Sink doesn't drain water. Half an hour after calling front desk for locking the minibar (as we have a small kid), nobody showed up. When we called again, they said it was already done! Unbelievable. Constantly loud noise from airplanes. And when we looked at the in-room breakfast menu, someone already checked items for us! Apparently they didn't bother to check and replace it. This is a bad spot on our otherwise wonderful holiday vacation. Don't book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack90291
Reviews.Content: I was here on business. The room was fine. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “NO HOT WATER, INTERNET BROKEN, WACKY A/C”
Reviews.Author: zeroone1
Reviews.Content: I am not one of those hotel guests that ever complains about a hotel, and I stay in about 30 nights a year. However, I feel compelled to write about my recent stay at this hotel. I never had an unplesant experience at a hotel ever. It all started the day after I checked in. That morning I had NO hot water. None whatsoever, not even warm or room temperature water, just COLD water. I took a nice cold shower! Then I went to the front desk and I got moved to a new room on the 6th floor. I was staying in the Bay tower. Then the water in the new room was not working either.I was then moved AGAIN to a new room, finally to room 697. Finally I got working hot water. The mechanic said the entire wing of rooms on the 6th floor lost hot water due to the line going into most of the rooms. The first night during my stay I couldn't sleep at all, The A/C in the room kept turning off when the room temperature reached 65. It's hard for me to sleep in complete silence! I need the A/C to stay on! I never experienced a hotel's A/C system that doesn't let the customer keep the thing ON! The next day I had to call a mechanic, and he eventually performed some "super duper" A/C thermostat tricks and found a way to put the system to 60. and it stayed ON and cold, finally! Why this hotel doesn't let guests have this simple ability is beyond me. The fun doesn't stop here, the next night in my stay I couldn't get the internet to work on my computer. I called tech support. The mechanic had to come to my room and replace not just the cable cord, but the modem to! Who knows why, but after they replaced all of the defective equipment I finally got online. However this hotel is special! You get to choose 2 speeds! One is the regular speed at like $11, and other is an absurd price of $20 (high speed). I opted for the regular speed and took a chance. BIG MISTAKE! The speed has been the slowest speed of ANY hotel I have every stayed at! It was slow, almost like dialup internet access slow. It was probably like DSL or slower. It was sad. It was so sloooow I got so frustrated I turned my Android phone into a mobile hotspot, and guess what my Tmobile data speed was much faster than the hotel's internet speed, This hotel needs just to offer one speed, and get rid of their slow speed. However with all of the negative experiences I had at this place there were some positives to note: PLUSES: Room services, it was pretty tasty and I enjoyed the shrimp cocktail, and spicy buffalo wings. However, the chicken tenders tasted like cardboard, it was horrible. View: it's gorgeous. I felt so relaxed and peaceful here. And I enjoyed watching the christmas boat light parade as well. Room itself and bed: the bed was pretty comfy, and the room was appointed nice. I used the mini bar a lot, and thought it was convinient even though it is pricey. Anyways I am rating my stay only 2 stars because the negatives of my experience far outweighted the positives. I hope this hotel fixed their hot water issues, and also please fix your ridicolous internet speeds and only offer 1 speed. And let guests FULLY control their A/C. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: Marina Tower is the way to go, everything about this location is great with one one exception. I refuse to pay $14.95 for wireless access on principal alone. Location was clean, close to the airport, noise was not an issue. Rooms were spacious and well appointed. i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good basic hotel, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: andresace
Reviews.Content: Good location, at 10 minutes from the airport by walking. Comfortable and with a nice view. There is some limitations however to access this hotel by public system transportation, you must walk a good distance. Complimentary shuttle services are good reliable option. Showers lack of hot water at some hours during the morning. Also there is not free internet at the lobby, where most hotels do. The have a good green campaign which they also reward in beverages. The best option to stay next to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jasonpo
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was clean, the staff were accomodating and pleasant and the views were great. The noise from the Airport was a bit loud at times, but manageable. The parking fees and WIFI charges were a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton plus”
Reviews.Author: Aussies2011
Reviews.Content: The check in was lovely. Arriving by the airport shuttle was a fantastic surprise (we had not asked at the time of booking - while at the airport we seen the 'sheraton' labelled shuttle free YES) lovely. The hotel lobby was so nice and open and fresh. The lady at the desk was wonderful. Really polite, and offered tips on our stay - what we were doing and went out of her way to help us with our check in. When I asked about allergies and restaurants, this lady went out of her way to provide us with the most accurate answer possible. Further since we were on our anniversary, and booking in early (which was some 5 hours earlier due to an earlier flight than expected) this lady checked and re-checked to give us a lovely king bed room (not queen) :)- it was appreciated. The staff overall were fantastic - the layout of the hotel was lovely. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel by the airport with easy access to downtown”
Reviews.Author: willbw02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in dec. Upgraded to room 1223 as a platinum member. Marina suite which is large and clean. The view of the city across the marina is nice.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaTraveler56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and loved the property and location. Location close to everything. Property and rooms are pin neat. Staff is wonderful. Hard to find a bad thing about this property. You pay for parking so do not let that surprise you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Faconner
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, five minutes from the airport, with clean, large and comfortable rooms. The location is between the marinas and the bay with great views from every room. A group of three guys stayed there for the weekend that the America's Cup 45's were racing in San Diego bay. They were very accommodating and gave us a room on the eighth floor, overlooking the bay so we could watch the races from the balcony. There was plenty of room for the rollaway bed they provided free of charge. We had breakfast in the very nice restaurant down stairs, and while it was $20, the food and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the airport, great service”
Reviews.Author: shortstakk
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Bay Tower of this Sheraton over the week of Thanksgiving in 2011. The hotel is nice, has a lot of space, and is quiet. The rooms are basic but nice, including a couch and coffee table area to sit (Tip: The Bay Tower has larger rooms than those in the Marina Tower, which don't have the couch and extra space). The bathrooms need some updating: there's no fan and the sundries are generic. The views overlooking the marina are nice. The hotel is very close to the airport and is convenient for that reason. The service at the hotel was great. Anything we needed they brought immediately and were very accomodating. They unfortunately do not have cribs available if you're travelling with an infant, as we were, but that's a specific need. Overall, not a luxury hotel, but an affordable and decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lost and Found”
Reviews.Author: shidan a
Reviews.Content: I left the hotel in a hurry and forgot to empty of the drawers. So I called the hotel and they connected me to the Lost and Found department. Nicolas who works in that department was very pleasant and helpful and arranged for my stuff to be delivered to my home 2 days later. I had to pay for the delivery but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Place You Want To Be When In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ryvyrwynd
Reviews.Content: Awesome locale on the marina located literally across from the airport and the Oil Lamp District and Old Town within sight. Beautiful, balmy weather for a stroll along the marina. Rooms are top-notch and excellently maintained by a professional and engaging staff. Wonderful amenities such as the excercise room and pool, club lounges, and superb restaurant. Outstanding conference rooms available with a well-trained and equipped staff to help make for successful conferences. Though close to the airport with hotel shuttles available, be sure to rent a car and visit the many wonderful sights that San Diego and outlying areas have to offer. The Oil Lamp Disrict. Old Town, Sea World, San Diego Zoo & Wildlife Park, the Birch Aquarium at Scripps, and more!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monaco-Keller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina twice this year and we loved it both times. The hotel is wonderful. The people are great. The pool, rest., Starbucks, room service, view and price are great. Easy access to the San Diego Airport and close to the freeways and Little Italy and downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Business or Pleasure it IS a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Jaime A
Reviews.Content: Very Clean, Great Housekeeping and Bell Staff, Nice Club Lounge

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexandChristine
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a club room for 4 nights before catching a cruise home to Australia. I was very pleasantly surprised after reading various reviews. Views were superb and the hotel is angled so that great views of both the bay and the marina are available from various places on each floor. Good phot ops. Staff were very cooperative. I booked through expedia so got free internet and club access but we had trouble getting our key to access the club floor from the lift. It was all sorted out with the utmost courtesy. Room was clean, well equipped etc. No wifi in the rooms. Internet was wired which was a bother for my friend and her ipad. I'd certainly recommend paying for the club level. Breakfast was good and the evening crudites, dips, cheeses and hot dish meant we could have a big lunch and not pay for an evening meal. If you factor this in, the US$30 a day for valet parking is worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to mix business and pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: Having lived in San Diego for years before I moved to Chicago, I know this hotel very well. Traveling on business, I have stayed here a few times over the past years, and never once been disappointed. It is an excellent place for a business meeting or conference, and located so very well to jump in a car or a cab and go out for dinner and a relaxing evening with family once the meetings are done! Superb service makes it such a joy, and you don't have to worry about doing good business while staying at this hotel, and also having your family very happy to be along, too!

Reviews.Title: “Got married here, they gave us a free room, called it a "suite"”
Reviews.Author: garek007
Reviews.Content: So there is nothing really WRONG with the individual pieces of this hotel at a glance.... The premises are nice, the rooms are clean, it's close to the airport. BUT, when you start adding it all up and looking at it as a total package, that's when the criticism comes in... I married my wife here in August 2011. Overall, I was very happy with their wedding packages. For only 105$ per person we got a great buffet dinner, 4 HOURS OF OPEN BAR (yay!) and someone who somewhat was a wedding coordinator. I really have no complaints about the wedding stuff. Everything went great, the staff were very helpfule with the setup. The only thing is that some stuff went missing, but that could have been our guests for all I know. Or an honest mistake, and could have gotten thrown away. The room they threw in was really two adjoining rooms and they just opened the door. Hardly a suite by any definition. They were nice rooms, but not a suite. If you get married here, make sure to dicuss that. The nice thing is that we ended up with a view of the bay. Either side of the hotel is not bad, pretty much all the views are good. Also, they charge for parking. If you are the bride and groom, you can get comped, but they will charge all of your guests, and parking is not cheap. If you get married here, they have some pretty good opportunities for photos. We took ours with the San Diego skyline in the background. If you are NOT getting married here then this hotel is ok if you are on business and have a car. Like I said, rooms are clean, etc, but there is not a coffee shop nearby, or a breakfast place, and room service is expensive. If you are in SD to have a good time, I'd suggest staying in Little Italy or the Gaslamp. The Gaslamp will be noisier, but is closer to fun bars/clubs. Little Italy is also fun, but a bit quieter, better for a family. This hotel is 3-5 miles from the Gaslamp and harbor tours, not great if you are here trying to see stuff. But if your goal is to be close to the airport, and you have no desire to leave the room, this hotel might be right for you. Even though room service is expensive, they have alternate options for dining close by. There are some restaurants on harbor island that are withing half mile to a mile away. Email me with questions, I know lots about this stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay At The Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: bambam62
Reviews.Content: Super nice staff. Check in & out was easy. Van serviced to and from airport was prompt. The room was spacious and well appointed. Nice amenities in the bath. And the view of the harbor was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Linda J
Reviews.Content: My father's and my experience with your hotel was Fantastic! We were in town for the Americas Cup World Series for 2 nights. The Service was excellent! The bed's were luxurious, we had such a good night sleep it was as if we were in our own beds. Everyone friendly. All over experience EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this property was excellent. The check in process went smoothly and the staff was very friendly. The rooms at the Marina property are rather small but are very comfortable. Never saw the maids but rooms were cleaned efficiently daily on our 4 night stay. Restaurants were a bit pricey but the food was very good. The property has excellent views of the marina and property is located to downtown. Great Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit!”
Reviews.Author: CsmithLaSalle_Canada
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great customer service. Lots of comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Carol J
Reviews.Content: LOVED the Sheraton San Diego! Each room had a small balcony with two chairs and a table. Mine overlooked a marina and San Diego Bay! WONDERFUL! All the accommodations were great. Food was good, staff excellent. The conference rooms were neither too hot or too cold (first time ever in my experience) but were "just right". The doors to individual rooms did not SLAM every time someone came or went (but closed well) as in most places, and the curtains truly did keep out the light and the noise. I'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for business traveller”
Reviews.Author: charic77
Reviews.Content: It's simple - I travel in from the east coast for business on Sunday night, arriving at 10 p.m., take the shuttle to the hotel, in bed 45 minutes after landing. The next morning, Hertz, Avis and National are a quick walk from Marina Tower to pick up the rental car and drop off at the end of the trip (night before the flight to avoid the return hassle). It is in a great location to access Old Town, Downtown San Diego, north to the beaches, and the views are incredible. I have stayed in most of the Starwood properties in the region and for a business traveller, this is a most convenient location. The fitness facility has state of the art equipment, for me, an important part of business travel. I have even rented bikes when I have some down time, ridden downtown to the Broadway Pier and taken the ferry over to Coronado for a nice afternoon ride. All in all it has been a nice "base" when I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, inconvenient location.”
Reviews.Author: featherfan72
Reviews.Content: I will definitely remember the gorgeous view of the marina at night, sunrise, all day long. The free shuttle to the airport is great, and from there, you can catch the $5 all-day bus that goes all over the city. Being close to the airport is important, because this place is not close to ANYTHING else. Plan to bus or taxi everywhere unless you have a car. The taxis are not cheap in SD, and public transportation is slow and circuitous. There are several hotel restaurants, with about the same food in all. We thought the place was rather pricey for being so isolated, but this is an expensive town.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not worth the price, and certainly not for leisure travelers”
Reviews.Author: Ka S
Reviews.Content: Look, this place is nice, and the staff for the MOST part is friendly, HOWEVER, if you are not staying here for business, i recomend you do NOT stay Here. The biggest problem i had/AM HAVING, is PARKING. Okay, so in san diego, you can expect to pay for parking almost everywhere, including hotels with high rates like this place; im not going to hold that against them. What i WILL hold against them, is that on the third night i was here (today actually) we left to go to Sea World and to sight see, and came back exhausted, only to find out the side of the parking lot that we had been parking, at (WHICH WE HAD TO PAY FOR MIND YOU)was closed for some highly irritating event. we ended up having to park on the other side furthest from our room, and while the walk was not too horrible, it was not short either, and add to that being exhausted, and having to park in a crappy place after paying a fairly high amount for parking ($22 PER night), i was NOT happy. But what ensures that i will NOT stay here again, is that NOBODY SAID OR POSTED ANYTHING...ANYTHING about this event, and about that portion of the parking lot being closed. And if they did it must have been like a few minutes before the event. Certainly not the night before, not on their website, and no one at the front dest brought it to our attention, at any point. Had we been informed we would have at LEAST been ready to walk a bit and plan accordingly on our sightseeing trip. Add to that the parking staff outside taking an attitude of hostility to us when we inquired as to why we could not park where we had been, and why nothing had been posted about it. Very rude. We did not as a result bother going out to eat, out of worrying about dealing with parking...great way to end a trip. Im not a person who generally holds hotels to unreasonable standards, but for the price paid, and the parking that i paid for (even if just self parking), i think i should have been informed somehow that parking would be a mess on my last night, so i could have planned accordingly and i dont think i should have had to have delt with snotty rude parking attendants. When the manager was approached about the parking situation, he told me quite clearly that parking PARKING SPACES ARE NOT GUARANTEED...but said he THOUGHT there should'nt be a problem. I honestly think it is unprofessional for a hotel to not know its own capacity, or amount of people coming to an event. The manager did offer to valet the car free of charge, bit it still put a cramp on our trip All in all the place is NOT worth the price paid...they charge for virtually everything, and paying for self parking does in no way (unless you pay more for valet) guarantee a spot...something that was not made clear at booking. If you are here for leisure they will not care about your experience. Their special events clearly are more important than the experience for an individual average joe guest; i dont hold it against them; they are a business and big events make them money, but just be aware of this. For the price, unless you are here on Business i would not recomend staying here. The location IS good (if you have a car) but again parking isn't guaranteed even though they do charge you. Check-in staff are very friendly and helpful but the parking staff is hit and miss. The main reason i cant recommend this hotel, is because its lack of consideration of guests who pay for parking, by failing to inform them clearly of events that may cause issues leaving or arriving

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for MCRD graduation”
Reviews.Author: kimmykiddo
Reviews.Content: My son graduated from the Marine Corps on Novemeber the 4th. I scoured the internet looking for the best deal for the whole family to be able to go. I was concerned when after much comaprison shopping I booked a flight and stay at this hotel with savings of over 1,100 for our party! (What was I going to get?). When we landed I saw our hotel. It is very near the airport and also very close to the reason for our trip Marine Corps Recruit Depot. We stayed in the bay tower portion of the hotel. The lobby was clean and desk help was exceptional! They informed us that the package we booked included breakfast all the days of our stay as well as a free shuttle to and from MCRD This by itself was a fantastic bonus! We asked for a higher floor and rather than bay view, we chose the marina view. Decorated in a nautical theme; the rooms were very clean, the beds comfortable, had an amply stocked mini bar and a large balcony to enjoy San Diegos beautiful weather and watch all the boats sail. The hotel was close enough to either take a taxi to Old Town for some sight seeing (which we really enjoyed)..or rent a car..which we also did..and took the short drive over to Coronado Island had some fantastic pizza, a little shopping and played on the beach. After graduation my son was never so happy to see a soft bed or hot tub in in his life! We really enjoyed the nice pool facilities. In short our trip was great . We got a great price on a clean comfortable room in San Diego near everything we needed to do and wanted to see!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, OK location”
Reviews.Author: poohbearlives
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Halloween weekend in order to visit friends and check out the Gaslamp District nightlife. The hotel was nice- room was clean, roomy, comfortable. We used Priceline and only paid $85 for a Saturday night so we think we got a fabulous deal. We even had a little balcony with a view of the harbor. The only thing people should be wary of, is this hotel is very close to the airport but about a 4-mile walk to the Gaslamp Dist. so if you want to dress up and go downtown, you need to take a cab- it cost us about $11 plus tip.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is, an expense account hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: EsoxL
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego for a conference which was held at the Sheraton. It is a large, sprawling hotel (> 1,000 rooms) with a couple of towers and a sprawling ‘resort’ wing called Lanai . There is also a second tower (350 rooms) which is about a 10 minute walk along the marina from the main hotel. We were put in the ‘Lanai’, a wing that if you squint your eyes a little you would think is a Mexican Resort Hotel complete with aqua painted pools, palm trees and outdoor type ‘hall ways’. The main difference from Mexican resorts are the hot tubs associated with each pool and reliable hot water in the rooms. Our room was nice enough, it had been tastefully updated in the last several years so everything, except the bathtub, which hotels seem reluctant to update, was new. The tub was a little worn and corroded around the drain. The marble sink counter was also stained, a problem I have seen in other hotels with marble counter tops. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet except when the folks upstairs were moving around. In the tradition of expense account hotels things like WiFi and internet ($20/day) and parking ($30/day) cost extra not to mention the exorbitant cost of the contents of the mini bar, the restocking fees of the minibar and the fact that you can’t use the minibar fridge for your own stuff. In addition the restaurant/breakfast buffet were expensive for what you got. That said the service was great, check in was fast, there is a shuttle that runs every ten minutes from the airport. If you are just flying in and out to a conference and you are on an expense account it is a great place to be. If you want to see the city, which is definitely worth seeing, then this hotel is definitely a bit out of the way, about a $15- 20 taxi ride. Public transportation in the vicinity of the hotel is negligible. The waterfront tourist attractions are about 3 miles away but there is a nice wide promenade type sidewalk between Harbour Drive, a main thorough fare, and the water if you are up to walking. So it wasn’t a great location for a spouse along for the trip as was our case. The hotel also seems to be a bit of a staging place for folks who are going and coming from cruise ships. Probably it works well for them. I will definitely return to San Diego with my wife but next time I will stay on one of the many downtown hotels where we can really enjoy what this fine city has to offer visitors.

Reviews.Title: “This really should say : SHERATON AIRPORT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: linbay
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a family vacation resort, this is NOT for you. You have to drive through the airport to get to this hotel, which is IMMEDIATELY adjacent to the airport. We made the mistake of not carefully studying the map before booking this hotel. With that said, we got a Marina suite, which is very spacious, comes with 2 large flat screen TVs, 2 closets, but the bathroom was EXTREMELY small. We have 2 balconies that faces the harbor, and the view is breathtaking. Nothing is walking distance from the hotel, so you would have to drive or take a shuttle. The upgrade to club access is well worth it since they do serve breakfast and afternoon snacks. You do hear planes flying above as they takeoff and land, but it's not overwhelmingly disturbing. The sleep quality is poor. It's the type of mattress where as soon as you get on or off, you can hear the springs compress or decompress. Overall, although this hotel is "cheaper" than the other Starwood hotels nearby, considering it's close proximity to the airport and what you are getting, staying at the W, Westin, or US Grant will get you more bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Close access to the airport”
Reviews.Author: sparkles89
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is rather nice. The only bummer is location for tourists. To use public transport you first get the hotels shuttle to the airport and then transfer to the local bus which can be time consuming.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, tiny and smelly pillows”
Reviews.Author: Chi-townAngie
Reviews.Content: This may be the straw that breaks my SPG habit, or at least, it will be the last of my Sheraton stays in the US. Have enjoyed great stays in S America and other places, but this tired and somewhat dumpy hotel doesn't deserve to be a category 3 much less a category 4. Have a tiny room, the pillows smell like they've been stuck up someone's armpit, and a view overlooks the parking lot. No wireless in the room (Club room). But, at least, I'm not getting calls and voicemails every couple of hours to buy into a timeshare, so this is an improvement over my end of the year Orlando stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: tina K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, if you want to relax, it's quiet, the marina is beautiful, and the best thing if you want to explore San Diego's attractions, everything is within walking distance. We took the boat cruise for see lions watching and it was really nice! One beautiful beach is 5 min from the hotel, but you can enjoy at the pool if you don't feel to go anywhere. The staff is friendly and helpful. We will stay again for sure here.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of hidden gems - great meeting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveler_0007
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the last two years and though I'm usually not a huge Sheraton fan I really like this property a lot. Both times I was there for conventions and as others note the hotel is across the road from the airport and a ways from downtown. Since my partner and I walk this wasn't a huge issue. We simply walked the couple of miles downtown, a lovely walk, and took taxis to Balboa Park and Old Town. Within walking distance of the hotel are two restaurants, C-Level and Island Prime, that are consistent winners for us. On to the hotel. Check-in was a breeze. We arrived almost two hours early and just walked into a room, very nice. The property includes a few different buildings and I think may include some longer term and time share units in places. The Marina Tower is in the main part of the hotel. The Bay Tower is a bit of a stroll across the marina. We've only stayed in the Marina Tower and have been glad we did given its proximity to the restaurant, etc. We've eaten at the restaurant, service was good and food just ok. Quinn's, the on site tavern and eatery seems to have better food and has a decent selection of draft beers and nice ambiance (overlooks the marina and pool, or you can watch sports on any of a number of tvs). There are 3 tennis courts that we used every day and in two visits I don't think I've ever seen anyone else use them. Good condition, decent courts. There are two swimming pools and two hot tubs. We tended to like the smaller hot tub near the tennis courts. Unfortunately both the pools and hot tubs close at 10pm. The first time we stayed here, just over a year ago, that closing time was strictly enforced so even though we were a quiet couple in our 50's just relaxing we got chased. This time when 10pm and the guards rolled around we were sharing the hot tub with a pretty rowdy group of Canadians who successfully lobbied for one more 15 minute round in the tub. I thought it was an improvement for the guards to give folks a break. Re the rooms, they're very comfortable, not new but not run down either. The bathroom was nice though we had an issue with the bathroom sink draining slowly. We reported it and it was fixed immediately - then we were given a $50 "experience adjustment" credit for our trouble. We used it at the gift shop. Frankly I attribute that to the power of media like TripAdvisor - to avoid a bad review, and sure enough here I am recommending the hotel rather than whining about a slow sink. A couple other gems here - there are two fire pits by the marina that are just plain cool, and rocking chairs suitable for just relaxing by the fire. This property has lots of spaces for couples to just drift hand in hand. The grounds are well maintained and it's an expansive property. We took cabs to Balboa Park and Old Town, about $15 each way each time, and walked downtown. Other friends at the same convention also walked downtown - though all of us are walkers, we're also all in our 50's and 60's so don't be too afraid to take it on. Leaving - nothing is easier. Free airport shuttle. Oh re the meeting rooms, etc., standard hotel issue. With the exception of the main banquet the food was unremarkable, however, at our main lunch banquet everything was a notch above usual conference food (a wonderful tomato cream soup served hot for example). When you're traveling with the love of your life it's easy to find things to enjoy, and with the combination of this hotel and San Diego we had a wealth of wonders to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “A Joy”
Reviews.Author: Stuart W
Reviews.Content: The SHERATON SAN DIEGO HOTEL & MARINA was the venue for a recent conference that colleagues and i attended. This hotel was first rate in all aspects and the staff were attentive and helpful at all times. The catering was superb and the bar had a lively and comfortable atmosphere, one of the best! If you want a trouble free enjoyable stay then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Box23
Reviews.Content: They try, I suspect, to be more or less professional. The service is spotty at best. Room keys fail daily. Hallway continuously scattered with dishes that stay for days. In room coffee is good. Food, which is good but not great, would be a good deal at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “You're in the Ourskirts Conventioner; Deal With It”
Reviews.Author: RoiSamuse
Reviews.Content: You are going to the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina only because your company sent you there for a convention or meeting. You arrive and discover it's a friendly place with great accomodations and you are near the aiport. How convenient. But you are dismayed to learn you are away from the action of lovely San Diego and restricted, for meals, to the hotel's two restaurants -- a pub that is reasonably priced but cacaphonous and crowded and a luxurious but overpriced restaurant. You would like to see the sights of Dan Diego but you dont want to rent a car because your down time is restricted to evenings and periods when you are not in convention sessions. Here's how we dealt with it. 1. We requested the pub menu in the restaurant, so we got less expensive meals in refined surroundings. 2. If you are willing to stroll, you can go to three other resturants at the marina. We recommend the closest one, Island Prime, particularly its less expensive wing, Level C, It has a great view of the skyline and the service is friendly. They have a good wine tasting option and the Mud Pie ice cream is to die for (and big enough for six people). 3. Downtown San Diego is a $15 cab ride away including generous tip. But the best option is the inexpensive one. Take the Sheraton Shuttle to the airport and ask the driver to leave you at the MTS bus stop. The 923 bus goes to downtown San Diego ($2.25 per ride, $1.10 for seniors over 60). Once downtown you are in the Gaslight District and you can connect to other buses, including ones we took to Coronado and Balboa Park. 4. We loved Balboa Park. You can spend a whole day there at the zoo and museums. If you want to stretch your legs there are trails alongside. The whole experience is better than Epcot in our opinion. (For lunch try the Japanese Garden restaurant. Teryaki meat, fish and vegeratian over rice are yummy. $11 each with drinks) 5. The Gaslight District has terrific restaurants. A local shopkeeper recommended "La Strada" 702 5th Street and we had a great meal. The linguini with clams was fabulous. 6. Take the 201 bus from downtown to Coronado and stroll around the Del Coronado Hotel, a national landmark.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Shoreline Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelgal
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I stayed at this hotel over July 4th. It is just a few minutes from the San Diego Airport, but not in direct line with the runways, so there was no jet noise. It is also right on the water, and with a room facing the water, we had a fantastic view of the fireworks that night. It had easy access and was convenient for driving to other areas of San Diego. I especially liked the way the room was set up. The bed FACED the windows instead of being sideways to the windows like in most hotels, so you could sit in bed at night and look at the lights. The room was spotless as was the rest of the property, and the landscaping surrounding the hotel was very nice. If I remember correctly, there was also a sidewalk between the hotel and water that you could walk around the marina on. Depending on when you stay, and if you have AAA or some other discount plan, you can get a reasonable price for this hotel. At other times, the price can be double. We are going on a cruise in December and I was anxious to book this hotel again for our pre-cruise stay. However, there is a convention going on that week and when I first checked it out, the price had skyrocketed. The second time I checked, there were no rooms available. The only reason I am giving this hotel 4 stars instead of 5 is because it is not within walking distance to restaurants, and the hotel restaurant is pricey, as expected. We did go ahead and eat breakfast at the restaurant which was excellent, but again, it was not a "breakfast included" type of hotel and the cost for breakfast was about $15 per person, I think. But as I said, I did love this hotel and would stay there again. And for those who aren't budget minded, this is definitely a hotel you will love.

Reviews.Title: “tired hotel next to airport”
Reviews.Author: KansasJayhawk1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights at the Sheraton while attending a conference. After a 60 second drive from the airport (yes, it is that close!), we checked into our room on the 9th floor. The lobby of the hotel was nice, although very busy with people attending a variety different conferences. The hallway to our room was scattered with leftover room service items. Our room was small, which was fine. The bathroom was recently redone. It sadly had no place to hang towels so when finished with them, we just set them on the floor. The shower curtain smelled like mildew. All the rooms have small balconies with a view of the water or downtown but if you open the balcony door you are bombarded with sound of jets landing and taking off. The outside of the property was nice, with several pools and a walking path. All in all, it is a very average convention hotel next to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but nothing to write home about.”
Reviews.Author: aimzblingz
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we discovered we were in the Bay Tower, not the Maruna Tower. We had no idea they were two separate locations and didn't discover it until bags were out of the car and lugged quite aways, after a 6 hour drive. The lady that checked us in was very nonchalant about it... We could take a 5minute walk, bags in tow or drag them back to the car and drive.FRUSTRATING! Our room was nicely decorated, beds were wonderful, all our contacts with employees was great! Our room could have been cleaner and they definitely should have changed the shower curtain (even the slightest bit of mold freaks me out). Overall a good stay, but I expect a spotless room for the amount we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Glenn S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and found everything thing to be very nice. Easy shuttle pick-up/drop-off at airport, very friendly staff, clean room with a great view of the harbor. I have stayed here in the past for both business and quick San Diego weekend getaways and have never been disappointed. Will definately stay here again, especially when chartering a boat as it is a short 3 minute walk to the docks.

Reviews.Title: “Too many extra costs”
Reviews.Author: Bronson W
Reviews.Content: I will try to be objective and review this hotel fairly, though I was quite annoyed at how much this hotel tries to rob you at every opportunity. The check-in staff were polite. We were informed on check-in of a $30 a night parking fee (our stay was 4 nights), and when I inquired about how to access in-room internet they told me it was $19 a night for high speed internet. High speed internet was crap, it was less than a quarter of the speed of the internet I got at the Trump in Las Vegas. We were given two vouchers for complimentary breakfast for our stay, for which we were very grateful, though once we were seated in the restaurant and given menus we weren't quite sure what we were allowed to choose from. This was soon cleared up when someone came and took the menus back and said that we could only eat from the buffet. After eating the 'buffet' once, we decided not to use the second voucher. The room also has a fridge, but only for the rip off minibar, you weren't allowed to use it. Not only did it quote exorbitant prices on the mini bar it also had a RESTOCKING fee in the fine print. How does get buggered sound? I'm not going to pay $5 for a small drink and then pay you 20% extra just to restock it. The room itself was reasonable and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was a bit grubby though In all honesty I probably wouldn't have paid attention to this things had the hotel not been charging me extras at every opportunity, I found myself picking on things in the room just because they were being cheap. What sort of hotel doesn't have complementary in room internet these days??? Given that the last day of our USA trip was to be spent at this hotel before we drove to LAX, we decided that with the $30 parking fee and $19 internet per day in our room we'd be better off just finding a cheap room in Anaheim on our last nights stay so we were closer to the airport on the last day. We checked out early even though we had already paid for the room for the night and spend what we saved on ridiculous fees on a room in Anaheim.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating, clean, right on harbor.”
Reviews.Author: yup_1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here a couple of times during a business convention I had. Great location on the harbor. Both times, we got a room in the bay tower, harbor side, high floor. These rooms are equipped with balconies that overlook the harbor and the air force base. The sound of the helicopters didn't bother me at all during the day, but I did hear some people complaining about it. I found it very interesting to watch their training everyday. Nice rooms and very clean. Some need updating but clean nonetheless. Grounds are easy to get around on and there are little cafe's and bars and breakfast places within and around the hotel. The staff is very accommodating and prompt with special requests. Just a great place in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fiona M
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, we were in the Bay Tower which we were quite grateful for as there was a big conference on in the main hotel. If you want to be in the city centre, this hotel isn't for you, but if you want nice service, and lovely rooms with a fantastic view I highly recommend this hotel. My only criticism is the lack of a laundry in the Bay Tower, we were told the laundry is on floor 5 of the Marina Tower, the Sheraton info booklet does not state this it all, and we were looking everywhere in our tower for the laundry which is the only reason this hotel did not get 5 stars from us.

Reviews.Title: “****BAY VIEW TO DIE FOR****”
Reviews.Author: dceastin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days over Labor Day weekend to attend a wedding. What a beautiful view, area and hotel. Wonderful walking area or we could just sit in our room and watch the boats, ships and life go by. We will definitely be back. It was so easy to just fly in, free shuttle to hotel, and everything you need is soooo close.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: FunintheOCsun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference. My options were to stay in the main hotel where the convention center is, or stay in the tower. Knowing that I would be sitting all day at conferences, I chose the tower which is a block away. I was very happy with my choice. The rooms are updated, modern, and clean. The staff, from the bellboys to the front desk, are friendly and helpful. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better options”
Reviews.Author: meresauter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Sheraton on the last night of our trip to San Diego, before flying out the next morning. During the previous four nights of our trip we stayed in a WONDERFUL hotel right in downtown San Diego. The price of this Sheraton vs. the downtown hotel were virtually the same, so I expected the same quality hotel & experience. Boy, was I wrong. First of all, the Sheraton is out on Harbor Island, a strip of land that is apparently still being deveoped for tourists and doesn't contain much of anything except for a few hotels. We were dropped off at the hotel by a cab driver around 5PM and literally felt STRANDED for the rest of the evening. There are two restaurants inside the Sheraton, both of which are offensively overpriced. We left the hotel in search of food, and after walking over a mile, found a gas station-like store that sold prepackaged sandwiches. We trudged back to the hotel and reluctantly went to the cheaper of the two restaurants inside. We both ordered $16 hamburgers. That would be $16 each. The food was average at best and the service was neglectful at best. Definitely a frustrating venture. Secondly, I'm still confused about this hotel and what part of it we stayed in. The main entrance of the hotel is beuatiful and plush looking. When we checked in, we were instructed to follow a long hallway to the right. At the end of this hallway we stepped into an elevator foyer that looked completely different from the main part of the hotel. The carpet and wallpaper were old and discolored. It was like we all of a sudden were transported to an old motel. Once we reached our floor, it still felt like a motel, not a "nice" hotel - the hallway smelled stale, and there were several room service food trays laying throughout the hallway. Without even entering our room yet, I felt ripped off. I was immediately wishing we had just booked another night at our downtown hotel that was GORGEOUS and equally priced. Along the same lines of this confusing split-personality of the hotel - there are two pools outside. One is luxurious and updated. The other, right next to it, is older and smaller. Our hotel key would not allow access to the nicer pool. We were apparently relegated as "second-class" and were only allowed key access to the smaller pool. This was all VERY confusing and practically embarassing. There were no signs of explanation as to the difference between the two pools that were RIGHT next to each other. I will say that the room itself at the Sheraton was very lovely. It actually felt updated, clean, and new. I loved the color-scheme. Because there was NOTHING to do on Harbor Island, we just got in bed early and watched t.v. for the rest of the night. Overall, I would NOT recommend this hotel if you are in San Diego for more than just a layover. If you do not have a car, cab rides to and from downtown are about $14 each way. Although that is cheaper than a hamburger on Harbor Island, it is not worth the price just to get far enough away from the hotel to find something to do. There are PLENTY of hotels in downtown San Diego that are the exact same price and are INCREDIBLY nicer. Bottom line, this Sheraton isn't terrible, but you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “great time in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: R0D0
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in San Diego, the Sheraton was good, we had a beautiful view of the bay, watched the ships and boats go buy. The food was good. Its is out of the way to get to Gas Lamp Quarters and the Sea Port villlage, wouldn't stay there for that reason only, its a $20 cab ride each way. They need a shuttle, and that would be great. We did the green way at the hotel which gave you $5.00 per day back in a coupon, we used that at the resturants, or store. All in all it was great but the need a shuttle to the convention centre.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport but not close to anything else”
Reviews.Author: Kinezo23
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel that is conveniently close to the airport. They even provide free shuttles that leaves pretty much every 15mins. I stayed at the Bay Tower overlooking the bay. It was fun to see the aircraft carriers and military aircrafts on Coronado island. The noise is not too bad. Rooms are fairly modern and spacious. The main Marina tower is good with a full Starbucks. Service was fast and efficient with Taxis always available. The gym and pool was in good shape. The Bay Tower seems dated and more cozy compared to the Marina tower. The hotel is good for a quick stay in San Diego but if you're staying more than 3-4 nights I would suggest you stay downtown as there are more things to see and do. They should look into a shuttle service for quick downtown trips.

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise hotel....near airport, but not much nearby.”
Reviews.Author: stonewithnomoss
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a lovely place to relax for a DAY in San Diego with immediate airport access, you cannot beat this hotel. It is not cheap, but if you are on business or booked at in conjunction with a cruise or something else, it is worth the money. However.... besides the lovely location and the beautiful walk along the harbor, there is really NOTHING out here and it's a cab ride to any other interesting parts of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: calalb
Reviews.Content: 6$ cab ride or free shuttle to airport. Hotel is redone and nice. I was there for conference but saw children and families, navy personnel, weddings, functions and a whole mixture. Nice pool and great fitness facilities. 15$ cab ride to Horton Plaza or Gaslamp area. Conference facilities good. And the staff ... very good in comparison to other Sheraton's this one's a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean, Comfortable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NicknAZ49
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very comfortable, airy rooms that were perfect on our recent visit to San Diego. Although near the airport and harbor, there was little noise and night and a staff willing to assist. The staff was helpful in getting around in the city and directed us to our destinations. In particular Mark, bell captain, acted as concierge and offered some great insight about his city and we were most grateful. He also made suggestions and reservations at Island Prime for our anniversary dinner. The meal and service there was excellent. We thank him for his courtesy. There were two problems that came up during our stay, They charge $22 per day for self parking that never seemed to work correctly and $18 per day for wired in internet. Since there was no wi-fi, we ended up at Starbucks to go on the net for emails and directions to some of our destinations. We think Sheraton should look into in room wi-fi right away. The parking problem was a due to card reader issue with the room keys. Management was working on the problem and it worked once for us but the bug returned. We would highly recommend a stay there because of the quality of the property, location and convenience to get around. We would definitely return there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great meeting experience”
Reviews.Author: ingcus
Reviews.Content: I was an attendee at a meeting at the hotel last week and had a great experience. I have stayed at other Starwood products in San Diego previously but never this Sheraton. I thought the Banquet staff were both warm and attentive. All of our needs were met and exceeded in a way most hotels do not. The hotel planned a boat outing for us one evening that all of our attendees greatly enjoyed. My guest room had a small balcony that overlooked the marina, and I enjoyed the view and weather very much. Hotel has all the typical Sheraton amenities like the Sweet Sleeper Bed and Link in the lobby that allowed our attendees to stay connected for free. Great experience for our group event.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hppygilmore
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious. The bathrooms are a little small but still nice. Just two small things I noticed when we got to our room. There was silverware outside our room and a little hair in the floor and the side of the bathtub. A little more attention to detail by housekeeping would take care of this. Love the balcony with table and chairs looking out over the water. Overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you stay in the main tower!”
Reviews.Author: YYCTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: This property has 2 towers about 5 blocks from each other. The Bay Tower has some nice ocean views but it appears to be their overflow hotel and too far from all the amenities of the main building. It looks like they put their guests who have booked discounted rates in this tower. The rooms are big with flat screen tv's, but the bathroom was filthy. Hair in the tub and toothpaste all over the wall. I booked this room through Priceline which includes it with the downtown hotels. It is not a downtown hotel. It is an airport hotel with about a 1 hour walk into the downtown. I walked it! The main property has a nice lobby with lots of free internet stations, a Starbucks, nice dining areas and a beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: shellergirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Harbor Island, on a small strip of land right across from the airport. It is beautifully decorated to feel like you are on a ship. VERY NAUTICAL! I was traveling alone on business and I felt very safe and comfortable. The rooms have balconies with views of the Navy vessels coming in and out of the harbor AND views of the boats docked in the harbor. The military helicopters are crusing around and you can't help but get the feeling that our country is being protected. You can feel the excitement and energy of San Diego and sleep in an amazing room. . .The bed, shower, coffee machines. . . It made me feel very special. . . .Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for plane watchers”
Reviews.Author: fsview11
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Priceline and was at first annoyed since its included in the downtown area but its all the way over by the airport. But turns out the views from the hotel are great, it looks like its been relatively recently renovated as well. Get a room on a higher floor, half the hotel faces the harbor with great views of Coronado Island and downtown as well as the airport. The other half faces the Marina. I'm a travel nerd so I like watching planes land and had a great view of the runway. Beware of parking since you have to at least pay the self parking rate of $22 there is no free parking around there. Also the rooms have wired internet not wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but can't walk to downtown”
Reviews.Author: CarteBlancWine
Reviews.Content: This hotel always offer great rates and if you are looking to stay near sea world and the bay its a good location. If you are looking to indulge in the nightlife of the gaslamp district you are better off at the W, Hard Rock or the US Grant hotel. This is primarily a tourist hotel for families or a good place to stay if you have a flight out the San Diego airport. The hotel is starting to show its age and is need for an update.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Elbert48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton due to a conference my wife and i wanted to attend. When registering we paid for a room on a higher floor that promised a view of the harbor and city. When we checked in we were told the rooms were being cleaned and they would call us in a couple of hours to check in. We went site seeing and came back SEVEN hours later, the check in was busy and finally got the bell captain to help us. We were informed they didn't have a upper floor room and we were placed on tthe "fourth" floor - which actually was the 2nd floor overlooking a beautiful gravel roof overhand! Complaints went unanswered until 3 days later when we were finally given a rate adjustment back to the convention rate. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Business stay, great surroundings, catering pretty good”
Reviews.Author: melsal22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days in mid-Sept. Hotel is on great running trails. Gym is very good. Rented a bike there, too. It wasn't in the greatest shape, but I was just cruising and had a great time because it was available cheaply ($7/hr). There were a couple of pools but it would have been better if at least one of them were set up so you could do laps. One is long enough but curvy, so you can't seriously swim straight across and back for an extended workout. They're just designed for splashing and lounging. Room was nice enough and comfortable. I liked that you could decline housekeeping service and get a $5 credit. Hotel has lots of enviro features, which I appreciated. The catered meals were very good. We ate breakfasts and lunches on a lawn outside the conference center, which was really nice. Watch out for heels sinking into the grass and slightly damp chairs in the morning, but I enjoyed it. The bar food was standard hotel fare. Only thing that raised my eyebrows is during a snack break, they served sports energy bars--as snacks! I scooped up a couple because I would only eat these on a 7-mile or longer run--they were packed with glucose/fructose/sucrose. Believe me, most people at the conference did not need to be eating athletic fuel bars as a snack between sedentary meeting sessions. Overall I really enjoyed my time there, and would consider going back for business, though probably not the family because there weren't a lot of restaurants close by and we try to do more economic eating when on longer stays with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “avoid marina view low numbered rooms”
Reviews.Author: cracklehillhogg
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms to be clean and well serviced, the food as reasonably priced as you would expect and the staff generally personable, but, reversing stacker trucks emptying vehicles and and trash at 5 am wasn't on. You know the sound beep beep beep, on and on... Check in staff asked what i wanted them to do about it! Stop it was appropriate, but they had the glazed expression of those whose neckties were stopping the blood flo to the brain. If you stay here don't take one of those rooms ( i was in 1000 on 10th floor). Check your bill on exit too, both me and a colleague had unaccounted items on the bill. ( it was a convention with a full house so perhaps they should be allowed leeway , but keep a check)

Reviews.Title: “Poor value and even poorer service”
Reviews.Author: shellih2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. Found out after I checked in that parking is $22 per day, added to the room; valet is $30. The main parking is quite far from the entrance - all side entrances are looked and you must walk all the way to the front to enter the hotel. Must use room key to enter and exit parking area. When checking in, your credit card is authorized $200 more than the cost of the room for "incidentals." No exceptions. Not told this in advance either. The hotel staff is less than helpful. Try asking for restaurant recommendations or what to do in San Diego. Better off asking for help from locals outside the hotel. My room, at a conference rate, was $169 per night. Not bad for San Diego, but what do you get? An armchair with a ottoman next to it, a small dresser, a huge with no drawer, two nightables, a small TV, and a very small bathroom. The closet is teeny tiny as well. And no free WI-FI - you have to pay an extra $12 bucks per day. At check in the desk clerk wanted to give me two queen size beds with a city view. Hello...my reservation was for a KING size. What do you know, one was available with a marina view. For that price, it darn well better be a marina view. Will I be back? No way.

Reviews.Title: “In every way, an awful place...”
Reviews.Author: LJJ58
Reviews.Content: I had one of my worst hotel experiences at this hotel. Lured by the mention of "billions of dollars in renovations, I expected -- for the money I spent per night, a luxury hotel experience. Let's start with the bathroom - very cramped and the "soaking tub" was a small plastic molded tub that only a child could bathe it. The light switches were put in very crooked. There was, I think, a hole in the wall that had a weird, hand cut plastic sheet over it. It was not enitrely clean and neither was the rest of the room. Weird bed layout had your bed FACING a huge mirror which mean you had not chocie but to see yourself everytime you glanced up from a book if reading in bed or when watching TV. I always test the honesty of hotel staff but leaving a dollar bill on the floor. In the hunderd times before that I had done this, the bill was always neatly placed on a piece of furniure. Not this time. Trash was not removed from my room, and it was very clear from debris on the rug that it wasn't vacuumed. The direct line to room service often did not work; they did not answer, and the front desk would say they would call me back, which they only did 50% of the time. The food was barely passable, and I stayed at a 4 Season in April that charged LESS for really amazing food with such gracious service. I approve of adding a percentage onto the bill automatically so wait staff can be properly tipped, but why was there also an additional $3 food delivery charge added on to the obligatory 16% tip? They advertise their link in service as being this great benefit, but what it means is you need to spend $18 a day for online service in your room or you lug your computer down to the lobby with the worn furniture to work. The ballyhooed TV wake up service did not work at all; thank God I set up a back up with my iPad of I would've missed meetings. I stay at different kinds of hotels -- a month before I stayed at a comfort inn near Olympia, WA, and had a MUCH better experience for MUCH less money. if you are looking for a quality experience, do NOT choose this hotel. They should be ashamed of allving this a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel, Service Lacking, Sticker Shock for Parking Fees”
Reviews.Author: soujourner1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline based on location trying to find a nice hotel close to downtown San Diego. The hotel property is quite nice and even though it is right across the street from the airport, the airport noise is not a factor. There is no free parking at this hotel, only valet or self parking and it is fairly steep per day ($22 for self parking when I stayed) which add up quickly. There are in and out privileges however. The hotel lobby is beautiful and check-in was smooth as they have several front desk clerks assisting visitors. The rooms are fairly nice, not upscale (not sure it is quite a 4 star hotel), but were clean and bright and had no funky smell like a lot of hotel rooms. The beds and pillows were wonderful and my friend and I kept wondering how we could buy some of those pillows! I did not appreciate the lack of follow through with the check-in staff. I originally booked 4 days through Priceline about a month before my trip. A few days later, I decided to add another day (which Priceline lets you do at the same bid price through checkin.) When I checked in at the hotel, they could not find my fifth night. The clerk said she would take care of it. Later that evening, I checked with the front desk and she still had not resolved the problem. The next day, still not resolved. By the 4th day, I had been told by numerous front desk clerks that the matter would be taken care of but it never was resolved by the hotel. I had to call Priceline several times and waste a lot of vacation time to resolve it myself. I can say that after check out, the desk clerk did credit some on my parking bill for the hassle, which was appreciated, but I would have preferred that when their desk staff says they will resolve a problem that they actually resolve it. Another minor irritation was housekeeping. Although housekeeping came every day and replaced the towels and made the beds, they did not actually clean the bathroom which I found odd. My friend who was traveling with me for a few days got her feet really dirty one day and when she took a shower, there were dirty footprints all over the tub. The next morning, they did not clean it. I had to clean it myself with a washcloth and shampoo before I could take a shower. The sink got pretty crusty after a few days and the mirror was also spotted and never cleaned. Also, there was one of 3 bathroom lights burned out when I checked in. I just presumed housekeeping hadn't been in that room for a few days and hadn't notice the light burned out and would change it during my stay. Never changed. I found this to be substandard for what claims to be a 4 star property. Otherwise pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Experience varies”
Reviews.Author: StevoA
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay, the reason why there are so many mixed reviews is when you get here, you think the hotel is only the one in the main picture; HOWEVER, there are really two hotels here, and your experience will vary greatly depending on which tower you are staying. The main one is clean, spacious, and staff is friendly, I can't speak for the other one, but just read some of the reviews and you'll get an idea. The tower I stayed in had great facilities, room was large and the best part was the views from the balcony, SPG status gets you the floor second to the top and free internet which is wired not wifi. Lounge is on the top floor and key card is needed, status gets you free breakfast, otherwise it's like $14, pretty basic, all continental mostly, cereal, fruit, muffins etc. no hot food. Getting down to the gaslamp cost exactly $13 from the hotel, it's not that bad, but there isn't really anything around, the Westin is a better choice if you want to stay downtown, it's probably a 5min walk to the gas lamp from there. Overall, I was very satisfied with the stay, facility was great, clean, quiet, and spacious, staff was friendly and attentive and the shuttle comes and goes very often, just remember, your stay depends on which tower you stay in, I believe mine was the marina tower and the iffy one is called the bayview tower. You should definitely ask where you'll be put before confirming.

Reviews.Title: “Next to airport- literally.”
Reviews.Author: MrsBarrie
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be a 3 star. The rooms, bed/linens/bathroom- everything are average. It felt like we were driving to the airport and bam -we were at our hotel. Yes we could see planes taking off out our window- so if you like planes this is perfect. I had to request a new room because our bedspread was stained and there was mold in the bathtub. Second room was a downgrade but at least it was clean and they gave us a breakfast voucher. Great bargain if you get it on priceline- but don't buy the rack rate. Overpromise, underdeliver. Btw- Coffee was stale in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Average but with Security Concerns”
Reviews.Author: SiteCer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on a business trip for a conference. The room was fine and, were I not working most of the time, I might have been able to enjoy the small balcony. The bed was not particularly comfortable and the use of a bottom flat sheet that slipped up from the end uncovering the scratchy mattress pad underneath made for poor sleep quality. The shower was OK - the water was hot but the water pressure was not great. The staff as part of the conference was very good and responsive. My biggest complaint is that I came back to my room one evening to find the door open. I decided to go in when I saw that a light was on but was certainly concerned about the possibility of an intruder. I called the front desk right away and they sent up a security guard. I checked and it did not seem as if anything was taken. The security guard took some data from the door lock and confirmed that the last key used was from housekeeping. I was just fortunate that my room was a bit further down the hall that a passer-by didn't take advantage of the door being left open. This is a huge concern for me and while the conference customer service was good and the room was OK, it is unlikely that I will stay at this property again unless I have to for business reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in most ways”
Reviews.Author: SurfTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Okay. This is what you'd expect. A large "resort" hotel not really within walking distance of anything. If you want to go anywhere, expect a cab ride or other means. So it's not too bad, but just not great. The good. It is in a very nice location, near the water (Mission Bay, which is NOT the ocean), and has great views of things like the naval base, the bay, Coronado Bridge, etc. (more on this in a bit). Great walking trails nearby, nice and quiet, decent hotel accomodations, etc. From that standpoint, it's great. And, it is REALLY close to the airport. Decent pools for the kids, and the usual amenities such as gym, Starbucks, etc. The bad. There's little nearby. You are going to travel anywhere, such as Gaslamp, downtown, La Jolla, Qualcomm, Padres, the beach, Corondado, you name it. Also, WHY MAKE ME PAY FOR INTERNET? When are hotels going to learn this is like making us pay for TV in the old days? It's not a sign of being progressive and hip, it's a sign of being out of touch! What's next, making me pay for local calls (cringe)? And, you are stuck most of the time in this hotel, at their mercy with restaurants. If that's okay with you, that's okay. Our room. Without doing anything (I think) to annoy the check-in staff, we got ABSOLUTELY the worst room in this place - room 5135 (don't agree to take this room!!). We didn't complain - were there on business and spent little time there (so management don't reply that we shouldn't have requested - we shouldn't have been put in such a dumpy room to begin with!!), but this was a crappy room. I happened to visit the room of other meeting attendees, including those without Sheraton Club membership, paid same amount, came in later, etc., and they mostly all had significantly better rooms in terms of views. And trust me, it matters at this hotel. Our room (again, 5135 - avoid it!) looked out on a parking lot and a green wall adjacent to tennis courts, while others looked out on the bay, airport landing jets, city skyline (imagine how all this looks at night?). It sucked. And, it smelled of mold - inspection of the air unit outside showed it all mildewed, etc. Not nice at all. The room interior was decent, not much to comment on from there (except the damn paying for internet). It seems to me that lousy rooms should be given out last, not early on during the day - a pet peeve of mine - why doesn't their computer system have some sort of ranking system and give out rooms in terms of some ranking system? Long story short, thanks Sheraton, and I'll certainly remember this room! I do commend them for deducting $5 / night for not having maid service. Great practice, and I hope it shows on the final bill. I like that. The sports bar on premise is pretty good, and food is okay although pricey and service is spotty (what did you expect given this was a self-contained resort hotel). The restaurant is same, except we found service there to be really poor (we complained, and to her credit, waitress took the blame for shoddy service, although she blamed it on a "large party of 40" which was there that night - at a hotel that seems to host large parties all the time, thank god there wasn't a party of 400 or we still might be there - and on a Sunday night with few other patrons. You figure for yourself on that one.). Restaurant food was pretty good, but prices were high for poor service. But what do you expect given a hotel with no competition within walking distance? Summary: Good hotel. Watch where they put you, which room. Enjoy the sports bar in moderation. The hotel restaurant is good but with poor service for us. Would I stay here again? If I want the big cookie-cutter experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rudolf51
Reviews.Content: San Diego Sheraton Marina Tower is situated on Habour Island. Amazing views of the bay and marina. Great location ! This is also a great location if you like to walk or run. The hotel is close to the airport, but you won't notice. The hotel was very clean and the staff was super friendly. Breakfast was one of the best we ever had. We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nautical & Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tamgerine
Reviews.Content: Thie hotel was very well-equipped with restaurants, spa services, and a great gift store. Beautiful walking areas all around the hotel, in the marina and bay area. My room had a nautical theme that was sweet. Bed was comfortable and cozy. Couldn't get WiFi working, but took it as a sign that work should be done for the day, as I had been up for almost 2 days on this trip! The air conditioning was on full blast and it couldn't be adjusted. When I called to inquire about it, they were quick to handle the situation, and brought me complimentary fruit tray as apology for the half hour intrusion. The service man was wonderful, friendly yet professional and very thoughtful. Great location for airport convenience, bad location for downtown convenience.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful view from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haihong H
Reviews.Content: The view from this hotel is very beautiful, food is not so good, but there are many nice restaurant nearby. Generally it worth staying .

Reviews.Title: “The "Step-Child" Effect”
Reviews.Author: B K
Reviews.Content: This was suppose to be an "Upgrade", WOW! what a dissapointment. The location is wonderful, the view spectacular . . . the room, staff & service, amemities and personnel, a disaster. One company, two hotels, one; newer, cleaner, the "A TEAM" staff, a place to sit and have a relaxing drink, a meal, whatever you liked to do. The other location, (the one we got) the "rejects" of staff, un-informed, non-communication experts. A gift shop that always seems closed, as well as a diningroom that closes "just because, there hasn't been that much business tonight". Really? To add to that; we had a toilet that continued running, non-stop. We called the front desk and asked to have it worked on. The reply was that "we'll send someone up in the morning, it's too late now; (it was 7pm). The next day I went to the front desk to ask about the running toilet situation. They we un-informed of any such situation. I asked that something be done while we were out for the entire day. We gave our cell phone numbers to them, (in case, they needed to move us to another room). During the day we recieved no calls. When we returned that evening, we opened our room the the sound of silence. However, the remedy for repairing the toilet was to simply turn off the water supply; no note, no calls, no nothing. I went downstairs to ask about the toilet, to which (of course) they knew nothing. I asked to be moved to another room, they made a new card for a room next door( never offering to assist with the move or even apoligizing for the trouble). As I stated before; great location, great view, terrible facility, it's definitly the "Step-Child" of this company. We'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Towers - one Great One not”
Reviews.Author: Barry S
Reviews.Content: Be carefull which tower they put you in -- they are about 1/2 mile apart -- one has every facility you could want --the one I stayed in the "Marina" was lacking in almost every regard. Good room and good location but that is it. No decent restaurant. No wi-fi in the rooms, no decent place to sit and get a drink. Gift shop is minimal and generally closed. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: TXTraveler512
Reviews.Content: I had selected this hotel because of the close to airport location and thought we might have a nice view. We were just returning from a cruise and wanted a day to sight see in San Diego. We were on the marina side so the view didn't turn out as well as I had hoped. The room was nice and we spent quite a bit more time in the hotel than anticipated because my husband was not feeling well. We had to walk quite a way to find something to eat and ended up at what was really a coffee shop. Overall, I thought it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan0121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a mini getaway and it was wonderful. Excelent customer service, great location and the pools, grounds and views were amazing. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For airport access OK”
Reviews.Author: JoannandKen
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you need an airport overnight. Nice location but not really anything else to recommenced it. Restaurants are either very expensive or a 'sports bar' which is bit naff!

Reviews.Title: “Sustainble and Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MikeRuss1
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Diego and it was the srat of agreat conference. The hotel is minutes from the airport. The shuttle bus runs every15 minutes or shorter as it was there when you need it. The arirval at the hotel was perfect. The lobby was beautifully decorated and prepared for our conference. The rooms were nicely appointed: refreshment centre, T.V nautical theme room and very comfortable. Concierge team member very accommodating. The Director of Front Office was very cordial and engaging; thank you Daniel. Though the airportis close to the hotel, you felt as it you were in a resort. The hotel does a great job creating a sense of relaxation and comfort with its surroundings. The guestroom keys are made from cardboard........WOW that is what you call "Taking care of the environment". Thank you everyone for a FANTASTIC experience. I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton - San Diego, Harbor Island”
Reviews.Author: mdculpepper
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite San Diego hotels. Friendly staff. Easy to find. Assessable parking. Nice bar and restaurants. Nice Executive Lounge. There are two hotels on the property. About a 5 minute walking distance apart. One tower is the "luxury" tower, has all the amenities and fill up fast. The tower tower is more secluded and has a better view of the San Diego Harbor. Ask which tower you will be put in. Both are a short car drive or bicycle ride to the main Port area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay the "best" staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Marina hotel and had a wonderful stay. The Staff is marvelous and the property and rooms were great. Loved the location next to the airport. I will always consider this hotel for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: sandiegotrip2011
Reviews.Content: this was a very beautiful hotel but the only disadvantage is out of the way from everything. restaurant incredibly expensive. if I had to redo our trip we would have stayed somewhere close to everything. the only thing close was the airport and most hotels in sandiego have free shuttles. concierige service not helpfull at all.

Reviews.Title: “Service and parking sucks”
Reviews.Author: thebigace15
