Was told a taxi would be no problem but in the event had to wait 20 minutes and ended up running! With retrospect I'd rather have paid a little more and stayed in a better hotel where I'd have felt safer, enjoyed the evening more and got a taxi with no problem the next morning

Reviews.Title: “No longer barefoot”
Reviews.Author: Ayreng
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton on a business trip (although i did have a couple days to play). This was my first visit to San Diego and your Hotel made my stay all the more fabulous. The room was kept clean throughout my stay and all of the staff were helpful and pleasant. I flew back to Sacramento and realized i left a rather expensive pair of shoes in the room. I called and left a message for "Lost and Found" and withing a few hours Nicholas had returned my call and got the ball rolling to get my shoes back to me. Within 3 days i had them back. It was just one more wonderful experience that your hotel provide me with. Thank you Nicholas.... Thank You Sheraton. Ayren

Reviews.Title: “Does Not Cater for Children”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice Hotel in a location that is betwixt and between. Not really within walking distance of any facilities (cafes, shops etc) but has a beautiful outlook over the Marina. Very handy to the airport though, if you are flying in. Our room faced the Marina so aircraft noise was not a problem. May be different on airport side. The TV selection is skewed towards business with very few Childrens channels. Glad we had a room at the main building as the other section was quite a distance. Must mention Rocio as she was a standout server.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staycation!!!”
Reviews.Author: filosab
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday weekend, we lucked out with priceline. This hotel has been in SD for a while and we were a little apprehensive. We heard about the renovation and it was fantastic!!! First and foremost - the option to decline housekeeping for a $5.00 voucher that can be used at the hotel (yes, Starbucks too) is BRILLIANT! Why can't every hotel do this!!! We always decline housekeeping and tidy our own room, hang towels for reuse, make our own bed, which saves the hotel $$$$ with no incentive, this place gets it! They will give you clean towels by the way, and you still get the $ 5.00 voucher! Another thing, the elevators are ample, large and fast, the elevator lobby on each floor is huge, bright, scenic and impressive, again as compared to gaslamp hotels, which seem to skimp on elevators if you ask me. The only drawback is distance from gaslamp, but this hotel made up for it. When we checked in the kind clerk said we had an economy room booked, but she promptly said she'd put us in a better room on the 6th floor, and we got a king as we had hoped for. The room is very spacious, with a downtown view, balcony, great bed and linens. Small bathroom, but well done - subway tile in shower, tub, lots of spots to hold soap, shampoo, etc., rain shower head, marble vanity with very nice lighting. Flat screen TV, high ceilings, very nice. Super, super quiet, even with airport across the street! The pool set it apart from other gaslamp hotels. It was really awesome. Overlooking the marina, tons of space, lots of lounge chairs, big pool, sunny, cabana bar, really great for downtown SD. The hotel lobby is great, computer kiosks with internet, cozy, modern. Starbucks in lobby is great. Parking at $ 22.00 for self park in lot that is part dirt is ridiculous. If you self park, be sure to bring room key to let yourself out of unattended parking lot! We had to re-park, go to lobby, get another key, just to exit the parking lot! A drag. We loved this hotel. The spacious grounds, spacious rooms, pool, we hope to stay again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Harbor island ROCKS! Top of the line service!”
Reviews.Author: sandileelogan
Reviews.Content: Best 27 anniversary we have experienced. We arrived on Friday evening after driving from Arizona, and from that point on it was just perfect.. We were greeted by a very professional friendly staff and went on up to our room. We proceeded out to the balcony to enjoy a beautiful view of the boats and the bay.. We were very tired and ordered room service the gentleman was so friendly and the food was delicious, in fact we ordered room service a few more times during our stay and had coffee and desert in the hotel restaurant and every time it was excellent our stay was so enjoyable and the room was so clean and everything was so perfect always want to stay with Sheraton the staff that was top of the line this Sheraton was on harbor island drive. I would choose this hotel over any other when in San Diego....

Reviews.Title: “Sacrifice convenience for quality”
Reviews.Author: lumbarlover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend with my 10 year old daughter. I got a good rate for the hotel for under $100 a night at Priceline so I thought. First of all from the reviews I expected the Marina Tower to be a better fit so asked for an upgrade and got one from the desk agent at an unexpected extra $20 a night. Now the Marina tower is nice because it has a restaraunt, bar, starbucks and heated pool along with full service gym. However if you want a bigger room and in my opinion better views stay at the Bay tower. They have a basic lobby but if you don't need all the ammenities I previously mentioned then that place is probably the better location. The bay tower is serviced by a free shuttle. I would stay at the bay tower next time. As far as transportation service. My daughter and I relied on public transportation. The shuttle takes you to the airport where you catch the bus. Since we relied on public transportation this place was not convenient. If you plan to travel the same way choose a place closer to the hub of transportation (downtown). I rented a car the last day and found free parking on the pennisula. This is closer to the bay tower and is a cheap way to park your car. Be advised there are only about 15 free parking spaces that are 3 hour time limit but free all night after 11. All and all the hotel is nice but I wouldn't stay here if you plan on exploring San Diego. We had a "Go Card" so that is what we did. I would like to thank "Angelique" at the front desk for her professional and kind service in dealing with the charges for my room. Noise is not an issue. PLenty of computers at business center so WIFI is not necessary

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Management could use an attitude adjustment.”
Reviews.Author: lccannon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sheraton for a little vacation in San Diego. The location was a bit of an issue at first because we thought it was going to be downtown, so it was further away than we thought. We fell in love with the view from our room and the girls at the concierge helped us rent a car so we could get around the city better. The beds were comfortable and our room was always spotless when we returned from sight seeing. It was also nice that there was a Starbucks in the hotel. Our only issues with this hotel was the overpriced, poor quality breakfast buffet and the unhelpful, rude hotel manager we had a run-in with. I have been all over the world and stayed in a variety of hotels, the breakfast buffet at the Sheraton wasn't even comparable to a continental breakfast at a Holiday Inn. Poorly cooked eggs and rotten fruit cost us $19 each! The other issue with the manager happened on friday night (April 8th). We were looking for parking and could not find any on one side of the hotel and the other side was blocked. We were exhausted and just wanted to get to our room. We asked a valet what the problem was and we were informed that there was a large wedding the next day that required the whole other side of the parking lot. We asked if we could valet for the same price as regular parking (Reg is $22 and Valet is $28), he said he would have to ask the manager. We pulled over and waited for a decision. The manager on duty came to our car and rudely informed us again of the wedding and that he would not valet our car for anything less than $28. We asked what we were supposed to do and he condescendingly told us we would have to park in employee parking that was very far away from the hotel and unpaved (it was raining so it was a big muddy mess). My boyfriend expressed that this was unacceptable and as guests we should have parking close the hotel. The manager then yelled at him that we would have to park there or not at all and there was nothing else he could do for us and walked away without another word. Like I said I travel quite frequently and have stayed in 5 star hotels and no-star hotels and I have never had some speak to me the way that manager did (I wish I could remember his name). Sheraton should take more care in training their entire staff to meet the needs of their guests, especially their managers. Overall the staff was very friendly and helpful, but one bad seed can ruin a nice evening.

Reviews.Title: “Disneyland or Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveTexas70
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice property and a quality hotel located at the San Diego Airport. I would not rate it a business hotel, more of a family hotel you would expect to find next to Disneyland. If you have a family attending Sea World or local attractions, I recommend this hotel. It is also extremely convenient to the airport. We had issues with check-in, waiting over 2 hours in the lobby. In the hotel's defense we arrived at 1PM, so we were early. However, the desk staff said the room was available, just not cleaned. They would "call housekeeping to have it prioritized" and it would be ready within an hour. Later another person at the desk laughed and said that was crazy, Housekeeping doesn't do that. After over 2 hours, they gave me a room that was already cleaned. The biggest negative was the Club Lounge, which we paid extra to have access to. Our card key did not work, so we had to go to the desk to have it fixed (again). At breakfast it was an interstate exit Hampton Inn with at least 12-15 little kids (ages 8 and under). Wow...wiping noses and then pawing through the pastries, eating from the line, taking stacks of things...real disgusting mess. We also had an issue getting to the Lounge and central elevator because of a "closed for contrsuction" hallway, which the desk told me was incorrect, "you just must be going the wrong way". The desk staff was very unhelpful and definitely never once asked about out stay. I would have told them and moved on. Now I am just disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: satchel21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina for two days. We were leaving on a cruise and wanted to spend a day exploring San Diego. The hotel has a shuttle at the airport. It runs on a continuous loop. There is no need to call the hotel to arrange pick up. The driver was very nice and offered some advice about things to do in San Diego. We stayed in the Marina tower in a club level room. The room was nicely appointed. The shower had plenty of hot water. The bed was comfortable. We had a very nice view of the marina. I enjoyed having my morning coffee out on the balcony. We enjoyed the club lounge. There were hot appetizers at night and a continental breakfast in the morning. There is a computer in the lounge with free internet access. Be prepared to wait in line as there is only one computer. The pool area was fantastic. After a day of airline cancellations and delays it was so nice to relax in the hot tub. We even made friends with another couple who was going on the same cruise. I would recommend staying at this hotel. It was wonderful experience. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. We will absolutely stay here again if we travel to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: ohcleverusername
Reviews.Content: This place is in a great location, and the price is right. It is totally quiet at night and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - wonderful view!”
Reviews.Author: jj1337
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. Very clean, very comfortable beds, nice staff. Had a great nights sleep each night. We checked in and the package we bought included a free upgrade and free breakfast. The front desk person was nice and very accomodating. We got 7th floor, king bed with a view of the bay/pool. Very nice! You can hear the airport a bit, esp. early in the morning. If you are a light sleeper, you may mind this. We got our breakfast vouchers with no problem. The breakfast buffet they had was great quality and Luis took wonderful care of us. Absolutely no problems at all. Location was good for us. We had a rental car and I think that is a good suggestion for this location. I do agree with most - the parking is crazy....$22 per night. I think if you are a guest there, they should cut you a bit of a better deal. We justified it with the free Breakfast. Pool was good. We layed by it for a few hours one day, but was too cold for us to enjoy it much. There were kids enjoying it, though!! Overall, we had a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the Marina”
Reviews.Author: hokie4beach
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right on the Bay and a taxi ride away to the Gas Lamp district. My room was overlooking the Marina and was able to take advantage of the spectacular sunsets. The best part about staying at any Sheraton is the comfort of their beds and pillows. I stayed for 4 nights and was able to sleep great. The rooms are very modern and clean. Immediately outside of the hotel is a jogging trail along the marina that I took advantage of...beautiful trail since it's parallel to the bay. I always enjoy my stays at Sheraton's and would recommend this one as well. If you are looking for a place right in the middle of nightlife, shopping, restaurants...stay in the Gaslamp district. I went into the Gaslamp district one night...but the taxi fare was expensive for it being only 3-4 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Two Double Beds :(”
Reviews.Author: PAspagirl
Reviews.Content: I am coming to the Sheraton April 12th on a business trip with my husband (HIS trip) I am just coming to get away and enjoy this beautiful hotel. Swimming, running trails, spa, workout room and restaurant. I noticed our reservation said two double beds :( That is NOT good for time away with my sweetheart without kids. I called reservations and they cannot switch me. They are all booked up. I LOVE and use Trip Advisor ALL the time and hope management will see this and possibly help this desperate wife out. We will enjoy our stay either way but was hoping to make in more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pmillerSpring
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to San Diego this past weekend to visit our son who is in the Navy. We made our reservation through Expedia and I have to admit I was a little skeptical because I had never reserved a hotel that way but I must say that we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is at a great location, beautiful views and friendly staff. Our room was very comfortable. I read a couple of reviews last week that said the close proximity to the airport was a problem because of noise but my husband and I did not experience any noise problems at all. We had a marina king room and loved the view. Overall, it was a great experience and we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lost and Found”
Reviews.Author: asandrao
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for conference. Excellent location. Excellent health club with 24 hour access. I forgot my iphone charger in the room and realized when I was at the airport. I called lost and found and both Nicolas and Andy were very helpful and understanding. They went to my room right away to look for my item and followed up with me promptly. They mailed my charger next business day and I had it within 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel-great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: taylorNy_ny
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel-great atmosphere! We enjoyed this hotel & the location. What a beautiful view of the harbor & very comfortable rooms. The pools were beautiful (1 heated 1 not) which we enjoyed despite the cold weather. Follow the signs to the airport out to Harbor Island for this hotel. It is not far from the zoo & downtown San Diego & Corronado.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, location & rooms, but don't open the mini bar!”
Reviews.Author: SimplyFengShui
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marina Tower because Trip Advisor rewiews advised against the Bay Tower and we couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel room, the beautiful property and the views! One negative I'll mention is that our stay was pre-paid as part of an Expedia package, and for the very first time in my life I didn't ask for a copy of the folio when we checked out. I'd taken a $10 container of nuts from the mini bar but was in the room when the lady came to check the mini bar, so felt it was understood what I had used. Usually they record what you've used and give you a receipt but she didn't. Well, you can imagine my surprise when my credit card was billed over $64! Accounting told me that the items in the mini bar are sensored, so if you remove an item (to read the label in my case) you will automatically be charged for it. Apparently the 'sensors' are to stupid to know when you've replaced the item back in its place. Anyway as a 'courtesy' I was credited back for the other 3 items I had been charged for - wow thanks guys. The nuts ended up costing $13 because they also add tax and a 'service charge' so be sure to add 30% to the listed price. Okay - lesson learned - it's great place to stay but don't open the mini bar!

Reviews.Title: “No 4 stars, but ok.”
Reviews.Author: ERO1229
Reviews.Content: Great view... unless your ground level at the Bay tower like I was. Ok rooms... bathroom was old & dingy... wallpaper was bubbling & had stains all over. Bed was comfy & a great location.I am still not sure how this hotel comes up asa 4 star on the third-party sites.

Reviews.Title: “Dream stay”
Reviews.Author: GenGens1
Reviews.Content: I actually joined tripadvisor for the sole purpose of reviewing this fantastic hotel! I couldn't have been happier with anything about it: lovely, comfy rooms with wonderful views, delicious food and brilliant, extremely helpful staff! If you have any qualms about booking here, I'd forget them. I couldn't recommend it enough!

Reviews.Title: “Great view and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: grothman
Reviews.Content: I was here as part of the HP Sales training this past week. I stayed in the Bay Hotel part of this complex...its a 5 minute walk from the main marina hotel. I was upgraded to the 11th floor and it was amazing. I had a view of the bay & downtown san diego. The sunsets were to die for. i dont think you can go wrong because the view across the hall is of the marina. The staff here was VERY accomodating and friendly, from the workers at the check-in desk to the people cleaning, to the service gentleman that was on the elevator with me. It's a super intentional friendly that makes me want to come back. The only negative was that the chairs in my room had worn fabric but thats mostly a cosmetic issue. Also, its like $22/night for parking so take a cab here :) The food at the harbour island restaurant at the marina was AMAZING!!! i NEVER eat hotel food and am so glad i did there...4 star!! Also, there's a little deli in between the two hotels that had great food as well...it was a lot cheaper than the one in the hotel..$16 for an omelette ouch! Bottom Line: you'll really like this hotel and its a super quick drive downtown

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Linda5584
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for (1) night before our cruise ship sailed. We checked in very easily and were given a Marina king room on the ninth floor. The view of the city skyline and marina were wonderful. The hotel, in itself, is nicely decorated and the rooms are nautically themed. It was nice to have a small balcony to sit and enjoy the views (and watch our cruise ship pull into the port terminal at 5:30 in the morning). Beds are very comfortable and the room was clean. Only complaint would be the slow service in the lounge restaurant and the distance to the Gaslamp district. LONG WALK!

Reviews.Title: “Hugely Improved”
Reviews.Author: Rich2809
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times before and I must say I was always a little disappointed in the past with the service and the general ambiance of the hotel. I stayed in mid Feb 2011. The hotel has changed dramatically for the better, it is a much more relaxing place to stay. The staff are friendlier, the rooms are comfortable. I now look forward to my next stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: JillyAltrincham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here towards the end of our road trip, we got a last minute deal. Rooms were really nice, if small. Nice bathroom. We really enjoyed the pool and the beds!! The staff were nice and friendly, in particular the valets who helped pack up our car and chatted to us. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: nebraska22
Reviews.Content: My son left his favorite stufffed puppy at the hotel on our trip last month. He was so worried about how we would get him back. We were already at the airport, and so we called their customer service number. Nicolas in the Lost and Found department found his puppy and contacted us to let us know that he had been found. They also shipped it back to Nebraska for us free of charge. Thankfully our son only had to sleep a couple nights without "Puppy". So thankful for the extra steps the staff made on our behalf.

Reviews.Title: “Even reservations are rude”
Reviews.Author: puddingjar2
Reviews.Content: I called to book this hotel and when the man I was talking with thought I was not going to book due to high price he hung up on me - does not bode well for this hotel if their reservations staff are rude! Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malibu34
Reviews.Content: We had a Marina tower - double room on a higher floor. The beds were very comfortable. No noise and we slept really well! At an Airport Hotel! Starbucks in Lobby! Internet in Lobby but Extra cost in room. 11$ Close to car rental and cruise terminal. Extra cost to park the car. $22 Nice restaurants in the Lobby and a very nice pool area.. Amazing view from our room of San Diego and the Bay! We had a Balcony. Even better if you have a King! We had our son along so we were nice and got a double. Great Last Night in San Diego. Went to Little Italy for Dinner very Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling lack of Cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: creativegirl75
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, friendly and accommodating staff, beautiful grounds, great food and drinks. I had a very enjoyable time and would give this hotel four stars if it weren't for the nasty condition of the bathroom. I mean, for a four star hotel, this was truly disappointing. Please Sheraton, for the prices you charge and the lovely amenities, every part of your guest rooms should be SPOTLESS.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful customer service!”
Reviews.Author: thanksPittsburgh_pa
Reviews.Content: Upon leaving my room, I left a small but crucial part of the charger for my laptop in the outlet. Nicolas Osorio Casanova responded quickly to the call I made, and returned the needed part. He saved me time and money, and made my memory of the experience even better. Such attention encourages me to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Halani
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marina Tower for 5 nights for a conference. The location is directly across the street from the San Diego Airport. The rooms are well appointed and cozy. My room had a small balcony which was nice to let fresh air in. Some nights I could hear planes fly by, but not more than a couple times. The bathroom was clean and the huge showerhead was like rainfall. Starbucks coffees and teas in room. The grounds are well kept, it was nice to walk around the Marina when the sun was out. I ate at the Harbor's Edge Restaurant as part of the conference. The breakfast buffet was great - eggs, bacon, sausage, pastries, FRESH fruit and more. Had lunch there a couple of times, too. The burger was alright, nothing special. They give you your condiments in individual jars, which was sanitary, but I felt like I wasted a lot of it. The biggest con about the hotel is how nothing is included. Self-parking and internet add a significant amount to the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a week!”
Reviews.Author: JanTurnerMoore
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews below and was flabergasted to read that their visits were less than expected. I found just the opposite to be true. I believe that the service was one of the best that I have ever experienced. Everyone that I spoke to were in the business of sales which is why I was there. The smiles from the front desk down to housekeeping were a refreshing sight day to day. I was there for 6 days and never found it to be anything but this. After returning to my home I realized that I had left articles of clothing in the dresser. I immediately called and was treated pleasantly and very attentively by Sue Seirres. She was going to follow up and check the room herself but in the mean time she would transfer me to Security. At this time I met Nicolas Osorio. What a kind and very friendly voice. He as well was going to go check the room himself and would phone me back. He returned my call in less than 30 minutes and had located the items. He said that he would Fed-X them to me the next day (Saturday the 5th) But then he realized that FedX does not ship on the weekends, he called me back immediately and said they wouldn't go out until Monday. How nice was that?? I received the items this week along with a letter NOT a note from Nicolas. He wanted me to let the hotel know that the box arrived safely more specifically my 'lovely purple sweater'. he knew that this was the item I relished the most. He felt his kindness in his words of the letter. A special thanks to Nicolas and the rest of the Sheraton employees. Oh, and by the way Sue did follow up and called me shortly after Nicolas did. I travel a lot with my company and I do believe that this was the best accommodations that we have had in many years. (including DisneyWorld). Thanks Shearton for treating your guests like family.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy , nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DriftwoodB
Reviews.Content: You would think with the airport nearby that the sound of the planes would be an issue. I wasn't . What was annoying was the noise coming from the other rooms. I could hear people using the bathrooms, flushing toilets, taking showers, and opening and closing the sliding doors, and talking. This was surprising for me. Usually, such 1st rate hotels are constructed better than this. The hotel is spotless, the staff pleasant and helpful. I did not like the idea of paying for internet access in the room. I do not feel like lugging my equipment down stairs when I want to check email. To do any kind of work, I would have had to camp out in the Lobby all afternoon. And lets not forget the parking fee. $22. So lets see, No Free Parking, NO Free Internet Access in your room, and if you are in the smaller hotel, only a cafe/bar to dine in. Will I stay here again....probably not. Would I recommend, again, probably no.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Too close to airport and a drive from downtown”
Reviews.Author: XclusiveTripz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel on the marina. Great convention facility. The hotel is right next to the airport so you get noise from the airport around the clock (not overly bad but still). Hotel is on the other side of the water from downtown so be prepared to take a taxi or rent a car. Parking at the hotel is $$$$$$ and there is not place to park for free. The rooms were beautiful and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location with views of San Diego Harbor and Harbor Island Yacht Ancohorage.”
Reviews.Author: Bentley
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is located on Harbor Island along with a smallish Hilton. There are marvelous walks (jogs) to be had along the yacht harbor waterfront. Views of Pt Loma and down to the Coronado bridge are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Tower was Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: SeeingWhatsNext
Reviews.Content: Customer service was friendly and very good in the Bay Tower. The rep greeted us warmly and upon hearing our stay was a part of our anniversary trip, she congratulated us and proactively provided us with complimentary breakfast vouchers (which included a nice buffet of eggs, meats, breads, fruits, steel cut oats, yogurts, cereals, coffee, etc.). Her generosity was not solicited or expected but was a real treat! The lobby was clean, bright, and candles were lit in the evenings. To us, these efforts indicate that the focus is on making a customer’s stay as enjoyable as possible – something we appreciated. The spacious room was nice and clean and decorated with a nautical theme that included vibrant reds and blues. We were allocated a room on the marina side and the views were quite serene and pleasant especially in the morning – the Coronado bridge, ships, and bay were nice to view . A few things to note: internet in the rooms is not included and neither is self – parking for $22. Parking we can somewhat understand as that is typically part of a nicer hotel stay but we feel the rate is rather elevated. The internet fee, however, is in our opinion outdated and unnecessary. We would venture to guess that a charge for the net may result in loss of business. Also, the refrigerator in the room is for their food and drinks only. Do not remove any of it to store your items as some sensor will automatically charge the removed items to your bill. Just some info… Overall, we would recommend this Sheraton because of the friendliness and customer service, clean and spacious room, and nice views. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable when nothing else is available, but avoid the Bay Tower”
Reviews.Author: IzzyInBliss
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton here is a standard run-of-the-mill chain hotel—decent, but nothing special. Not my kind of hotel, but acceptable when there's no better choice. I stayed here because everything else was booked because of 2 conventions in town. But my biggest beef is the deceitful "bait & switch" I was subjected to! After checking into the main lobby, I was told my room was in the Bay Tower just 5 minutes' walk away. There was a pretty map of the "property" showing the two towers and the surrounding pools, so I got the impression maybe it's just one of those large resort-like properties. Well, it turns out that this is literally down the road, several commercial property blocks away, in what is a second-rate motel that was probably a Ramada Inn-level place that they bought and are selling as part of the Sheraton. The gym and pool is a joke, the lobby is not a place you can comfortably hang out in, there is no coffee kiosk or Wireless Lounge like in the main building—but you pay the same price. The so-called view is over a parking lot towards the harbor—facing the naval base with turbine engines that go on till late at night. The one good thing if you have an early flight out is that it is literally next to the airport. If I had to stay here again, here's what I'd do next time: 1) Make sure my room is in the main "Marina Tower"—not the second-rate "Bay Tower." This matters to me because I like easy access to a coffeeshop downstairs, and a better gym and pool and hangout areas. Not that it's not a good place—but I'd rather stay at a Double Tree then, and pay accordingly and at least have warm cookie instead of those sensor refrigerators you're warned not to use or touch. 2) If I get stuck in the Bay Tower again, personally, I'd prefer the room to face the Marina instead of the harbor. Yes, the Marina side is the airport side, but I find the plane noise isn't as loud or aggravating as the non-stop turbines from the Naval base.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ikelmay
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for our pre-cruise stay, and were looking forward to a couple of days of relaxation and shopping. Our room was spacious with a balcony overlooking the main pool and although not commanding the dramatic views of the higher floors, was very pleasant (given this hotel was obtained through an opaque booking option, sometimes choices are hit and miss). I am surprised at some reviews describing negative experiences with staff as we encountered nothing but friendly and very efficient service - the guest service agent who checked us in - Dinah - is a gem. The hotel location could be a somewhat negative aspect as the hotel is away from the downtown core of San Diego. However, I researched transport options and we had no trouble accessing public transit. Should you prefer a cab, it is only a 12 minute journey into the city. Given the hotel's proximity to the airport, there was little or no noise issues. We would stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Facilitiy”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerUpland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the hotel in January 2011 and we were very pleased. What a beautiful place for a weekend outing. We certainly enjoyed all the amenities. This place is well kept and the rooms are spacious and beautiful. All new carpet, furnishings, big flat screen TV and great restaurant inside the complex. The front desk personnel were most helpful and very professional. We felt very fortunate that we landed this place. It sets on beautiful Harbor Island and every room has a beautiful view. The room fee was reasonable,however I am never pleased when I have to pay for parking my vehicle at the facility that I am staying at. The parking fee is $22 per day. The pool area is lovely and well kept. Harbor Island is a great area to run, walk, ride bikes and a great view of the downtown area. Thanks for the fabulous weekend.!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Read "TERRIBLE" and "POOR" Tripod reviews BEFORE you book it!”
Reviews.Author: YourWorld
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to get their Customer Service "wake up" call before they realize that they have certain memebers of staff giving a proper grief, attitude and generally speaking bad customer services to their paying and valuable guests. Sadly enough I know Sheraton for the better, but this stay was a major let down! Horrible experience! We made a mistake by booking this hotel based on the Excellent reviews and we never dreamed of that we would have to agree with lots of people who rated this particular hotel as Poor or even worse Terrible. Our check-in was awful, the receptionist wasn't interested in us at all, and although they have plenty of rooms available on both sides of the hotel (the main big building!) the receptionist didn't even bother to ask us which side we would like to have, ie. Marina view or the absolutely fantastic views of the city, which we didn't get. The Concierge staff were most of the time playing with their mobile phones while we were there, only when you let them know by calling them they would respond to you and then they will acknowledge you. The soap and shampoo were unreplenished and heavily underestimated, and we were left the dirty glasses in our room for days! We have to contact them several times for the soap and shampoo and it arrived there several hours later! When you go half way around to World on a holiday of a lifetime the last thing you need is to be annoyed and frustrated with the basic, small things issues and problems which shouldn't have happened in normal circumstances and with professional members of staff. Some of the staff appeared to us as either new and unsufficiently trained, or just not happy with their job or whatever else is in the background. The room service was slow, and once they appeared they were even slower as they had a new guy in the room service departpment who was to receive his training - in front of us in the evening! This was a horrible experience as we have just landed after a very long flight! Unfortunately the senior member of the room service failed to spot this and unfortunatelly we were left with no other option than to participate in that Circus de la Room Service! Once we finished our meal we called the room service to pick up their trolley, they just told us to drive the trolley out and leave it there, which stayed there for the whole night. They first picked up the trolley in the morning in front of our door. However, once they've picked up the trolley, another room service attendant hours later came to our door banging and asking us for the trolley from a previous night, to our great astonishment! We've told him that the trolley had been picked up by someone else. He was very grumpy in his search for that trolley and he didn't even apologise to us for the disturbance he made. He walked away muttering something to himself. Shocking experience! Chocolate from the mini-bar incident: Wow! This episode is a top notch of BAD Customer Services!! Honestly! WOW! On our 1st night we took a chocolate from our room's mini-bar, and to our great astonishment, the chocolate had expired MONTHS ago! Clearly we were not happy with it, and on our discovery some other products had been expired too! As the mini-bar in the rooms is touch-sensitive, we had try to communicate this to the room service and the front desk, but without any success! So, a trip to the reception in a middle of a night was needed to try and get another chocolate from either them or room service or something like that. The night receptionist failed to understand what the problem was, she wasn't interested in our problem what so ever!! We have explained to her that we don't want to be charged for it so if she can make sure of that, and if we can get someone to replenish other products from the mini-bar asap. Our request fall on death ears, the girl just didn't have a clue what I was on about, and she kept asking me to comeback tomorrow to the reception or to get hold of someone in the room service, but first the following day?!?! She had a proper attitude, so it was best to leave the argument there. Oh my God, the following day our HORRIBLE customer experience continiued!!! WOW!! Someone from the housekeeping came banging at our door, and we have asked her to comeback later as it was very early and it was a proper inconvenience. She spoke very limited English so clearly she did NOT understand what we were telling her. As soon as we realized that the lingustics are the issue we have tried to simplyfy our message to her. Then she walked away. Not even half an hour later she came around again, the same housekeeper, claiming that the room service send her. We didn't want her in the room at that time as we were still asleep but we felt that we didn't have a choice as she muttered something to us that she is busy! WOW! Like we care?? What a stressful event. And yet it did not end here. We have struggled to understand to communicate to her what the problem was about the mini-bar as it is was very obvious to us that the night receptionist did not tell her the whole story! Shocking. So, we have spent good 15 minutes explaining to this lady that we didn't touch or eat or drunk ANYTHING from the mini-bar, she claimed that we did as it was missing, and then we told her that she must seek that missing chocolate bar from the reception!! She was very suspicious, and she muttered something to herself, something which we didn't understand, in Spanish! She was visibly upset about the whole thing although we have tried to explain to her in a very plain language so she did understand what we were telling her. Then all of sudden she started to complain to us that she doesn't understand English very well, and that she will send someone else. We felt sorry for this woman in a way, but we were upset at the same time about how this could have happened, this great misscommunication between the departments. This housekeeper sent from the room service wanted to charge us for the expired chocolate from the mini-bar. No one ever came later on to replenish other expired products from the mini-bar and we have never ever touched that mini-bar again. We never received a call or any message of acknowledgment from anyone from anywhere from the hotel, so we were left in uncertainty about the whole mini-bar experience until we have received our final invoice where we have registered that they did not charge us for the mini-bar products. Awful experiences, constant frustrations, desperation, bad customer services and what else not!! Soon after this room service left our room we were to go to bed again, however that wasn't possible as another housekeeper kept knocking at our door to clean the room although we did have a DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door!!!! She came around twice and she realized we were not up then she said she will come back later. She too muttered something to herself and appeared not to be happy because of our presence in the room. The same incident happened the following day too. Awful! On a check out from this hotel the lack of same interest for the paying and valuable guests like us was the same as we entered the hotel, awful, nothing, appaling! Even when we stayed at the 2 or 3 stars places the members of staff were very warm, hospitable, very friendly and kind to us. The room we had didn't have the city view and that was a major let down, although we must emphasize that the rooms are lovely (in the main building!). I can follow to some extent what other critics wrote about the design and furniture of this hotel, however, our main objective and at the same time a total FAILURE of those were lack of friendly and welcoming stuff, appaling customer services and never going and extra mile for a customer!! A major disappointment, frustration, desperation and what else not! We made a major mistake by booking this hotel! The room and the building is nice, they even have Starbucks there which I was quite pleased about it, the area, the lobby is okay and the views around the hotel are nice, but what's the point when you have your holiday and mood ruined by rude members of staff with a proper attitude and no clue what so ever??!! It is a real shame as our money will now go to someone else instead of Sheraton in San Diego! If they don't appreciate your business, well, there are plenty of other competitors who will do anything for you and your valuable revenue!! You don't travel half away around the World on a holiday of a lifetime to get crappy and appaling customer services and attitude, that's just plain WRONG!! :(( And if you're lucky you'll get one of those PR-letters from the Management saying how surprised and sorry they are about your experience and how they hotel pride itself to be the best and blah blah blah, and they will just wish you all the best! What a joke! We won't stay there ever again until the things change DRAMATICALLY for the better, obviously!! Sheraton other places maybe, but this one, no way! One girl from the Concierge and one guy from the Starbucks were the only people who smiled at us once and that's about all the smiley and happy faces in Sheraton we've got during our several days long stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence base for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: spggold
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for the money! The front desk personnel is very helpful! Hats off to Melissa and Blanka at front desk for going the extra mile and making our weekend extra special. We stayed at the bay tower, the balconies and the rooms are a little bit bigger I noticed. Excellent view either side of hotel. Rooms need an update, but kept very clean, so you really don't care. Maryann B. in the spa is excellent! She really knows what she is doing! I did the Reflexology and she was the very best! We live in Vegas and go to all the strip hotels for spa services. She is really awesome! Service in the resturants is top notch. Very helpful, Rebecca at the breakfast buffet gave some really nice suggestions and directions! The breakfast buffet for the price should have made to order omelets and waffles. Miss that! Dined in the Harbor View for dinner, Service was excellent and prompt, but for the price and quality of food I would look into one of the more upscale Gaslamp district or some of the fresh fish resturants just down the street. The Hotel is situated on it own Island kinda (park like) Great neighborhood. Overall this hotel is great for a nice quite upscale getaway! I would recommed this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad base”
Reviews.Author: malbecblue
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the airport, so it's probably best for those who are either stopping over briefly, or those who plan to drive around anyway and just use it as a base for a short stay (which is what I did). Despite the proximity to the airport, I didn't notice the planes at all. There are two hotels - Marina and Bay Hotel - the Marina is definitely the better of the two. The hotel itself was comfortable and the rooms spacious and the one I had had a nice view over the marina. Compared to other hotels I experienced on the same trip, I thought this one was fairly cheap and pretty good value for money. In summary it had what I needed - no more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “Always a relaxing stay prior to a long business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Deepwater805
Reviews.Content: I fly out of San Diego once a month for overseas business trips. These flights often encompass two days for me to get to my destination, and I've found that getting a room near the airport prior to a departure is the best way to rest up prior to one of these lengthy trips. After trying a few different downtown hotels in San Diego I've finally settled on the Sheraton Marina Hotel. Aside from the being the closest to the airport, it's also the most relaxing. I've never had a bad sleep there, and in fact I always leave for the airport very refreshed. I've come to feel so comfortable with the Sheraton Marina that I've even stayed there a couple times when it didn't involve business. It's become my hotel of choice whenever I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay”
Reviews.Author: MtMacFam
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay! Say hello to Scott at Tapatini Bar and get a PHD level cocktail!!! Very nice view in all directions and easy to get from point A to B. Staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, beautifully decorated room, and facilities”
Reviews.Author: americanvagabond
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very courteous, especially Nicholas in Lost & Found who sent at no charge my favorite bathing suit that I had left behind. We found the room to be spacious with a nice view of the marina and excellent furnishings, plasma TV, and modern nautical decor. The pool, jacuzzi, and fitness club were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful & fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: nina_anne09
Reviews.Content: I was at the Sheraton for only one night so I didn't get to experience any of its many amenities, including the beautiful outdoor pool and tennis courts. I had been traveling all day and was exhausted, and was so happy to have a nice, comfortable, quiet hotel room to crash in. And the service was awesome! I had left a bottle of lotion in the room the following morning--something pretty small, but I did want it back--and Nicolas from Lost & Found was super helpful in locating it. He found it, Fedexed it to me for free, and I got it back right away. So...beautiful location, comfortable, and wonderful, helpful staff...definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not normal sheraton quality (bay tower)”
Reviews.Author: liongal
Reviews.Content: This tower is fairly average. The view and location, however, are outstanding! Restaurant is more like convenience cafe (very small and limited menu). Beds suck (guess they haven't upgraded to new cozy ones). Toilet paper and tissue are cheap and scratchy (details that add to feeling of "nice detail" or "am I in motel 6?"). Front desk staff was friendly but a bit too much to the point for my taste (I like the "is there anything else..." and other courtesies). Took 3 calls and 2 visits to front front desk (over 4 hour period) to get corkscrew and room service menu delivered (I called guest services made my request only to hear "allow me to transfer you to room service"...did this 3 times...never got connected. Just wonder why he didn't send it up..?) Room service and bar staff are super friendly and food was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable 5-star Quality!”
Reviews.Author: dfm7772001
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service, beautiful views, best fitness center I have ever seen in a hotel. It's a cab ride to downtown but very close to the airport. Have the breakfast buffet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton's name and motel 6 quality”
Reviews.Author: skyhome2011
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed there for 2 nights and I would never come back to this hotel. My decision to stay in this hotel was base on the beautiful photos from their website but be carefully, there is a bait and switch, when we arrive the hotel, we were sent to another property called "bay tower". The stuff was nice and friendly and when I asked what's the difference between "bay tower" and main hotel. I was told "the room here is 35% larger than main hotel". After we got into the room, we turned on the heater and we all fall asleep until we waked by cold. The heater is not working. called the guest service more than 5 times and no one pick up the phone. I had to go to front desk and tell them that the heater is not working. Almost 1 hour later, a engineer came and fixed the heater. When I asked him to make sure the heater won't break again, he told me to call guest service again if it breaks again. Around 10:30pm, we found that there is no hot water in the bathroom. called guest service more than 5 times and finally somebody picked up the phone and told me that she will send a engineer to my room to check out. more than 30 minutes later, no one shows up and nobody picks up the phone call. Went down the front desk and was told "the boiler is broken and engineer is working on it. no ETA'. we waited another hour and went to bed without taking shower. On the second day, I requested to move to the main hotel. The lobby is beautifully and full of guests and activities. The restaurant is great and feels so warm. After we got back to our room around 8;30pm, we found that the heater is NOT working in our room. called front desk and was told a engineer is on the way. 45 minutes later, no one shows up and I went down to the front desk and was told there were 5 more calls in front of me and their engineer is working very hard to fix the issues and I have to wait. Another 30 minutes later, a guy came in and fix the heater. (not sure if he really fixed or not, before the fix, the temperature shows 65 and after the fix, the temperature shows 71 max. We set it to 74 but never exceed 71) I requested to talk to their manager but was told that the manager was too busy and I only can talk to him after middle night. I was offered one day free parking because of above horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ke11ya
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not bad but not great either. The location was okay. It had nice views but I don't think it's in the best part of town. The hotel overall was clean and looks like it's going through an update. I couldn't tell if our room was an updated room or not. It seemed on the older side. The bathroom was very small and the hairdryer did not work. I left a note asking for a replacement from housekeeping. They took the old one but did not leave a replacement. My big issue was with the service. Everyone was nice but not very competent. When I checked in I asked about an upgrade. I received an email from the hotel prior to arriving offering the opportunity to upgrade for a fee if a room was available. I selected the upgrade I wanted and submitted my credit card information. When I checked in the person at the front desk was not familiar with this but said she could offer me an upgrade. I told her I wanted to stay on the club level. She ended up putting us in the Bay Tower which doesn't offer the club level which was annoying because I paid for this upgrade. I discovered the error the next morning when I called to inquire where the club room was. The person on the phone had to add the club level access to our reservation. He only agreed to do this after I complained about the confusion at check in and the fact that I requested a wake up call but never got one. Overally, I can't complain too much because I got the room for only $79/night (before the extra $20/night for the upgrade). But had I paid more than $100 I would have been mad. This hotel is not worth more than what I paid. Lastly, the $22/night charge for self parking was ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Staff embodies San Diego's friendly vibe”
Reviews.Author: muddslide
Reviews.Content: Checked in during holiday week to find (it seemed) 1/2 the population of Nebraska ensconced in the hotel before the Holiday Bowl. Posed no problem for the staff, who were uniformly friendly (unstuffy), upbeat and knew how to do their jobs. Received a great rate so immediately upgraded + $20 to try Club Level extra amenities - between that and all the folks running around in "Huskies" t-shirts - felt like we were on a cruise ship, very family-like feeling given it's a hotel (a place where a bunch of strangers stay together). Afraid this happy vibe might evaporate if Huskies loose ;-) Very comfy 12th floor room with balcony overlooking marina. Surprised at absolutely no airplane noise. We found everything we needed was readily at hand. Hotel has distinction of being turbo (or some new green technology) powered and liked the little touch of being able to skip room service and be green (on a day by day basis) in return for a $5 or 500 Starwood miles credit Best - very interesting location on busy harbor - nice if you like boats (of all shapes and sizes) and Navy helicopters. However, Harbor Island location is not central/downtown. And there are no public transportation options to nearby downtown. Also enjoyed staff's mix of professionalism and genuineness. Odd quirks: Trouble getting to Floor #1 due to obscure elevator bank for that purpose and no (little) signage. Floor #1 is for pool, gym, etc - its elevator bank is located far away from main bank of elevators but no signage at main elevator bank to this effect. Rode up + down main elevators for a while (where there is a floor #1 marked on the panel) but it would not stay lit . Needless crazy making when a few clearer signs would help. Though a nice idea in theory, hors d'oeurves offered in Club Level evening reception Tues-Thursday (gratis though bar charges for drinks) were marginal, a polite word for almost inedible. I have a caste iron stomach and they gave me indigestion! Hope the hotel will review the quality of the fare.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: lleecpa
Reviews.Content: All the staff and management have made our stay (my dog, Sugar) and I a very enjoyable experience. We truly appreciate everything that have been done for us. Thank YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, albeit a bit isolated”
Reviews.Author: John_CornerBrook
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Marina was a fabulous hotel. Our room was huge, the decor and condition of the hotel was wonderful, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. We had one small complaint (our peek viewer in the door was reversed - you could not see out of the room, but those in the hall could peek in - the thing was installed in reverse!) but it was fixed in minutes. And close-by the Boathouse Restaurant, recommended by hotel staff, offered great food and very decent prices. Hotel car parking is very pricey, but we dumped the car and enjoyed the neighbourhood. That's the one thing you must remember. The Hotel is too far from downtown to walk reasonably, so a tixi ride is a must if you want to go there.....and you should. San Diego is a great city with lots to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dalexbanda
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took the kids to Sea World and stayed here. We received a great price through priceline, but was skeptical after reading some reviews. Don't judge a book by its cover. Upon arriving we were immediately impressed. The location was great and we had a high room with a great view. The staff were extremely polite. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with Children - very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: kranjan
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Diego and stayed here for 3 nights. PROs 1. Very close to all major attractions (Zoo, SeaWorld, Gaslamp/Downtown) -- not close to Legoland 2. Very clean, excellent service at Check-In, Resteraunt, Housekeeping 3. Breakfast is pretty good with a nice buffet spread - very good service at the restaurant 4. Great location for evening - you can walk to most places in Downtown within 15 minutes 5. Rooms are all suites, which are roomy and let you wind down after a long day 6. Hotel is open to letting you use their fridge to store stuff (even though they have a minibar service) 7. Room includes a Microwave 8. Free 2x Waters per room per day 9. Very quiet rooms CONs 1. Parking is $23 a day, so park on the street if you can. Also parking is on the 11th Floor which means you have to drive up and down 4 floors each way. Parking is very tight spots. 2. Check-in on the 12th Floor and you use a different elevator to go up to your rooms, which means that you have to take a minimum of 2 elevators to get your room

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing, will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jashwinm
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel for 4 nights as I attended a conference that was hosted at the hotel. When we arrived in my room I found there was no Safe in the room, called reception and they sent security up to check but he also could not find the Safe, I then asked to be move to a room with a safe and they said it was not possible to do a room swap, yet 10 mins before when I check-in the person at reception gave me a few room that I could choose from. I found the hotel to be very average considering it should be a 4 star hotel. They don't even offer free in room internet, yet I stayed at a 3 Star Holiday Inn in New York and they offer it.The only good thing I found was the GYM. Now I needed my final invoice and I have been trying for more then a week to get it. I cannot believe this sort of service from a Sheraton hotel. Due to teh fact that I went on business I cannot claim the stay back from my company was I have not recieved my invoice yet. Unbelievable. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Traveller165
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Marina Tower on Saturday November 20th. We thought it might not be too busy on the weekend before Thanksgiving but it was quite full. We got this hotel for a priceline bid of $65 and given the choice between the second floor or paying $20 for the top floor we opted for the top floor. The view of the bay and city skyline from our room was incredible. There was a storm passing that night and we got great pictures of the city with the changing weather. Being close to the airport we could hear the jets taking off but we brought a fan with us for white noise and had no trouble sleeping. The room was average sized and the bed was a bit firm but not overly so. The bathroom was clean and the only thing missing was a vent fan. The balcony had 2 chairs and a small table. Although I hate to pay for parking, from previous stays around downtown San Diego the $22/day fee was par for the course. The parking lots are off to the side of the main enterance and can get congested at times. The overflow parking is not paved and was a bit muddy during the storm. Overall it was a good value for what we paid. We only left the hotel to attend a football game at Qualcomm Stadium and had no trouble getting to and from I-5. With this in mind not being close to restaurants, shops, etc. was not a big issue; but, would prefer to stay in downtown within walking distance of the Gas Lamp Quarter otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: calinurse
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel. We were in the Bay Tower, in a requested high up room with terrace facing the Bay and the Air Force Base, and to the left, the downtown skyline. The room colors were red, white and blue, in keeping with the Military base theme. Room was clean, beds comfortable. Front desk folks were pleasant and helpful. We walked to the Marina building for coffee, and in the opposite direction for a late night restaurant (cant recall the name) but there is not much else in walking distance. The weather was gorgeous and we loved being right on the bay. However, since nothing much is in walking distance, so if you want to be in downtown San Diego, or Coronado, you'er better off picking a place there. For us, the location was fine as we wanted to visit points both north(la Jolla) and South of the airport. Room was clean and roomy enough. Free internet in both lobby and business center--a big plus. There's nothing per se wrong with the hotel, but next timeI'd probably choose a different hotel in a more residential area, such as Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - a nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: ericu33
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Priceline and were a little nervous after reading these reviews, especially once we found out we would be staying at the dreaded Bay Tower. However, my wife and I had a wonderful time (even though it rained) and realize that some people will simply never be satisfied. Below is a breakdown of the pros and cons. Pros: •Beautiful lobby in Marina Tower •Excellent and helpful staff. Special Kudos to Scott and Bryan at Tapatini bar. We had a great conversation with them and they gave us some great advice on restaurant choices (don’t let this review add to your narcissism Scott  ) •Excellently maintained grounds. We didn’t mind the 5 minute walk from the bay to marina Towers and enjoyed “peeping” into the yachts in the harbor. •Fairly close to Gaslamp (but still need to drive or take a cab). •Comfortable bed! •Nice balcony – we were able to sit outside, watch the planes take off and land, and enjoy a bottle of wine. Cons: •Bathrooms in the Bay Tower are VERY small and have no exhaust fan. •Walls are thin and you can easily hear what is going on in hall and other rooms. •No free internet access in room…Really? It’s 2010. You can pay for access, so it’s available…but not free. How about joining the 21st Century Sheraton?? •The Harbor restaurant was WAY overpriced for the décor. Does anyone really want to pay $30+ for dinner and sit in a restaurant that looks like an outdated Long John Silver? Obviously not, I saw maybe 2 couples eating there the entire time. Overall, I would recommend the hotel although I would probably stay somewhere in Gaslamp for my next trip. Don’t buy the horrible reviews you see here – some people have impossible standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: janeByronCenter_MI
Reviews.Content: Our experience was wonderful. It was lovely, a relaxing and beautiful location as well as close to the airport. Everyone was accommodating and helpful. Our room was wonderful with a beautiful view. Without a doubt we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: tyronen13
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out we had a great time. The location on the marina was complemented by the perfect weather. We upgraded to Club, a good choice for us. The staff was particularly impressive. The room was a little small, but well appointed. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Service Okay”
Reviews.Author: BohemianTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights for a conference. It's extremely close to the airport and you can hear the jets. "Luckily" the air conditioner was loud enough to drown out the noise. Checking in was okay. The guy didn't know anything about our conference which was happening at the hotel and didn't offer to direct us to the concierge. They have an area with about 8 pc's & a printer in a livingroom type area. But if you want internet in your room it's going to cost you $9-15/day depending on which type you get. They also have a pc setup us for getting your airline boarding pass. Our room was pretty good. Not as clean as I hoped; I found a big long hair in the tub and the crevices of the bathrrom needed a thorough deep clean. The theme of the room is nautical. We had a nice view but had to haul our suitcase up 2 flights of stairs as there wasn't an elevator near our room. Strange, but I guess it's an older property. The bed wasn't all that comfortable for a Sheraton. We had a nice balcony with 2 chairs and a nice view of the marina. There was a flat screen and the cable had a good selection of channels including a nice selection of international news stations like the Russian news channel. We didn't eat breakfast in the restaurants and our conference was catered for lunch. Really nice catering job by the hotel. The food was really, really good and the staff was friendly & efficient. On our last day, after checking out we decided to have lunch at the hotel pub. It took freaking forever (like an hour!) for a salad and a sandwich! They said that the kitchen was really busy but it was 1pm and I'm sure it's busy everyday at lunch time. You'd think they would have scheduled more staff durring that time. We barely made it to our flight. They have 2 pools and a beautiful waterfall and fountains going into the main pool. They also have a pretty large hot tub. We didn't bring our suits and were pretty bummed that we couldn't go in. They have a fitness center but we didn't use it. The friendliest people at the hotel were the valet & catering staff. The location is pretty central. We saved money by just taking cabs as hotel parking is $18/day. For 5 days we spent about $150 on cabs. A one-way cab ride to downtown is about $15 with tip. They also have a free airport shuttle. Overall, I'd stay there again but I'd make sure we got a really good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Relations Response”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: We booked with Priceline and were concerned that in consequence we might get shunted out to the Bay Tower. I emailed customer relations in advance and requested a specific room type. Received a pleasing response stating that the hotel would be happy to provide me with the requested room. Allocated a delightful room in the main building with beautiful views across the Marina. The room looked as if it had recently been refurbished. It was modern, spacious and clean. Restaurant was expensive but the food was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Hotel and Marina even though the weather was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Bay Tower Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SianLi
Reviews.Content: I and my son stayed in the tower one night. Nove 29-30 part of a wedding party.( I have a receipt.) My Rep. was Kory. Her attitude and disposition was terrible. I was sent to room 388, I opened the door, a man jump from the bed. I went back to Kory and told her there was a man in our room. Her answer was, you are the only one booked in that room. I am telling her there's a man there and she's insisting no one should be there. Our room #194 had no exhaust in the btroom and there was mold at the top of the shower. At check out I bought the issue up and was told about security, computer mix-up and such. Too much information. She never apologized. It seem the problem was my fault. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: LittleLee234
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel and that was enough. From the start of our arrival the parking was a nightmare. Checking in was a bit long but quick when we finally got up to the counter. Our first room was on the 4th floor on the end over looking the jacuzzi. The room was large but that is all the goods things I have to say about it. There was a huge red stain on the carpet when we walked in. The people in the room next to us were so loud we could just about hear their whole conversation. I called the front desk and requested to be moved. They told us the hotel was sold out. So I decided to take a towel from the bathroom to close the gap under the door that adjoined the rooms. There was a huge black hair on the towel so once again I called and requested to be moved. They told us to come back to the front desk and they would have another room for us. Our second room was on the 3rd floor and we had a lovely view of the parking lot. The room was much smaller than our first. We immediately noticed there was black hair all over the bathroom floor. We had problems with the shower working correctly and had more water coming out the faucet than we did the shower head. It took a good 10 minutes for the shower to drain before the next person could shower. We were unable to find the TV remote, after calling the front desk it took them 30 minutes to bring us a new one at 1:30AM. To top things off a car alarm starting going off at 5AM. Needless to say this was the worst hotel experience. I booked the room through priceline which was the first mistake. They were not helpful in resolving the issues after we returned home and said there was nothing they could do. I've emailed the hotel and no response. I was given the name and number for Riquel and have called and left her 3 messages with no response. There are plenty of other hotels close to the San Diego Airport and I would caution you to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “This Sheraton hotel is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: luisa_barlow
Reviews.Content: My family and friends (9 of us total) stayed several days at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina located at 1380 Harbor Island Drive, San Diego, for our son's U.S. Marines Corps graduation at the MCRD. We were all extremely happy with the fabulous location of the hotel. The views of the marina from the hotel are spectacular! The hotel is extremely close to all the major San Diego tourist attractions and the airport, which makes it very easy to access. In addition, we were very impressed with Sheraton's excellent customer services, their extremely helpful concierge, and providing us with all the creature comforts you could find in an upscale 5 star hotel. Not to mention they have a Starbucks in-house - Totally Awesome! Two great restaurants, a super nice gym, an amazing spa, and so much more..... If you are going to stay in San Diego, be it just for fun or for serious business, the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views, great variety on club floor food, extremely attentive staff, with plenty of walking paths.”
Reviews.Author: KateChristie
Reviews.Content: I was on the club floor with marina views for one stay and on a high floor with city and bay views on my second stay in October. Great bartender in small tapas bar who can mix truly classic cocktails. Very reasonable rates for our small goup meeting. Excellent lunch during our board meeting.

Reviews.Title: “It was an Awesome weekend at the Sheraton Marina Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hector99_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a very wonderful weekend at the Sheraton Marina. The Staff was great and catered to our every need. The activity facilities were well kept and very accessable. At night we walked the grounds and took in the beauty of the city and the surrounding harbor. The dinning was pleasant and the food wonderful. Thank you Sheraton for providing such a great service and creating some cherished memories. Sincerely Yours, Hector Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “far from enchanting and a trap for folks without rental cars”
Reviews.Author: tbs82478
Reviews.Content: the hotel has two towers: the nice "marina" tower and the stepchild "bay" tower, a five minute walk between the two. the hotel is a cab ride from everything, poorly appointed and has minimal ammenities. twice, i've stayed here for a conference held in the marina tower. both times, I booked the conference tower and was - without any notice - moved to the bay tower. so I have to either hoof it to the marina tower or wait 15 minutes for a shuttle. not ideal and not what I reserved. customer service when I complained about the switch today I got a "we're sorry" and the manager tried to shift the blame to me for not booking with the conference block. no offer for free in-room internet or anything else. when I tried to order delivery for dinner, I found there was no directory of delivering restaurants and no phone book. I got a phone book and made some calls but no one delivered to this location. upon calling the front desk to request options, I was told to go online. (she assumed I was paying $12/day for in-room internet). when I explained I had no internet, she told me to come to the lobby and use their computer. really? ammenities 1 vending machine in the whole hotel, overpriced mini-bar or over-priced gift shop. you can't walk to anything so they have you at their mercy. "free wifi" in the lobby? yeah, but only an hour and you have to agree to pay for overtime when signing in. wifi in room? nope, but you can pay $12/day for wired service. bottom line if you've got a car, you might be fine here. if you're walking, you'll feel trapped and taken advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again & again!”
Reviews.Author: Engineer54
Reviews.Content: Great views of the marina. Very accomodating staff. Need a car. Not really within walking distance to attractions.

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: tll3
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and have to say it was one of the nicest stays I've had in San Diego over my last 8 years of visiting there monthly on business. Ive stayed in a little nicer hotels but the customer service and staff far out weight the luxuries of a very select few I have visited. I cant say enough about the staff, managers, waiters, and bartenders at this hotel. Its hard to find a hotel staff who treat you like your on vacation as cater to your every need. Keep up the good work and ill be back soon and suggest you to all my traveling companions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay... could be better”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: My stay here was just fine. It was not great it was not horrible. I can say what I did not like most about this hotel was the fact that it does not have wireless in the room. What year is it? Seriously.... wireless should be standard in all business hotels. The room was fine... it was not bad, it was not amazing. The location, while has some great views... is so far away from the city. Its not within walking distance of anything... beyond the airport. The gym was really nice and the pool looked great. Would I stay here again... it all depends. If my event was at the hotel, I guess I would stay here again. Thus I say I would recommend this hotel. However, would I choose to stay here again, no.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with GREAT staff!”
Reviews.Author: superstorm
Reviews.Content: We took our 3 yr old to San Diego the last week of June and stayed at this hotel. Hotel is adequately furnished. The hotel staff was excellent, always accommodating and helpful. We requested a refrigerator to store my son's milk, etc. It was promptly provided. A couple of months later the hotel charged my c/c for the fridge and removed it once I complained that a charge was never communicated to me. Very happy with their service.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay at Priceline prices”
Reviews.Author: adesmar123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton marina 10/2- 10/25 ( 4 nights). There are two properties on site- the Bay and the Marina towers. Both are nice, we stayed int eh Bay tower. I think those are the Priceline rooms. The room was Sheraton quality. The staff was great. all went well. There is a $22 per night parking charge though. So make sure you keep that in mind. The hotel is well situated near the airport, with an ongoing complementary airport shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandomTravels123
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that will nickel and dime you to death than this place is for you. $18 a day for in room internet access is robbery, hell Motel 6 offers free in room internet. Sure you can use their "Internet Lounge" in the lobby for free if you don't mind the lack of privacy when trying to conduct sensitive business matters. No in room refrigerator, oh sure they could bring me one for $15 a day; wow the operating cost might be all of .50 cents a day, what a joke. Let’s talk mini bar, I know only the truly desperate use these things but $4 for 4oz bag of pretzels, $24 for mini bottle of wine, really? If you bring a car they will be charging you $28 a day to park it there, insane. My room did have a nice view if you don't mind the sliding door rattling from who knows what all night. I fixed that with the notepad from the desk stuffed in between the sliders, nice. You may be wondering if I notified the staff, well no they probably would have wanted $ to look at it and the note pad was the only free thing in the room. When I made my reservation I requested a king bed (traveling with my wife) but when we got to the room it had 2 twins. I called the front desk to ask for room with a king and was told they are all booked but should have something the next day and they would call me to get me into a different room, needless to say I never got a call oh well probably would have wanted more money for that as well. I had a standard room where I got a conference rate of $200 a night (regular rate of the street is around $250) There is absolutely no way I would pay that if I was making the trip on my own dime. One last thing, if don’t mind taking a cab everywhere you go or taking the hotel shuttle to the airport to catch a city bus than you would be happy with the location because there is absolutely nothing within walking distance of this place. You’ve been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: baracegirl
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through Priceline and have to admit that I was somewhat hesitant after reading other reviews. However, I found my stay in the Bay Tower at the San Diego Sheraton to be extremely pleasant. All staff members were friendly and helpful. I had a room in the Bay Tower looking out to the bay. The view from my balcony was incredible and the room was nice and the bed extremely comfortable. Steve in the Bay Tower Lounge was great as was Lucia who I saw each morning in the Bay Tower restaurant while I was having breakfast. Both these employees are definitely an asset to Sheraton. I would definitely stay at this hotel again when I visit San Diego on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: Campedo
