I was however disappointed with the level of service as this particular property. Many times people would try to contact me at the hotel and no one would pick up at reception. In addition when I tried to contact someone at reception it took a few calls before anyone picked up as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: darrin90254
Reviews.Content: Accomodations, customer service, meals, and surrondings were excellent. Views form the rooms give an ice view of the amrina and pools. If your interested in being close to the airport - Perfect-, if not, this hotel might not be the ulitmamte choice.

Reviews.Title: “There are plenty of other hotels by the sea”
Reviews.Author: ShameOnSheraton
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I was surprised to learn the hotel charges $22/night for parking. This charge was not clearly disclosed prior to check-in and comes across to me as tacky. On the third night of my stay, I came back to my room to find my keycard did not work. I headed down to the lobby and learned the hotel staff had mis-booked our stay and believed we had checked out that day. The staff member who assisted us seemed friendly enough, and assured us that the problem had been taken care of. Yet the very next morning the hotel folio had been slipped under the door and showed us checking out that day! I'm tolerant of one such mistake, but after an issue has been brought to the staff's attention and the same mistake is made the following day, I made the decision to never return to this hotel. To top it off, since the hotel staff messed up our check out date, we did not receive housekeeping during part of our stay. All in all, it was a disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to marina, airport, short ride to downtown”
Reviews.Author: MikeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel almost walking distance from the airport with a surprisingly beautiful setting near the marina. Service was typical/good for a well run large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: zenatom
Reviews.Content: The down side: Rough start with shuttle and check in. After waiting 30 minutes at the airport, I was glad to see the shuttle arrive. Unfortunately, the shuttle didn't stop but continued on. Finally took a taxi as I didn't want to wait another 30 minutes. On check in, the attendant asked if I was standing in the right spot (how would I know the shuttle didn't stop if I wasn't in the correct pick up place??). Room wasn't ready even though it was after 3pm. Was told they would call me when the room was ready. After 2 hours, I stood in the check in line again to inquire if the room was ready. Yes, the room was ready. I did get a call 30 minute later that my room was ready. Had a package sent to the hotel which the hotel staff stated didn't arrive. After phone calls to my secretary and delivery service verifying the package did arrive at the hotel and was signed for by the hotel staff, the hotel was finally able to locate my package. Package arrived damaged but I don't think that was the hotel's fault. I was charged a $5 "handling fee" which I thought was tacky since they obviously didn't handle the package effectively. Positive: Except for the transportation and check in process, the rest of the hotel stay was uneventful. Room was clean. Bed comfortable. Nice view of the bay. Wait staff in the restaurant was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Temi659
Reviews.Content: My first time in SanDiego, CA. The environment was simply breathtaking! I enjoyed the views, the service, the courtesy of the workers, and the assistance received as needed. The weather was simply perfect, in the 60s, coming from an almost 100 degree environment. The hotel was clean, the food was good, and I enjoyed the vouchers too. Thanks for good customer service, way to go! Hope to be back. JA

Reviews.Title: “Other than weather enjoyed San Diego”
Reviews.Author: airellis
Reviews.Content: My only complaint would be when I checked in I was advised that I had booked a room with a king size bed (not the double I thought I had). I wasn't going to let that bother me; besides checking in on July 4th before the fireworks > well I was in a hurry to see the amazing show. Now that I'm home and reviewed my confirmation I did indeed book the double > given that I have confirmation of same you would think the front desk would also and not make it like its my mistake if thats all they had left; the hotel was packed due to the long weekend. I found the hotel very clean and other than the minor mix up with the front desk (seems to be a problem with this hotel given the other comments) I enjoyed my week. The weather was totally unexpected; but not Sheratons fault. I met some friendly locals who were as surprized by the cold weather as I. I loved the location near the airport. Also had a great view of the Navy base. If back in San Diego I'd stay here again; but bring my confirmation in order to avoid check in mix ups.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: TNTWesternAustralia
Reviews.Content: Check in was a bit slow, but not really an issue, we had to remind them that we had Club room access as they forgot which would have meant we couldnt access the Club Lounge, but we got that sorted so was ok. The room was quite small compared to all the other hotels we had stayed at in the US on our holiday, in saying that though the decor was very nice, the room was clean the bed was very comfy and the view was great. One issue which was not the hotels fault really but would have liked some kind of announcement to have been made, after checking in we experience a 5.4 earthquake, was in our room sitting on the bed this was very scary to me as we dont experience these hardly at all where we live, as I said not the hotels fault but a phone call or some sort of PA annoucement would have be been good. Walked down 12 flights to the lobby, as lifts automatically shut down which is expected and the lobby was caotic, quite alot of flustered guests and not really any hotel staff around. Apart from that was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected with a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelor03
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, The desk person wrote my rm number illegibly on my key packet & gave me incorrect directions to my rm. Wandered a few floors trying to guess what my rm number could be. Called the desk & they told me they couldn't tell me my rm # over the phone-I'd have to trasp back to the front desk with all my luggage to find out. AC didn't work in rm- it remained 73-76' despite the thermostat being set at 65. Reported this to front desk with no response. Food was mediocre & I didn't get the right items on my order. I never got another pre order breakfast slip after the 1st day. My room cleaning got skipped 1 day. When I called to report it, there were no offers to rectify it, so I had to put forth the question of at least getting some new towels. No map of the hotel grounds in hotel info booklet. I had to wander around to find the entrance to the fitness center ( which was only on the outside), etc. Never found what would be considered the Business center Outside staff were very attentive- about the only plus for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but isolated from resturaunts/entertainment”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSteve81
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty clean except for a few long black hairs in the bathroom which shouldn't be there for a hotel of this level. The location is isolated from entertainment. It is located right on the marina which is very nice. If you want to go anywhere it's gonna run 10 dollars minimum for a taxi to grab a bite to eat. Also, you'll pay $12 a day for internet in your room. And $12 if you take a drink from the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “Rediscover?....recommend Rethink before deciding to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Room1413
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of the hotel was a disappointment. Hotel is across from the airport and convenient but so is the Hilton. This property was remodeled but is poorly ran and highly inefficient. I waited nearly a half an hour to check In and was only sixth in line. Upon arrival, there was no one at the front desk and after ten minutes, someone came from the back room and after that, another one for spg guests. The spg gold/platinum person was so slow that the regular person was averaging 5:1 over the spg gold person. As a platinum, I gave up and joined the regular line. After you get the keys and a parking pAss to pay 22 dollars to park in a dirt lot, I was left to my own to find the elevators. There are many elevators and most likely, you will end up o. The wrong elevator like I did. I guess this is how they greet guests or show them the workout room by lugging their luggage in a quest for the room. I have stayed at every star wood property in San Diego and this is by far the worst. They even give you one less in room coffee pack than all of the other Sheraton properties. The rooms are nice with warm rooms nut a lot of hall noise and is not quiet. Also, if you are friendly like me, prepare yourself to be ignored when greeting hotel employees with a friendly hello...I greeted two folks and neither responded. I don't think this property is very kid friendly although they have A pool. To my platinum colleagues, the only amenity the property offers is points so do not expect anything else. This has to be my 45th starwood stay this year and by far the worst...so no need to rediscover or even return.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReneMoore
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by saying all of the gentlemen outside the hotel were very nice and welcoming. The bellman was readily available and the valet employees always came out to open my door when returning from a cab ride. Outside their doors, they provide a great 4-star experience. The service inside; however was not as pleasant. The check-in wait time was very long and there was only 1 person at the desk for the majority of the time during my 5 day stay. This was very inconvenient and time consuming for anything I needed that required assistance from the front desk staff. I tried several times calling the front desk from my room and never got an answer. Room service took forever and I never received fresh towels for my room. I paid the extra $50/night for a Club Room which should provide "upgraded amenities" such as a one of the top to floors with "breathtaking views of the city", terry bathrobe, bathroom magnifying mirror, access to the club lounge, etc. No robe or magnifying mirror and the club lounge could only be accessed from 1 set of elevators on the opposite side of the hotel from my room (which wasn't on one of the top 2 floors). Of course I figured this out after 25 minutes of searching because no one answered the phone at the front desk. I could go on but those were my biggest issues with the hotel. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: eightkids
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights for a business conference. Check-in was terrible, and I found out two days into my stay that my credit card was charged double the intended amount, This was a major inconvience (it was the only money I had). The hotel manager provided accomidations for me to eat the rest of my stay. I am back home and my credit card issue is still not resolved. I have several overdraft fees along with checks that did not clear. I missed a whole day of the conference that I was supposed to attend, tring to resolve the problem with the front desk. I was so upset my blood pressure was elevated, and I had to take medication. This was a nightmare. I can say that the view from my room was very nice and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Enough with the texting!”
Reviews.Author: builderswife5
Reviews.Content: We just finished our stay at the Sheraton and we were very pleased with the hotel and service. Our only complaint was that the pool attendants spent more time texting than playing with the kids. The two helpers called the kids over to play a golf game that took about 4 minutes and then the helpers sat back down. I asked if the helpers were going to play a game with the kids and they said in about an hour they would maybe play another game. It would have been nice if the helpers could have played tag... with the kids.We have stayed at several beach hotels that have been kid friendly and fun for the kids. Sheraton didn't go the distance and the kids have asked not to return to this hotel. They said it was boring and there was nothing to do. I do not recommend this hotel if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy With the Management”
Reviews.Author: luvthesun66
Reviews.Content: Check in took over 30 Min. We checked in on Friday before the 4th of July holiday weekend. You would think they would have more than one person checking in, but she was very nice and did apologize for the wait. The room was great with a wonderful view. 4th of July fire works were amazing! We stayed three nights and never had any hot water. Other than that we enjoyed the room (bay tower 4th floor) . Checking out-not so great! The rate we were quoted when booking the room was some how changed to $50 more a night. The manager on duty did NOTHING to change my rate and said that's what it is and offered a print out of the rate SHE has. After checking out I spent 45 min on the phone with cental reservation, who were the ones I booked my stay with. Come to find out when I called to confirm my room and rate 4 days before some how the rate was changed. I was told to call the mgr and they will fix it. I called to speak with the same mgr I spoke with when I checked out and she said sorry it's still $50 more a night and I must have changed something when I called to confirm. Hummm...wouldnt I know that? And no, I didn't change anything. She said she couldn't help me and would have to speak with her mgr and would return my call the next day. Mind you all of this is still being done on my vacation. Back at home the next day, I still haven't heard anything. I call the same mgr at the hotel and asked her why I haven't heard back from her. She said she will go ahead and correct the bill since she doesn't want to go "round and round" with me. Pretty shady considering she told me she couldn't make any changes the day before. Hopefullly when the bill comes in it will have the correct rate quoted charged. If it wasn't for the rate issue and the way the management handled it poorly, I would have gone back.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful and Upgraded room with wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: LeahC0926
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room on the San Diego Zoo website the morning of our stay but when I arrived at check-in the staff could not find my reservation. However, they solved the problem immediately and upgrade our room to one with "a view". The room was very nice, clean and comfy. I really enjoyed the balcony looking out on the marina bay! The staff was helpful with all types of questions about various sightseeing locations. Upon check out they did say I would be charged for the parking which should have already been prepaid but upon checking my bank statement when I arrived home, everything had worked out in the end. Thanks for a wonderful stay and I will definitely checkout more Sheraton locations during future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: laurasmurfy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the July 4th weekend. The hotel is okay.. It's not luxurious or fancy and it didn't really meet our expectations - especially at the price ($229 + taxes + $28 parking each day). We stayed in the Bay Tower and had an amazing view for the fireworks - that's the best part. The bathrooms are clean enough but not well maintained... Iron spots/rust in the tub..grungy corners.. just generally looking a little old and worn. For the price, we hoped for a really comfortable, clean, superior hotel experience. That's not this hotel. We also had problems with housekeeping.. We left Saturday at 9:30 to visit Old Town and came back at 2:30 and they still hadn't cleaned our room.. but we had to put our son down for his nap so we couldn't wait for them to clean it then.. and housekeeping leaves at 4pm so we didn't get our room cleaned at all. (Should have requested the $5 "greener" credit for that day in hindsight!) The parking fee is ridiculous too.. like everyone else says. Unless we want the amazing 4th of July fireworks view, we won't be staying here again. There's a slew of other hotels downtown that are cheaper and/or able to meet our vacation expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Plastic in the food & Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: HappyHBMom
Reviews.Content: What was supposed to be a fun family vacation mixed in with some work turned out to be a hue disappointment. When I booked the room I was presented with photos and reviews of all the outstanding renovations. When we arrived we were quickly told we would be a the “other” tower. The bayside tower was not what we had seen or booked. Not wanting to make a big deal about it we checked in. It took 25 minutes before the desk answered my call to bring up our luggage. By that time my husband had self parked our car, gotten a coffee and made his way back to our room only to have to turn around and go get our luggage himself. We went to meet my sister in law who we were traveling with who was in the Marina Tower for dinner. We went to Quinns as the other restaurant was not open?? In our order of fish and chips we were served a piece of deep fried plastic that was still attached to the fish. My husband nearly choked on it thinking it was a bone! Our waitress did her best but she was missing in action most of our meal. When the Manager did come over he offered to comp the dish. Unfortunately, not wanting to make a scene in front or our 2 small children we said okay. Needless to say, the meal was ruined for everyone and no one finished their meals. $90.00 for food no one could eat and service that was unacceptable. We went back to our hotel and the next morning my husband woke up with a huge bug bite on his leg, when we pulled back the sheets on the bed bugs flew out. We were able to catch one to show to the Operations Manager and bug guy. My husband still has the bite on his leg and it’s been over a week we have been home. We were moved to the Main Tower and upgraded to a mini suite with $100 Sheraton money but we were paying $300 a night to get fed plastic and to get bit by bed bugs!!! Unacceptable. I would not and will not recommend your hotel to personal or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST TREATMENT I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shuggapus
Reviews.Content: I experienced the worst treatment from management and housekeeping..... It took management 35 minutes at check-out to come to try to address the issues. I still had to call the corporate office to get the issue resolved.... almost missing my flight in the process.. find a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bay tower property just OK. Monitor your bill carefully for over charges”
Reviews.Author: FREDLOW1
Reviews.Content: My stay at this property did not get off to a great start. At check-in upon hearing I booked the room through a third party, E.G. Expedia, Priceline, Hotwire, I was told I would be in the Bay tower and not the main Marina tower. They claim it one property but it is two. Dont be fooled by the web site as the amenities at the bay tower are poor. Pool tiny, fitness center a joke (a couple of cardio machines and some dumbells). The main marina tower has 2 pools and a proper fitness center. It has the nice restaurants and the Starbucks. The main tower offers movies by the pool at night (Weekends) and has other fun daily pool activities. Bay tower nothing. You feel like a second class citizen and not worthy of the Sheraton name. The one redeeming quality of both properties is the view. Rooms are average sized at best but was clean and oder free. Bathroom was small and the toilet was loud and sounded like a cruise ship toilet and toilets flushing can be heard through out your stay. Balcony was nice with a view of the bay. Beds and pillows were comfy. On my last night they slipped my statement and it said everything was paid in full and was Charged $288. As my room was pre paid I was not too happy with what I saw. I went to reception and they corrected the problem. Just beware every person ahead of me had a problem with over charging. From a 70 year old man being charged for the entire contents of his mini bar (apparently he bumped into it) to another person being charged for an extra day. I would only recommend this place because of the location but thats it. Finally please keep in mind this review is based on my stay in the bay tower. I might have had a better time at the main property.

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: Jamii
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is a nice hotel with a nice view, but the rooms are too small. We stayed here as part of a wedding party; otherwise, we would have gone somewhere cheaper. They didn't give a very good group rate. Of course, parking was $20 plus a day, but that is becoming more common. The annoying fee was to have internet in your room. It's free in the lobby but not in your room. At over $200/night just give us internet access please. also, you couldn't put your own drinks in the firdge; otherwise you were charged. They have mini fridges to rent, but it's another fee. Food and drink was over priced for the value. Our air conditioning didn't work in our room, but we just left the window open and enjoyed the breeze. Amazingly the gym was free and that's awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Club benefits a joke-10 people in line for breakfast & staff clears buffet”
Reviews.Author: footloosefancyfree47
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Starwood Preferred Guest experience I have had. The designated reception counter was cold and uninterested in being helpful. I was traveling with my son and Grandsons and although we took 2 rooms for 2 nights after a booking error in the secondary building the only rooms we could get were on the club floor. They were lovely rooms but the $50 surcharge/per room for the club was a joke. Breakfast was served until 9:30 and when they ran out of food(coffee, toast, cream, milk, etc. at 9:15 they were reluctant and slow to replace and then at 9:29 with 10 people in llne they cleared the buffet. The computer did not work and the staff was unhelpful, indifferent and dismissive. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Secondary Location, Crazy Add-On Charges, Plastic Cups, no SPG benefit”
Reviews.Author: ChuckC
Reviews.Content: Against my better judgment I booked this Harbor Island property which is well away from where the center of San Diego's enjoyable nightlife has relocated. The staff was pleasant in every way, but too many things weren't great, for example: * despite paying $279 my room looked out on a gravel rooftop * there were plastic drinking cups (think Holiday Inn) in the bathroom * no wireless Internet and $18.95/day charge to connect * $22 for one night to park my own car in an uncovered lot * $21 for a breakfast buffet * no acknowledgement for being Starwood Gold, and no benefits offered With taxes, the Internet, parking and my typical buffet breakfast the tab for one night was $355. Sorry, but that's way too much for just an average property in a secondary location.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Much Better”
Reviews.Author: LadyRedbone08
Reviews.Content: The Marina Tower Townhouse was a surprise upgrade. Well appointed rooms and bathroom but what had us not wanting to go back was the service and valet fees of $28 and the late check out charge of $10/hour after noon. WOW!! And we are Starwood Members. We previously stayed at the Bayview Tower for our first honeymoon and it is by far better. Even with this upgrade the Bay Tower was just off the charts and just a better property. Seems as if things have gone down since 2004. Called to the front desk on several occasions and no one ever picked up the phone. We absolutely love San Diego but will stick with our Marriott family of hotels or the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “My suggestions-Jonathan Christian”
Reviews.Author: goodwind45
Reviews.Content: More counter top room in bathroom will help Not enough place to hang clothes in the bathroom Better exhaust fan in bathroom will help Hair dryer could be mounted on the wall Selves could be added to put towels and other items Room service was very good Thank you

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL and VERY CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: jolenece
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Harbor Island Drive took my breath away the moment I stepped into the lobby and then again the moment we got into our room. Everything about the room made me comfortable. I loved the white comforter. So clean,thus when its very white and remained white, you know the hotel actually is very clean. Very white towels, white sheets--just made me feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: Phxnative
Reviews.Content: I went on priceline put in a bid for a four star hotel for $100/night. I really didn't think I would get anything, but this came in. I was pretty excited at first, until I read the reviews. I figured for what I paid a night it would be worth it. They put us in the marina tower, and just like the other reviews, this is a bit older tower and not as nice as the main one but it had great views! The beds are comfortable and clean. The only wierd thing is the towlets have the loudest flush I have ever heard. You can hear when other rooms flush them too. We had a little airplane noise, but not too bad. We ended up falling asleep on the balcony one night, it was very relaxing. We had a car and the location was perfect for us, since we spent alot of time cruising the bay. All in all, if you can pay $100 a night like we did, it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Too many add on charges”
Reviews.Author: cinredsfan1975
Reviews.Content: The room was OK. The view was terrific and the location was good. The beds were too hard and uncomfortable. The real problem, however, was the add on charges that just kept piling up. $22 a day to park is ridiculous. $11 a day for internet is even more ridiculous, especially considering it isn't wireless or high speed. There are no vending machines, or if there are they make them impossible to find, and the prices for the in room refrigerator are unbelievable. And room service-$16 for pancakes. Come on! You people need to go out in the real world. Even Super 8 has free high speed wireless internet. This hotel is really about a two star that is trying to act like(and charge like) its a five star.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely perfect! beautiful hotel and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: isabelyoung
Reviews.Content: Just returned 2 days ago after spending our last 6 nights of Californian trip at the Sheraton Hotel and marina.I cannot believe the negative reviews because we thought this was the best hotel of our trip!!The whole hotel has a wonderful ambience,beautifully decorated and the beds are so very comfortable.We were upgraded to the club floor so could have breakfast every morning in the club lounge with its panoramic views of both the marina and the San Diego skyline.There was no airport noise in our room when the balcony door was closed plus the planes do not fly at night so can`t imagine how people could be kept awake!i can`t recommend this hotel enough and will certainly recommend it to anyone going to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GailFin
Reviews.Content: I am so surprised as I read some of the previous negative reviews. I stayed here for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed my visit. The hotel is conveniently located to many of the tourist sites which made it easy to tour after our conference. The service at the restaurant was excellent. The waitstaff was prompt, attentive, warm and friendly. They made me feel like they really cared whether I enjoyed my meal or not. We used valet parking and received our car within minutes of our request. The valet staff was courteous and again friendly. In fact every hotel staff person that I dealt with was extremely helpful. Everyone greeted me when I passed them and always looked me in the eye which made me feel like they were really focused on me. The ambiance of the hotel was lovely. The comfortable seating areas in the lobby were great for socializing and relaxing. There were computers available for guests which helped me a great deal. The decks and patios were lovely to sit on to gaze at the beautiful view of the marina. In the evening it was so nice to sit outside at one of the fire pits and relax in a rocking chair in the cool San Diego night air. My room was on the ground floor which made me a little nervous because of the sliding glass door. Therefore, I didn't open the drapes. I would have liked to have let light in but it was too easy for anyone to see inside the room since I faced the parking lot. I would have preferred a view of the marina and a room higher up. However, the room was clean, comfortable, quiet, and had a cheerful decor. I was surprised that being so close to the airport, I rarely heard a plane. Maybe being downstairs was a plus! I enjoyed my stay here and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in this Sheraton property”
Reviews.Author: Mini2010
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Bay Tower. Hotel parking is very limited and costly. The room was nice until you start to hear the noise around bedtime. Toilet flushed like a cruise ship and you could also hear the bathroom noise from other guests. Airport noise was not too bad, not much can be done about that. I have stayed at other Sheraton properties and have been pleased with the hotel. This property to me does not measure up to the name. Staff was nice at both towers and friendly, no complaints there. They should not charge for internet use. Other lower priced properties don't charge. I was very disappointed about the $11.95 fee.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbugluv30
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here prior to our visit to Sea World. We stayed on the Club Level and our room had a wonderful view of downtown San Diego. Most of the staff we encountered was very friendly. The room itself was clean and the beds were awesome. We enjoyed being able to open the balcony door and the view was fantastic. In other reviews people complained about airport noise , we were able to sleep just fine. The only thing that we were concerned about was that pets were allowed in the hotel and my husband is allergic to pets. I did not see on the website that the hotel was pet friendly and if I had known that I would of put a note in the reservation to make sure that we were not in a room that just had a pet in it. The lobby had nice places to sit and relax however we preferred to be outside. The weather was lovely and they were showing a movie in the pool area the night we arrived. The fitness center was a nice feature that had adequate amount of treadmills, stationary bikes and weight equipment. They also have two ping pong tables so that the kids and adults can play. The pool area was very cute and clean when we went the next morning. If you book in the Club Level you are given access to the Club Lounge the next morning which provides you a nice continental breakfast. If you are able to get a good deal on the Club Level it is worth the upgrade. I think it is a great hotel for families who can splurge on a nice weekend get away or vacation. The only negative is the parking, if the hotel is full you might have a hard time finding parking closer to your tower. Not everyone might enjoy the long walk from the parking lot to their building. In addition, the parking is a $22.00 fee and I would hope that the management would improve the parking situation. P.S. Be ware of the Mini Bar in the room, I had already read about and had even requested them to empty it out. However, when I got to the room the Bellman even advised us to becareful with the mini bar. If the sensor is messed with they will charge you for the mini bar. I opened the cabinet door and found that the mini bar had not been emptied.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! We sure enjoyed our stay at this hotel! We will be coming back! They Love Dogs Too!”
Reviews.Author: JusTravlinThru
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked at the Sheraton Harbor Marina Tower (the largest of the two Sheraton's on Harbor Island). We got the "Romance Package" and stayed in the Marina Suite. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious, very clean and had a picture postcard view of Downtown San Diego. We were even impressed that we barely heard the planes taking off and landing at the San Diego Airport which is just about 1/4 mile away. The bed was very comfortable. We slept so well. Also, the newly decorated room was very nice. Probably most important for us was that they welcomed our dog with no added charge and no fuss. Sure they wanted us to be responsible for our little guy, but it was nice that we felt welcome. There was even a very nice restaurant on the island called the "C-Lounge" that welcomed him on their patio. The view of the city at night was breathtaking from the restaurant's vantage point. Now back to the Romance Package, it was a great value. The complementary "breakfast in bed" EACH DAY was impressive. We ordered off of the menu what we wanted and had deliciously prepared FULL breakfasts delivered to the room both days we stayed there. Then on our anniversary night we got a complementary bottle of champagne and 6 huge chocolate covered strawberries. Finally, they offered us a very late checkout of 4pm, which we gladly used. We enjoyed every minute of time just relaxing on one of the two balconies overlooking the city, sail boats and Navy ships on the bay. The only downsides were that daily self-parking was $22.00 and in-room high speed internet was $11.95 per day (up to $18.95 for super fast internet). NO WIRELESS IN ROOM, BUT FREE WIRELESS IN THE LOBBY. This is pretty steep compared to other properties we've stayed at. But we felt that, given the total value of the package we booked, it was ok. WE WILL BE BACK and I heartily recommend this property for your next vacation! We did not experience any of the negatives in service mentioned by other folks who stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has gone downhill in the past 2 years!”
Reviews.Author: MemomSacramento
Reviews.Content: This hotel had many problems. No one answered the phone--operator, room service, guest service...NO ONE! They have NO towel bars in the bathroom yet encourage going green and reusing towels--that can NOT be hung up! They had an earthquake and we were swaying on the 8th floor, but when I went down the elevator to find out if we might be evacuated as they were 2 months ago the staff said they NEVER evacuated! Lying to guests is not good customer service--and they had no idea what to say to all the concerned guests!! The consierges were wonderful and the restaurant staff, but the rest of the hotel NOT too great!!!

Reviews.Title: “I was rather disappointed by this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: catraveler1234
Reviews.Content: I was rather disappointed by this hotel. The location and views were great but that is were the positives end. The bed was very comfortable, but there were what appeared to be blood stains on our sheets. The cleanliness of the hotel I would say to be below average and our shower curtain was also stained pink at the bottom. But, the worst aspect of the hotel had to be the noise. It was the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at. I felt like I was in a college dorm again. I don't know if it was the guests that were there when we were or that their walls and windows are paper thin, but it made for a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JoHouston
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel with a great rate thru Hotwire, but when reading the reviews I was a little concerned with the location since I was not renting a car. But taxis were always available at the hotel and for the tourist spots we hit, the rate averaged 8 to 13 dollars. The zoo being the most at 17.00. All the tourist spots we hit had taxis waiting outside so you never had to wait for one. This was perfect for my daughter and I. There were also concerns after reading the reviews that we were booked at the Bay Tower and not the Marina Tower. That was not a big deal either. After being gone from 8 am to 10 pm every night it didn't matter to us. When we were driving back to the hotel you come to the Marina Tower first. My daughter and I would stop there and go to their bar/restaurant and sit outside and have a drink. Then we would catch the shuttle that seemed to always be there when we were ready to go and it would take us to the Bay Tower. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful too. Very important when you are from out of town and trying to figure out where to go and how to get there. Hotel was clean. They offer 5 dollar vouchers to not remake your room everyday. We used one every morning for breakfast at the restaurant at the Bay Tower. We thought this was really a nice place to stay. We wanted to go to La Jolla and w/o a car it would have been expensive by taxi. There is a visitor information center down by the Harbor who can give you any information you need to get around. We went to Seaport Village and they have a booth that sells all kinds of combination tickets at a discounted price. We bought a Seal Tour, Midway tour and zoo as a package and saved money. All in all a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lorna Alagar ~ excellent customer service..she keeps you coming back to the Sheraton Hotel in San Diego, Ca.”
Reviews.Author: MsIsley
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and it's always great to have excellent customer service. And, from time to time, you will cross path with an individual that truly cares about their job. Lorna Alagar at the Sheraton Hotel & Marina in San Diego, CA will make you feel great about your day and your visit. She took a terrible day that I was having and turned it around into a positive. Her calm demeanor and professionalism is impeccable. What a great asset to this hotel. Thank you Lorna Alagar for simply just being you. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “I doubt that I will ever return”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I am a pretty seasoned traveler and have stayed in dozens of hotels in the last 10 years. Sheraton San Diego had the distinction of being the first hotel that I ever found a live bug (identified by my 11 year old cousin) crawling in the bedding and also the first where I found hair in the bathroom AND no soap when I entered the room. We got our breakfast comped because of the bug incident, but not much was done about the hair other than it was cleaned while I was gone. Room was actually nice, front desk personnel very friendly, but those two incidents stick out. I must also say, although this has little to do with the hotel, that I was disappointed with Priceline because this is listed as a downtonw/Gas Lamp hotel, and this is hardly the case. It is a $12 cab ride to that area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet for being by an airport”
Reviews.Author: OUMOM
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, quiet and clean hotel close to airport. A little further than I wanted from the things we did. There is no trolley stops at or near this hotel, so you would need a car or take a taxi. It is approx. 3 - 5 miles from downtown gas lamp quarters. If you rent a car be prepared to pay $28 a day to park it at hotel, a little pricey if you ask me! No restaurants or shopping within walking distance. Hotel restaurant very pricey! When we checked in there were dirty dishes outside the room on the floor from previous guests that stayed there for 4 out of our 6 days there, complained three times before they finally picked them up. Overall hotel experience was great! If you drive to downtown be prepared to pay $20 to park. Seaworld is great, but spend the whole day as there is alot to see and do. Do not waste your money on the zoo. Definitely go to the USS Midway Museum. If you have a rent car to to LaJolla Beach and see the baby seals that hang out there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: neilstersteve
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business purposes. This hotel is very clean and comfortable. Has all the ammenties I need. Received a good rate through Resorts Plus International. Plan on staying here again on a future business trip....great hotel and the boss even approved of the low rate I received!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mhayduk
Reviews.Content: I was originally concerned with this Hotel because it was so close to the airport but it was beautfiul, spacious and had a perfect location.. When you got to hotel it was very big and felt more like a resort than a hotel. We had a great view from our room of the marina. We stayed in the Marina tower, which is newer and everythign seems to be in this section. (Starbucks, Restaurants, gift shop, pools, gym) Rooms were totally updated, with nice bedding and very clean. I would def stay here again and recommend to a friend. If you are debating this or right downtown, this is a really nice hotel, cab to downtown is $11 and you have more room and a Big pool. I dont think you will get that downtown. Also "The Link" which is there computer/social area is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssimon1999
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the night of our arrival into San Diego as we were landing late in the night. The shuttle was easy and the hotel is across the street from the airport. It is a large hotel that is clean and upper scale. The rooms were comfortable and the beds were really nice. I got a great rate on this hotel of $120 through the hotel's website, which I thought was a deal, especially since is was not through priceline or expedia, etc. I woudl stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: emmd_9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently booked this hotel thru a Priceline special for $99 a night when most four star hotels were charging $250 per night due to the marathon. We were very pleased with the choice. The hotel is a short cab ride ($15) to the Gaslamp area. There is a nice shuttle to pick up/drop off near the airport. We didnt stay in the main tower but this wasn't a problem as we still had a pretty view of the marina, and a huge room. The room was clean, nicely decorated, and very comfortable. While it is close to the airport this was not a problem as the airport seems to be situated near most everything so the noise would have been a factor anywhere. I only heard the planes a couple times and it never bothered our sleep. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: barefootsusan
Reviews.Content: For over a year we planned a family vacation with all of our children, their spouses and the grandchildren. The rooms were great, and we all had a wonderful time. The check in was easy and the staff courteous, the restaurant food was good and they were very accomodating to our large group. It was easy access to the airport, downtown and other attractions like the zoo and legoland.Also easy access to walking by the bay. Thank you for a wonderful reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for GATOR by the BAY always Mother's Day Weekend.”
Reviews.Author: beachygirl52
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at this Hotel. It is across the steet from Terminal 2 at the San Diego Airport and they offer a free shuttle. Since it was our Anniversary we decided to stay two nights. I must have mentioned this when I booked the hotel several months in advance. We arrived back to our room about 10 PM on Friday night after attending the The Gator by the Bay Festival. Much to our surprise and delight the Sheraton remembered our 32nd Anniversary with a very nice bottle of wine, a large attractive bowl of fruit with about eight different kinds of fruit. Then to top it off , the most beautiful 8" designer type Anniversary Cake. It made our whole weekend. This hotel would also be a great place to stay if your taking a cruise out of San Diego. They have incredible views, to the east is the famous Coronado Bridge and Coronado Island and to the West is the Marina both with beautiful views of the San Diego Bay. The pool area is really nice and we enjoyed spending the afternoon in the sun and water. Oh yea, and the beds are sooo comfortable. A great place to stay and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for Memorial Day weekend. We got the hotel through a blind bid on Priceline and would have preferred a more downtown hotel (as the bidding area includes both the Downtown and Harbor regions) but at the end of the weekend were very pleased with the Sheraton. We checked in on Saturday evening and were very happy when the woman checking us in gave us a marina view. The hotel was bustling with activity and there were a lot of people using the internet access in the lobby and the Link access they had with a few computer terminals. We walked around the hotel and down the marina a bit and saw the two pools - one of the pool areas was showing The Little Mermaid which was a good idea if you had kids. I believe they have movie showings throughout the summer on Fridays and Saturdays on large screens outdoors. The room was nice with a very comfortable bed and a flat panel TV. The bathroom was on the smaller size but perfectly adequate. There was a balcony with a few lounge chairs that gave us a view of the marina. The hotel is a block away from the airport so if you have a morning or evening flight and want a hotel right near the airport, this is your choice. For the most part we really enjoyed the hotel. The only issue we had was that the parking area is very limited and we had to park in the back area and our car ended up pretty filthy because the back lot isn't paved and is a dirt lot. Considering the parking is $22/night it would be nice if they would at least pave the back lot so I'm not forced to get a car wash after staying there. Also, if you don't have a car you're somewhat limited in places you can go on foot. Overall this is a pretty good hotel and we'd be happy staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Unfortunately Away from All the Action”
Reviews.Author: ggsnaps
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a beautiful 4 star hotel, probably good for conventions or business meetings. I was lucky enough to get the last room in the Marina Tower; I probably would have left had I been booked in the Bay Tower... I hate that "Annex" concept where they have those overflow bldgs that have none of the amenities and niceties of the main bldg. Luckily the lady at the check-in desk saw my face when she said Bay Tower and quickly made the adjustment to the Marina Tower with no complaints. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. My room was small, but very pretty, with gorgeous harbor, bay, downtown views and a balcony! The property was lovely. But huge minus for the location, unfortunately. I was expecting this to be walking distance to the gaslamp and other parts of downtown San Diego, but this is really better described as a very well done airport hotel (the airport is across the street). I'm a walker, and downtown San Diego is such a great walking area, but I had to get in my car to go anywhere. And speaking of car, I thought $22 for parking was quite steep considering the fact that we were not in the heart of downtown to begin with. So,mixed reviews on this place. It's pretty and will prob work if you're a business traveler or looking for something convenient from the airport. But, if you're looking for a place that's in the heart of it all, this is not your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Hotel for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice room that overlooked the water and had a balcony. The room was clean and had a gorgeous view (I think it was the 25th floor). I thought the hotel was centrally located in San Diego and we walked to a lot of restaurants and activities. It has a Starbuck's in the hotel, which is nice. It also has a really, really nice fitness center. I thought check in was good, but check out was a bit of a hassle. The check out machines were down, so we had to wait in the line. However, I have never had good luck with San Diego hotels. I don't know why, but usually I don't have a good experience. This was a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel complex”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, just a few minutes from the airport. Make sure your room is in the main Marina Tower. The room itself was nice, contemporary style, with a balcony facing the water. Good service and prices. I don't think there was any wi-fi internet in the room but I might be wrong. Food in the restaurant is ok, try the seafood salad sandwich. The shuttle bus didn't run as often as I expected. Convenient ticket check-in kiosk in the lobby will save you time at the airport (security lines are long). For a nice dinner with view, try Bertrand at Mr. A.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and value”
Reviews.Author: Zydecolover
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights . The dance festival used this hotel as the host hotel. I enjoyed the great location, free airport shuttle service, good food and the free internet use. The hotel also offers green incentives. I chose njot to have my sheets changes everyday and I received a $5 coupon for any restaurant in the hotel - very worth it!!! The staff was friendly and the spa area was quiet and relaxing - just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Who Ever Said Business Couldn't Be Fun?”
Reviews.Author: mesuzwhoyouz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with several colleagues stayed here for a large software conference in May 2010. What an experience! The first impression left by the front lobby and the staff of the front desk was incredible. Staff members were extremely helpful, courteous, and friendly. The check-in process was a breeze, and our wishes were accommodated. Our room was impeccable as well, and had a stellar view. We rated the beds "very good" only because there is no bed like home; they were very comfortable and inviting. Housekeeping was efficient, friendly, and also accommodating to our needs. The "Green Choice" program offered by the Sheraton is a fabulous idea and is beneficial to the environment while also making the guest feel like they're getting a bargain. I love that there was a Starbucks inside the facility. We tried Quinn's, and enjoyed it, but more, really enjoyed several meals at Papanani's, a little deli/eatery located between the two towers (the prices were very low, food was excellent, and the ambiance was incredible). Additionally, half-way through the week, we found that we had to extend our stay a day; the hotel was very accommodating and gave us the conference rate for the extra day. Parking is a little steep for us East Coasters ($22/day), but we found fairly cheap fares in the shuttles and vans available to hotel guests. Very conveniently located across the interstate from the airport; however, while inside the hotel room itself, we could not hear planes taking off and landing. The SheratonLink in the lobby offered free wireless internet and plenty of cozy seating areas for those who didn't want to pay for in-room services. For our first trip to California, we were very impressed, and would highly recommend the Sheraton San Diego Hotel & Marina for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay with young kid; would stay again”
Reviews.Author: saurin13
Reviews.Content: I was cautious about staying at this hotel because of the number of negative reviews here. I was expecting a motel quality sheraton. Let me also tell you that I went with my wife and a two year old. Overall my stay was pleasant (especially for the price). I would stay again. It is literally walking distance from the airport - but the rooms are well sound proofed, and you cannot hear the planes. Even outside in the pool, we hardly ever heard the planes. The location is pretty good in that it is close to everything (short cab ride, no need to rent a car - we even gave our car back early because it was cheaper to use a taxi). However nothing is walking distance and the onsite restaurants are very expensive ($28 for linguini pomodoro!). The pools are clean and have a lagoon shape, but are not really resort style. but they are not the standard rectangle either. the hotel was clean and the staff friendly. no issues overall. i stayed in the Bay Tower (the one that is by itself). The other tower seemed to have a lot more activity/people, but the rooms were standard sheraton rooms. I had no issues with stains or anything like that. For families - there is a kiddie pool (which is essentially a 1 1/2 foot deep pool for kids the size of a spa). Sea World was $20 each way in taxi. Zoo is even cheaper. Downtown about $15 each way.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: aandjSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Marina for one night prior to our cruise. It was great to have a shuttle from the airport to the hotel although it took a while for it to come even though the hotel is fairly close to the airport. We stayed in the Bay Tower with a view over the harbour. The rooms were large although not in perfect condition. This hotel is a reasonable distance from town. (Approx $15 by taxi). This hotel was fine for one night but you really require a car if staying any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, nice hotel for conference”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1717
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a decent one for a conference- good amenities, close to the airport. Not great food onsite though and getting to downtown or any other parts of San Diego required a cab ride and some time. Beautiful views of the marina and the bay from many rooms. There are actually two buildings, about a five minute walk apart - we were not told this when making our reservation and ended up not staying where our conference was. This wasn't a difficult problem as it was a pleasant walk, but would have been difficult for people with difficulties walking or getting about. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Rooms were standard and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Big Fat Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: DetroitareaKate
Reviews.Content: If you really want to see San Diego and all it has to offer, don't stay here. The description the hotel website gives is a fabrication. There are 2 parts to this hotel- the "hotel" and the "motel". After thinking we were staying in a 4 star hotel with a view, we ended up driving up to our room with an outside door in the motel portion and had a view of a fence and if we looked up, the airport. SUPER disappointing. The girl that checked us in was unfriendly and unwilling to move us or ensure we would get moved the next day. The hotel did move us after the first night, but the view was still not great. The rooms are just ok, but not 4 star quality rooms. It is about a 10 minute drive downtown. There is very little to do in the area where the Shearton is located, yet parking costs $30 per night. San Diego offers SO much... do not stay here. Stay downtown or on Coronado. I was willing to lose my money on our room at the Shearton just to get the heck out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Europeatheart
Reviews.Content: We are repeat visitors here. Spectacular views, surrounded by water on 3 sides, great service and staff, great food and 3 pools to choose from. It is the perfect resort within the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wished I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: LikeToSmile
Reviews.Content: We had a little extra time on our vacation, so we booked a weekend through Hotwire and took our chances. I wasn't real thrilled at first to be booked into this hotel becuase I had stayed here twice before for conventions. The first one I got a room miles from the main tower right next to the swimming pool pump room. The second time I got a room overlooking the parking lot. I was at a convention then, so it wasn't really a big deal, but this was a nice getaway with my hubby. Thanks to other reviews, I knew to ask for the Marina Tower with a Harbor view. I did not use the automated check in system just so that I could request a room with a view. The check in chick was really friendly and gave us a room on the 9th floor facing west over the harbor and marina. The sunsets were fantastic and hubby and I even ordered room service one night just so we could enjoy the view. The room was decorated in a red, white and blue nautical theme. It was very tasteful. We had breakfast one day in the restaurant. It was really nice and we had a nice window table by the marina. The hostess was super nice and our waitress was very efficient. The price was less expensive than I thought it would be. There was a rude dude at the table next to us watching sports on his laptop and talking on his cel phone. We asked him nicely to turn down his computer or use an earpice. He continued to talk on his cell phone. I can't believe these kind of people, but it isn't really a reflection on the hotel. All of the hotel staff seemed exceptionally nice. We even observed some staff trying to help out the UK guests in accomodating them with additional nights and telling them what parks and other places were offering free or reduced admissions for them because of the volcano and ash that caused them to have to stay longer. All in all, I wish I could relive my weekend again in exactly the same way (minus the rude dude at breakfast). The only thing I didn't like was having to pay for parking. I was prepared for it as my reservation clearly stated the price of parking. $22/day isn't bad if it's a covered parking garage, but for a parking lot it's kind of steep, especially when we had to park way out in the dirt/gravel. Five stars all around except for cleanliness and that's only because there was a large urine stain on the down blanket of one of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue, pleasant staff, wonderfully comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: NellBolton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 day en route to a Panama canal cruise. Having read some negative reviews prior to leaving England, we booked in after a 23 hr journey with trepidation! Ok, so the reception seems understaffed & checking in took 20 minutes - but, our room was fine, the view was onto the tennis courts, we thought it may be noisy as it was on the ground floor near the swimming pool - it, was so quiet and the beds were soooo comfortable. In fact the only disruption we had was from noisy americans laughing outside the door at 3am! The food in the bar area was good as was breakfast and the staff so pleasant and helpful, particularly the waitress at breakfast, who went to great pains to introduce all those going on the cruise before we left the restauraunt. Overall we were impressed & thankful that the negative reviews were unfounded. As it is so near to the airport, would definately stay here again and hope for a room on a higher floor .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff but a little bit shabby.”
Reviews.Author: NORDYsouthy
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in Marina Tower on the 6th floor for a week. Location was excellent and taxi's to most attractions such as Sea World, Zoo, Gas Lamp are approx $15 each way. The lobby and grounds are immaculate and first impressions are excellent. Check in was prompt and efficient. The room was a good size but it felt a little shabby due to scuff marks on walls, stained grout around shower, stains on furniture, rusty fire sprinklers, etc. There wasn't one single issue that was enough to complain about, but combined they did take the gloss of the early impressions of the hotel. I also noticed numerous stains on the carpet in the hallways and the ice machine on the 6th floor was out of order for the duration of our stay. I'm not a big fan of Starbucks, but I was glad it was there as the restaurant has a fairly limited breakfast menu and is a little expensive for it's standard. Quinn's pub is a nice place to have a quick meal and a drink. The reason we would return to this hotel is the staff. As it was our first time in San Diego we availed of the concierge desk on a few occasions. The ladies on the desk are fantastic and seemed genuinely happy to help. We would rate the hotel a 4.0 based on our experience. If a little more time was spent ensuring everything worked and was clean the rating would be a 4.5

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: As a traveler of over 150 nights a year, I stay in a lot of hotels. among the many, have been a fair mixing of sheratons across the country (Atlanta, Tampa, Cedar Rapids, Chicago, Minneapolis). NEVER before have I stayed at a Sheraton so glamorous, perfectly detailed and well thought out! Let's get a couple negatives out of the way first: -Front desk is understaffed and slow! Phones sometimes aren't answered promptly. -Over-priced breakfast restaurant. (although cheaper Starbucks is in hotel too!) -Would love to see mini-fridges included in rooms, as the expensive mini-bar is a big turn-off to everybody who isn't still living in the 1980's! -$22.00 a day to SELF-park! Ouch, folks. C'mon! There, that's the bad staff. Now, just a smattering of the numerous great elements of this facility: -Excellently furnished health club, with ping-pong tables outside. -Starbucks in the lobby! -Love the complimentary computers in the stylish lobby "nook" area. -Fun sports bar that seemed to be hopping at night. -UTTERLY FANTASTIC POOL AREA!! Beautiful fountains, and a pool that is one of the largest free form pools I've ever seen (and I've stayed at 4 resorts in Hawaii!) Also a hot tub that literally could seat 20 people comfortably! -Grounds are well-manicured, with rocking chairs strategically placed to view the adjacent marina-yacht club and relax. -Balconies in all rooms are perfect for viewing the yacht club on one side of hotel, or downtown skyline on the other (can't go wrong with either view) -Rooms are comfortable with flat-screen tv's and nautical colors and decor in deep blue, burnt orange, and white. -Gorgeous lobby with wonderful mood lighting and an aquarium about the size of 2 French doors put together! All in all, can't say enough good about this place. Simply loved it and would not only welcome a chance to return, but would go out of my way to make it happen!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelsfortennis
Reviews.Content: We purchased two rooms through Hotwire at a very good price. We were very pleased with the quality of the rooms. We stayed in the Bay Tower. We had a lovely view of the marina. The room was very spacious and pretty. The bed was great with wonderful bedding. In other reviews some stated the hotel was not close to anything. We found it to be within ten minutes of the Gaslamp District and Petco stadium, and a straight shot from our hotel. Also within walking distance of our hotel was a superb restaurant called C Level, which was located on the water. It is so easy to get around San Diego and we loved overlooking the marina from our balcony. Very very close to the airport but the airport is very close to everything else too!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Decent Room, a Bit Over-Priced”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveler007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sufficient for the needs of my wife and myself, but given the price and my wife's SPG status, I would have expected better. We were placed on the 4th floor above the pool, in which we experienced loud enough pool noise to require earplugs to sleep. Although not pleased, we were leaving on a very early flight, thus our decision to stay at this location. The bed was comfortable and bathroom sufficient, but service was lacking. When we asked the Concierge about the airport shuttle, they said we could catch the first shuttle with no problem. As it turned out, we had to wait 2 shuttles before we could get to the airport. The pool area might have been nice, but we did not have time to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel even though I was stuck in a ground floor corner room”
Reviews.Author: CanViking
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel. Great facilities, restaurants and friendly staff. If I have any complaints I have to say paying over $10 per day for interernet is a little steep nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great breakfast, but remote.”
Reviews.Author: Seadog68
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with nice rooms, two good pools. However it isn't close to anything else so you have to drive to downtown. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Sunchaserdebbi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main part of the hotel. We left on a cruise the following day. We had the most fun here. There was 11 of us. We stayed on the fourth floor and I booked the rooms through priceline one month prior to trip. I got them for $75.00 per night per room. The staff was great, food overpriced, but they did offer parking while we were on the cruise for $10.00 per night. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was horrible”
Reviews.Author: travellerut
Reviews.Content: Okay, maybe not the absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I stayed there because my conference was in the hotel. I didn't see any cockroaches. There was no green water coming from the faucet. It has an excellent view of the harbor. And it is very close to the airport. But this hotel was not good at all. First off, the bed was lumpy, which made it hard to sleep. Also problematic for sleeping was that the walls were so thin you could hear anything and everything going on in neighboring rooms, even coughs. This hotel really needs to invest in some soundproofing. The hotel is not within walking distance of anything. You need to take a cab to get anywhere. It wouldn't be so bad if the restaurants in the hotel were really good...they are not horrible but not places I would want to eat every meal for five days. There was a sound akin to that of crickets in the vent. I called the reception to get them to fix it, they said they would come, but never did. I called again and still no action, then gave up.We had to call the reception to get the bathtub unclogged. They did eventually come and got it cleared but the drain was still pretty slow and got worse as the week went on. About half the times we called the reception there was no answer. The concierge was not that helpful. I stayed in the hyatt near the convention center during an earlier conference and oh how I longed to have been staying there as our taxi passed it on our way to restaurants. Anyway, I would suggest staying somewhere else. This is a pricey hotel and from what I gather, you are paying for a nice view and little else.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Sheraton Hotel and Marina”
Reviews.Author: silentbob007
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Sheraton, having once again won the room on Priceline with a 4* bid in the downtown area. I was extremely happy when I arrived at around 11 AM and was immediately given a room. While I was in the Bay Tower last time, this time I was placed in the Marina tower. I was placed in a corner room on the 12th floor. I found this room to be a little smaller than the Bay Tower room, but perhaps a little better appointed. The shower and sink were quite nice. This tower also had much nicer grounds with a nice pool and spa area. The restaurants on premises were, as usual, pricey though had a good view. The on-premises Starbucks was a nice breakfast option if you didn't want to pay for the highly priced buffet breakfast. This hotel also offered some nice services. They have a free airport shuttle that runs on a constant loop about every 20-30 minutes. You can call for the shuttle, but I think it will just show up ... funny thing ... if you do call and select the option for the shuttle in the phone system, it will kick you back to the menu. There is a Microsoft center in the lobby offering free wi-fi and a few free computer terminals with printers. There is a charge for internet in room. The biggest negative for this hotel is probably its location if you want to do anything downtown. I saw a trolley stop, so that may be an option, or you could also take about a $10-15 cab ride downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Octodaddy
Reviews.Content: What's the point of opening a hotel with say, 500 rooms, and not providing a garage to park in? A parking fee of 14 dollars per night is way too much. The rooms are small, smell like shoe freshener and the bathrooms are small with a tiny sink. You're better off staying at a less classier place for half the price. The location blows; right by the highway and there's nothing but a huge green mountain right behind the hotel. This place is more like 2 stars as I work for a 4 star 5 diamond joint in Vegas and I find it hard to believe that the Sheraton is only 1 star less. Give me a break.

Reviews.Title: “Service is below what I expect”
Reviews.Author: emikelaw
Reviews.Content: I just wish someone would answer the phone when you dialed 0 from your room. I could never get someone on the line.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, great view”
Reviews.Author: Zorro98
Reviews.Content: I got a great price on Sheraton's web site and they upgraded me to the Marina Tower facing the water and downtown - peaceful, beautiful. The staff were exceptionally pleasant and attentive. As for the facility and the room it's about what you expect from the Sheraton brand. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, very close to the airport, spacious rooms, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CBacha
Reviews.Content: The hotel was chosen because my wife was attending a conference there, with activities during 4 consecutive days. It is located just a few minutes from the airport and the hotel has an eficient shuttle service every 10-15 minutes to and from the airport. Rooms at Bay Tower are kind of 30% bigger than those at Marina Tower. We had 2 double beds. Great breakfast. No free internet in rooms, just in lobby. The shuttle can take you to the airport where there is a bus line to downtown reached in 10 minutes. Beautiful ambience. Nice decoration. Spacious. Some noise from helicopters of a Navy base at the other side of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: onemoreflight
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (thank goodness) before a cruise and as a regular Sheraton guest at other properties I expected this to be in the same league - wrong ! we stayed in the Bayside tower which was probably the first mistake, we heard from other guests that the marina tower was better. They say this hotel has been renovated - what that means is a pretty lobby and new wallpaper in the bedrooms. couch in our room was dirty, bathrooms were a disgrace ( outlets hanging out of the wall), worn out towels. we complained the the receptionist who just shrugged her shoulders. The restaurant was only open for breakfast and that was expensive however we found a little deli by the marina that did great food for very reasonable prices. This property is barely a motel by my rating !!

Reviews.Title: “Save an hour of your life, take a cab... not the shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: dawoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for one night. The hotel advertised a free shuttle bus to/from the airport. I assumed that the shuttle would constantly be coming around and after 30 minutes of waiting.... I called. The lady on the phone said the shuttle would be there in 8 minutes. 28 minutes later, the shuttle arrived. Not being familiar with the area, I didn't realize that the hotel is practically across the street from the airport. A little too far to walk with luggage, but a cab couldn't cost more than 5.00. If I had to do it again, I would spend the 5 bucks and get an hour of my life back. I try to stay loyal to the Starwood properties and usually am upgraded as I've been a Platinum member for a few years now. No luck here... My room was about as standard as it gets.... although at check in It was noted I was "upgraded to a higher floor"... WTF? The room itself was "average" . Clean and what you would expect from a Sheraton. The room had a very nice flat screen TV, but despite being HD capable, none of my channels were in HD. Kind of a waste. My trip was very short... One day and I spent most of my time away from the hotel. I noticed a bar/pub type place that seemed popular and a very cool salt water fish tank that was HUGE in the lobby. In all, my stay was what I would expect. Nothing special and earns the "a-OK" rating from me

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay - Great Food & Service”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneQlders
Reviews.Content: We had a loverly short 4 night stay at the Sheraton San Diego. Our room was comfortable and we found service to be great. The restaurants had great food, although a little pricey. The service at the restarurants was generally very good and most of our waiters we very good with our 4 year old daughter. We were there for Thanksgiving and the Thanksgiving lunch/dinner was excellent. We loved San Diego it's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia_smile23
Reviews.Content: Over priced small room. Took FOREVER for room service and when we finally got the food we had to send it back because it was COLD! You have to pay for parking or vellet any which way you go. LOTS of hidden fees! Beautiful views of SD though.

Reviews.Title: “Was excited for a view I never got. Standard Sheraton.”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for a weekend stay in San Diego. In the end, our stay was perfectly fine. I was disappointed however, after reading the hotels website, at the room we ended up with. We got what I like the refer to as the 'Priceline Shaft'. This is when you typically end up in a room that is of lesser quality than a regular room in the hotel, simply because you booked on Priceline. Some hotels can't do this because all rooms are basically identical. The Sheraton Marina, on the other hand, quite easily put us in this category. To be honest, there was nothing really wrong with the room itself. I was more put off by the location. The website advertised how almost all the rooms had a view of the skyline or the marina. Ours had a view of the backside of a tennis court. Not only that, but we were in some random satellite building that wasn't really connected well to the hotel. I also was severely unimpressed about the fact that our room had exterior corridors, very motel-like. There was no security for my door and anyone could have wandered up the driveway and knocked on our door. It was really bizarre to see this type of building in a Sheraton - I was certainly not expecting it. Once I accepted the motel atmosphere, the room was fine. It was fairly standard with most Sheratons, but decorated in a nautical theme. We had two beds, a desk, and a bathroom. It was not an overly large room, but not small by any means. The bathroom was a bit tiny and the lack of ventilation in it, something I find common in the US, was a little suffocating. Outside the room, the hotel had a full service Starbucks that we enjoyed although I think the prices were mildly higher than normal. There was also a restaurant and a lounge that we did not sample. I didn't see a fitness center, though I'm sure one exists. We walked by the pool a couple of times to get to the main hotel - it seemed nice. Never busy due to the cooler climate. Rooms contain internet for a fee, or you can go to the lobby for free wireless. There is also the Sheraton Link in the lobby, which provides free computers with internet for registered guests. At other hotels this area has been packed with people however I rarely saw anybody using them at this hotel. Location wise you are not really around much, but it is still a nice location. The airport is basically next door, so it is convienient if you are using it in conjunction with an airline. The marina is behind the hotel, if for some reason you are headed in that direction. My favorite part was that is was located on Harbor Island (not an island - attached to land). This provided a long Bay-front walking path with fantastic views. A drive downtown was 5 minutes. Overall this hotel was satisfactory to stay at. I wasn't happy with being in the two level outside building, and there were a few expensive add-ons ($22 parking etc.) that irritated me during my stay. But we had good sleeps, the proximity to downtown was appreciated, and we were comfortable. That's enough to earn 3 stars out of me.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service ever experienced at a Starwoods Resort”
Reviews.Author: bonzai20
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we were told we could've upgraded our room for $20 on-line, but at the counter it is $25 and then the next front desk told us $50 - sounded like a scam. We decided to eat at the restaurant and stood at the counter forever - wait staff all tried very hard NOT to make eye contact so they were not "stuck" helping us out. We ended up checking out early and booking a new hotel. Upon check out we again waited while the bell boy finished chatting with a friend to flag us a cab. When cab arrived, no help with bags and he went back to visiting with his friend. A lot of work to do at this hotel to bring customer service level up to the Starwoods standards they are known for.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BAY VIEW”
Reviews.Author: mpopovics
Reviews.Content: I booked it from Expedia for 100 something a day. I didn't know there's actually two hotel one is the Bay tower and the other one is the Marina Tower. We end up in the Bay tower. The room is big with sofa and a little desk table. the bed is really soft but the washroom is a bit small and not that clean. No fridge just a mini bar and it has a sensor on it...don't even open it. We're in the 11th floor and from our balcony we could see the fantastic view of the Marina and Downtown. It was nice after few months of winter in Canada. Transportation: we didn't even rent a car. On the first day we just hop on the trolley come in around 8:52AM and 9:52AM and this will bring you to the Seaport Village. You can also walk but its about an hour to the seaport village. Cab is about $15 one way including tip or a bus Route 992 I believe takes you to downtown. FOOD: we didn't eat in the restaurant, we eat in a small deli located between the two tower it's called papananni's I believe. or we just eat in the Seaport village. You can buy drinks in the delli as well. There's some drinks at the gift shop as well at the main lobby of the hotel. over all it was a great city and we will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to just sleep. Close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: kelhuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel and Marina with a friend. The rooms were clean, and the bed and pillows were super comfy! Slept well the 3 nights I was there. The fitness center is nicely equipped, but the location was kind of weird to me- had to go outside and walk under the foundations of the hotel to get to it.
