Reviews.Content: I am writing this as I sit in my dingy hotel room waiting for my TV to "warm up" so I can catch the news/weather. I turned it on about 20 minutes ago and it is still not playing. I am in the Linai section of the hotel - which is probably the older section of the hotel - if that is possible. My room is available to anyone that wants to walk up to it becasue my door leads to the outside. I asked several times for a room change but the hotel is booked becasue of the conference that I am attending. I explained to them thaht as a single female I feel very unsafe. The staff was nice but unable to change my room which I can also hear every plane that takes off. Make sure you pack your sleep aid! I was really excited to see San Diego but the hotel is so far from downtown that I might as well be in middle America. If you have to stay here - try to stay in the main section of the hotel - it might be a little nicer. I am stuck here for a conferenc with no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MumaRules
Reviews.Content: I recently went to a conference at this hotel and found it adequate but not inspiring. As others have pointed out, this hotel is very isolated. It would definitely not be my first choice if I were in San Diego on vacation. The cab ride into town is about $12 each way. That adds a hefty price to the cost of a meal. We took the cab on the first night but then explored Harbor Island on foot the second day. There are 3 other restaurants on the island - one is exorbitantly priced and the other two are average quality seafood restaurants (the Lighthouse at the very end and the Boathouse). They are an easy walk from the hotel. Regarding the quality of the hotel: We stayed in the West Tower (the smaller of the two) which was a 7-10 minute hike from the conference facilities. The walk was pleasant, along the marina and provide a little exercise at the start of the day. The first room we were assigned was facing the airport (marina side) and that's where you could hear every plane take off. We quickly changed to a room facing the bay side, which was much quieter. The view from the balcony was quite nice and peaceful; you could see the Coronado bridge and downtown San Diego. In the room, the furnishings were typical but the bed was not comfortable. After 5 nights, we couldn't wait to get out of there. The bathroom toilet flushed with a very loud noise (kind of like the newer toilets on an airplane) - not a big deal until your neighbor flushed there's in the middle of the night and you heard it in your room. The other complaint is the inconsistency of the shuttle bus. It was great to have a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel; but, the shuttle was supposed to take you from one building to the other. There was no schedule so you could wait quite a while for it. Generally we walked but later at night, we didn't want to walk in the dark along the water so we waited and waited.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Only If you're not paying for the Room!!”
Reviews.Author: n2exploring
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference at this hotel, so thankful I did not have to pay for my stay. The advantage to being so close to the airport is also a major disadvantage with the noise factor. And as mentioned by other reviewers, the low flying frequent helicopters in the area were quite disturbing, especially if you tried to walk outside to enjoy the marina. I stayed in the east tower and was given a room on the first floor with a parking lot view! I was foolish not to ask for a better room, thinking that it wouldn't matter since I would be in meetings the majority of my time. Little did I know that the hotel would be the site of several wedding receptions that went late into the night. Imagine trying to sleep with the sound of loud celebrants outside my window, car fobs continually chirping as people returned to their cars, and car alarms going off without end! The room was well worn and partially for that reason didn't seem quite clean. I did appreciate the coffee maker in the room, but since it only brews one cup at a time, I can only imagine the negotiations that must go on between couples for the first cup! This hotel also boasts their huge internet center in the lobby. They have about 8 to 10 computers, but that is not helpful when all but 2 of them have "Out of Order" signs on them. I desperately wanted to print my airplane boarding pass since I had an early flight, but the 2 working computers were being monopolized by people that felt no sense of courtesy. Yes, there is a Starbucks inside the hotel. No, they will not honor any Starbucks gift cards that you may have. I did not dine in any of the restaurants, but the meals prepared for the the conference were wonderful. My room didn't have any hotel information books or maps so I have no idea how many restaurants were available or what they offered. I did consider room service one evening, but when I couldn't locate any menus, I gave up and bought a pastry from Starbucks. I was concerned because my return flight left at 6:30AM. I inquired and was told the Hotel Airport Shuttle would start running at 5:00AM, stopping at the other tower before heading to the airport. This concerned me because I am accustomed to flying out of Atlanta and you really need to allow time to get through long waits at security. I arrived to check out at 4:40AM. Although my room was covered, I always like to be sure that nothing has been put on my credit card. There was a gentleman checking out ahead of me and he was having huge issues. He went back and forth with the receptionist. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw a Hotel Airport Shuttle pull up, load 2 passengers and take off! I looked at my watch and it was 4:50AM! The gentleman behind me looked at me and we both screamed in unison! Another shuttle arrived shortly after 5:00AM, and I climbed on not a minute too soon! All of us thought that since every seat was full that we would go straight to the airport and not stop at the other tower. WRONG!!! Can you believe that we had to try and load more passengers (who had to stand) and their luggage on an already filled to the max shuttle?? By this time I was so nervous that I was going to miss my flight, especially since we had to stop and unload passengers at each terminal. Mine was last. I really prefer to write good, positive reviews, but I appreciate the people that share their unpleasant experiences also. Maybe this will help someone make a better plan. I did not have a choice about where I stayed this time. If you are planning a vacation, please research other hotels that are better situated and better maintained than this one. You will be so glad that you did!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has nothing going for it”
Reviews.Author: TravelSkeptic43
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a conference at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. Frankly I'm amazed at how high it rates on TripAdvisor. Either the staff is being paid to write trumped up reviews or the folks who visit this hotel just don't get out much. For reference, I was in the East (main) tower. On the positive, the restaurant and bar side of the house did a superb job. The food was great and the wine list was even better. That's where the positive comments end. First, the location. For someone visiting San Diego, you either want to be downtown where the action is, or far enough out that you can get free parking and drive to the local attractions. The Sheraton has neither. It's not walking distance to ANYTHING. Someone in the elevator who did have a car commented that the valet charge was $29/day. Further on location, forget having a quite night's sleep here. To the north is Lindberg Field. To the Southwest is North Island, a major US Navy air station. To the Southeast is the main Coast Guard station. Between the civil, military, and coastguard planes and helecopters there's almost no time of the day when there isn't a loud drone or roar occuring with great frequency. My room was small and old. The fixtures in the bathroom were at least 30 years old and one of the tiles in the floor was completely detatched - I could have dug it out with a pocket knife. Bathroom fan - forget it. The sliding door to my balcony fit so poorly that wind blew freely into the room. The noise from the aformentioned aircraft combined with the drone of the air condition units that my room overlooked made sleep an impossibility. One of the few redeeming features might have been the Starbucks. I went in one morning and ordered a Syrup Cream - a fairly standard menu item. The people working there didn't have a clue what I was talking about. When I pointed out that it was a standard Starbucks menu item, they pointed at their menu board and managed to get out enough broken english to tell me that they only knew how to make what was on that board - nothing else. As for process and procedure - the hotel was pittiful. Hotel guide book (binder) in my room was so incomplete it was all but useless. It gave menus for the main restaurant, but not the other two. There was no map of the complex so for the third restaurant that was in the west tower, I didn't even know what it was or where it was. It mentioned the pool, but didn't give the hours. When I pointed these items out to the concierge (two of them on two different locations), I was given the same stupid response - "Perhaps they did it that way because they want you to come down and interact with us!".

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Good service. Need a cab to get downtown.”
Reviews.Author: jimpennstate97
Reviews.Content: Great place. Right on the water. Good customer service. Need to take a cab to get downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for business reasons. The hotel staff was fantastic, although the girl at the front desk who checked us in wasn’t the friendliest person--she wasn’t too bad. The bellhop who helped us with our bags was really nice, and later during our stay my friends and I used the concierge several times and were treated great. They were very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Also, the valets were great--giving us bottled water every morning to take on our sightseeing trips, great ideas on where to shop, etc. I loved the lobby, there was a Starbuck’s (a real plus for me), a nice gift shop, and there was a beautiful aquarium, also a really nice area for business—computers, etc. All in all the first floor is great. Now on to the guest rooms--the rooms were a bit shabby. The bathrooms were small. Everything was in need of paint and wallpaper, and they really need some new soft beds. Ours was as hard as a rock! So while we were not too impressed with the rooms, on the plus side--they had Starbuck’s coffee in the room, also a nice little balcony with 2 chairs so that depending on which side of the hotel you were on, you could enjoy either a beautiful sunrise or sunset. We had a city view and loved it. Be advised though of the airport noise, it can’t be avoided, but it does stop between midnight and 6:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Signs of aging”
Reviews.Author: pilot08
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 4 nights. For over $200 a night, i expected more. Room that i stayed in is showing signs of overuse. Could use some renovation. Furniture looks a little worn. At least it doesn't look/feel dirty. I can find similar conditions hotels for 1/2 the price.

Reviews.Title: “Probably one of the worst places to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PandaExpress
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here because a conference I was at was here - otherwise if this is YOUR money and you are on vacation, please do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. First off, this property is ooooold compared to other major hotels in the San Diego area, the rooms in the marina tower are tiny and the while the front desk tries their best to trick you into staying at the Bay Towers (about 1/2 mile away) where the rooms are supposed to be 30% bigger, those rooms are even OLDER (if you can believe it). It's like stepping into a run down 1980's movie set. And while the rooms are bigger, the furniture size didn't increase and the room is poorly laid out so that you have big blank spaces of wall and carpet where there really should have been something else. First floors in the Bay Towers where I got shunted too (after expressing obtaining a reservation for the Marina Towers) faced the parking lot so any crazy person could just cross from the parking lot into your room if you left the balconey door open. Surprisingly enough someone in the conference said that the hotel cleaning staff or room service had come in, unlocked the balconey door and not fully closed the front door - how scary is that??!!! Front desk was rude too - when I pointed out that I had PAID for a reservation for the Marina Towers she said - sorry they had given up my room and there was no choice. I wasn't late or anything for check in. I was shocked! Parking at the Marina Towers is a bit nuts if there is a conference in town, they are doing some sort of construction on the parking lot (what I'm not sure - since i never saw anyone actually doing anything) but it's basically a dusty dirt lot with very NARROW parking spaces. There is not enough parking in the self lot (again if conference in town which usually there is), so you see lots of cars just circling around stalking people. Also it's not a very close walk from the self parking lot to the Marina towers. The parking at Bay Towers is a lot better - but then you're away from all the action. There is no gift shop yet at the bay towers (they're building it) and I didn't remember seeing any business center either - remember everything is really headquartered at Marina Towers. The good news at both towers. 1) Noise - while you're pretty much right next to the airport the noise inside your room is pretty much not there 2) Parking - it's $20 but for in and out privileges so that's not too bad for hotel parking. Good luck for anyone risking a stay here on their own dime.

Reviews.Title: “A Joy Ride for your Expense Account”
Reviews.Author: sivin
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business meeting in San Diego and asked me to join him and make it into a mini-vacation. Arrangements were made by his associates at a special rate; hence I can't quote the usual price of this room. However, I would consider it to be run-of-the-house and standard. That said, it was fine. This should be considered a business hotel, rather than a vacation property. The Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina is one of two in the area in close proximity to Lindbergh Field, the San Diego International Airport. It is so close that one could practically walk there from the airport. We rented a car, though the hotel provides shuttles. The drive to the airport from the hotel is probably no more than five minutes. Though the location makes for a convenient launching point for San Diego activities, visitors should keep in mind that planes fly low over downtown San Diego creating a frequent roar of jet engines up above. The airport appears to close about midnight and not reopen until an early, but not unreasonable time the next morning. The planes are heard and seen from the hotel but didn't create a problem for us; they might for some. The hotel has over 1,000 rooms, all having balconys. Our room was what I would consider of an average size with two double beds and was comfortble enough for our adult daughter to spend two nights with us. It was tastefully decorated and all furniture, bedcoverings, etc. were crisp and clean upon our arrival. However, the view from this room was so enchanting that even a lesser appearing room would have gotten a thumbs-up here. The hotel faces San Diego Bay and our room had a glorious view of the city skyline and a great expanse of the bay. The room's small balcony with its table and two chairs was a class spot to enjoy your morning coffee while viewing the many sailboats and other vessels passing by. And as if to complement the daytime view, the San Diego night time brought on the city lights and a mad search for the proper camera exposure to capture them. The room was equipped with a television, clock-radio and a very simple little coffee maker that was fine for tea but questionable for coffee. For that ,management apparently wanted us to go into one of the hotel's restaurants. The room was also Internet equipped and the user would be connected for $11.95 a day. There was a stocked refrigerator in the room carrying sodas ($3.00), small waters ($3.50), Rice Krispies Treats ($4.00) and the like, "all prices subject to a 20% restocking fee." We passed on this little Sheraton moneymaker. We were all thankful for our cellular phones here because Sheraton fiercely guards outgoing calls from its rooms. They charge $2.00 for access per local call, up to 60 minutes per call with .10 per each additional minute beyonyd that first hour. Toll free calls will set you back the same as above. Want operator assistance, or making a credit card call? It's all the same to these folks. If you need to call long distance your prices will be that much higher. Bring your cell! The hotel has a few restaurants and we dined at Quinn's, a casual sports bar offering adult sandwiches (no pb&j on the menu, though I am certain they would oblige if requested) such as the marinated skirt steak on a ciabatta roll which I had and a very fat pastrami sandwich selected by a friend. They had a wide assortment of appetizers and some nice main dish salads and the requisite soup for a seaside community, clam chowder. Prices were about what you would expect in a city hotel, with the chowder at $8.00 for an average sized bowl. Food was well prepared. As a full-service hotel, in-room dining is also offered, but be prepared for the food prices to be pumped up with Sheraton's version of thinking of its patrons' comfort (tongue in cheek here). The in-room menu reads "For your convenience a 19% service charge and a $3.00 delivery charge will be added automatically." However, if this is not a determent then a very nice selection of foods is offered. Aside from a bank of computers in the lobby available to guests without charge, we did not use any of the other commercial offerings, but I did investigate what was available A "Smart Office" is set up with a computer, printer, speaker phone, scanner, fax etc. at $75.00/hr. This room is described as being appropriate for small meetings and interviews and has a capacity for up to four people. They have a spa and fitness center for a $10.00 daily fee for hotel guests. Various spa treatments are available and the center is equipped with cardiovascular equipment and body machines. Neither a hair salon nor manicurist was in the list of services. There is a small store selling the usual hotel merchandise and snacks but don't expect to find any semblance of solid nutrition (a bagel, for instance) there. Again, they want you in their restaurants so they can sell that bagel for $6.00. Everyone we met at this hotel, from check-in personnel, to wait staff, to maintenance, was extraordinarily nice. Apparently Sheraton takes the time to select and train its people and it shows. No complaints there! Beware of their parking arrangement. They charge $20/day for hotel parking, more for valet. An adjacent open lot charges $4.00 per hour and the charges just keep accruing. Check before you park so you won't be surprised. In conclusion, this is a pleasant place to stay, especially for the business traveller. The property is smart, food is good, and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyRob2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina from 12/25-12/31. In general, we were very pleased with the hotel. From the outside, it looked very nice. It was very close to the airport, so that was convenient as well. We did frequently see and hear planes going overhead every few minutes. It didn't bother us at all, but others might be more sensitive to that. The plane noise never disturbed us during the night either. The hotel room was nice. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The rug seemed a little bit worn, but that wasn't a big deal. We had a balcony over looking the pool area. In the evening, they often had hot cider in the lobby. I thought that was a nice touch. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the computer availability. It was great that they offered free internet use, however, they only had about 6 computers for hundreds of guests. Most of the time they weren't even all in service. That was frustrating! Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was clean, conveniently located, and affordable. If we head back out to San Diego in the future, we will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: curiousjayu
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night here after disembarking from a cruise. For what I was looking for, the hotel was perfect. It is just a few blocks from the airport, and is convenient for folks heading out of town. The location on Harbor Island is very pretty, and there are gorgeous views of downtown and the marina from many of the rooms. When we arrived, our room was dirty but we were quickly upgraded to a Club Level room. The room itself was nice, if not spectacular. The continental breakfast that is one of the "Club Level" perks was great - no complaints and pretty much a real breakfast. We paid $105 per night on Priceline for the hotel. If you are staying in San Diego for an extended period of time/vacation, I'm not sure I would recommend this hotel, just because of the location. You can't really walk to anything, and if you are running around the city, cab fare would probably add up. That said, you would probably do fine with a rental car here, since most of the downtown attractions are very close.

Reviews.Title: “Not great....”
Reviews.Author: Amyj1276
Reviews.Content: I suppose my expectations were a bit high, but I was pretty dissapointed. I was here for a conference at the hotel, so didn't have to worry about traveling away from the hotel. On the positive, the shuttle from the airport to the hotel went fine. It was only when I got to the hotel.... First, the guy who checked me in didn't ask what kind of room I needed and I ended up in a room with 2 small beds rather than 1 king. That's the least bothersome aspect of my experience, but still slightly annoying considering everything else. When I got to my room (which was in a great location overlooking the pool and marina) I searched high and low to find the information binder so I knew how late the restaurants and pool were open. I finally called the front desk to ask for one, and the one I got had whole sections missing! They must not pay attention to these things.... I also asked for my desk chair to be replaced because the chair was so gross I didn't want to sit on it. The seat and back were full of stains and other grime, and there was grime on the armrests. Gross. The housekeeping lady gave me a little hassle about the request, but ultimately got me a new chair, which was slightly less gross than the first one. I did find out how late the pool and hot tube were open, by the way. The hot tub was not nearly as hot as it should have been, and the nasty smell of cigerette butts all over the ground around the tub took much away from the experience. The shower also wasn't great. The shower head was old and difficult to change the stream. The string that goes across the shower to hang wet clothes was completely missing. My final complaint: who hangs mirrors (or other glass) over the bed in an earthquake zone?????? I've only been living in an earthquake zone (San Francisco) for less than 2 years, but even I know better! Bottom line: The hotel is decent, and at first glance the room is nice. And the room was quiet, which is definitely important. However, I think what makes a nice hotel (especially for business travel) is paying attention to the details. This hotel does not pay attention to the details, and the overall experience of staying here reflects that. I'm glad I wasn't paying for this room, and unless required for work again, I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jcmg
Reviews.Content: I just spent a few nights at the Sheraton Harbor Island and had a very nice time. The Hotel lobby was very nice and the staff VERY helpful. The rooms were nice, but could use a little updating, but overall quite nice. The pools looked great, we only ate at Quinns, the food was good (its like a sports bar) but it was quite loud. Overall we had a great time and would definitley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ThatGirl299
Reviews.Content: Horribly noisy hotel. You would think that a hotel across the street from the airport would have noise remediation but the walls were even thinner than usual. The decor is nice, and the staff is friendly and efficient, but you will not get any sleep here. The views of the harbor from both sides are utterly destroyed by the noise of the airplanes. You also hear everything your neighbors are doing (I mean, EVERYTHING). Not pleasant. My room smelled of body odor that wasn't mine. I was not able to get any sleep at all. Most egregious was the energy-efficient thermostat. You could only manually get the fan to blow on high for five minutes, then it switches automatically to "auto." So, no hope for white noise to drown out the other noises.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mauijunkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property because of the proximity to the starting line for the San Diego International Triathlon, which we had friends participating in. I am a Starwood Preferred Member and at arrival I was told by the Starwood Rep that I was the Guest of the Day. I was given free parking and an upgrade to the Club Level which included a cocktail reception and free continental breakfast. This was just an added bonus. The hotel it beautifully decorated, the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable. The hotel is very close to the airport but noise was not a problem. This would make it convenient who may have a layover. I would definately recommend this hotel. We couldn't have had a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Waterfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOC
Reviews.Content: This is a large scale Hotel on the Marina at Shelter Island. It has a blue white and red nautical motif in the large lobby complete with massive salt water aquarium. There is an open wi-fi area overlooking the boats/marina,and several different types of flavored water greeting the arrival of its jogging clients. The food at the lobby bar is basically pub type fare. The rooms are clean and bright with flat screen tv's and baconies with great views. In my opinion this is one of the nicer sheratons. It has an incredible fitness center and large pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: adb1158
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for a conference. The hotel is directly across Harbor Drive from the airport. There was some airport noise, but from my room it was minimal. I highly recommend that someone planning to stay here sign up for the Starwood Preferred Guest program as they seem to provide a whole floor for members. I really liked getting the two liters of complementary water every day--beats paying the normally exhorbitant prices! They also had coffee and tea in the elevator lobby on this floor. A nice touch. I stayed in the East tower in a corner room furthest from the airport, which partly explains the low aircraft noise. I had a balcony overlooking San Diego harbor and was able to watch the sun set over Point Loma as well as watch ships coming in and leaving from the Pacific. Pretty cool. Beds were very comfortable, the cleaning staff wonderful and the downstairs staff very friendly and approachable. Parking is a bit steep, but I believe it is true anywhere downtown. Took five minutes to get to the freeways, maybe ten to get to Gaslamp Quarter. Overall a great stay and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a priceline deal!”
Reviews.Author: Bessca
Reviews.Content: After bidding $90 for a 4 star hotel in downtown San Diego, I was a little concerned that we would get a pretty lousy place. I was very surprised...first of all, they put us in the West Tower, which is farthest away from the airport. The room had a beautiful marina view, and the furnishings were great. The bed wad very comfortable and the room was good sized. I would definitely stay here again, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: gregaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: freeway and airport on the east, navel base with helicopter traffic all night on the west. rooms were recently renovated which match a 3 star property, but the noise, and $20.00 charge for outside parking lot ( no street parking option), ranks this sheraton as a " never return".

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cdom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. It was our first trip to San Diego and this hotel was responsible for us falling in love with the city. The concierge was very helpful in sending us out on day excursions based on our interests and overall the staff was very friendly. The breakfast buffet at $20 was worth every penny - the food was fabulous and the view of the bay made it even better. The pool, the hot tub, and the workout facility were all top notch. If you are a jogger, you will love the scenic trail that will take you all the way downtown with a harbor view the entire run. Will definitely stay at this hotel in future trips to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights after a cruise. Was given room 5207 in the Lanai area. This is a four storey building connected to the East Wing and has its own pool and hottub. This is a very nice hotel. The gardens and pool areas are beautiful. You have the marina on one side and the harbour on the other. A free shuttle takes you to the airport and from there you can take the bus downtown. The walk to the airport only takes 5 - 10 minutes. I paid US$119 per night for single occupancy (total $402.86 including taxes) . Lobby has free internet computers. Buffet breakfast was $21. Expensive but excellent. I would certainly stay here again. andrew

Reviews.Title: “Great experience here!”
Reviews.Author: KC traveler 2
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 5 nights [tue to sunday] in oct07 and loved it. got a room in west tower on 7th floor. had a view of the bay and planes landing [no the noise was not that bad!] staff was GREAT in every way. internet in lobby free for 45 minutes each time you log in, lots of people use it. pool and hot tub were very clean,etc and felt great. ate at the sports bar a couple of times and service was very good and the view of the boats was nice. ate breakfeast at a local deli called Papananis between West and East towers every morning with the "locals". Very good food and good prices. Was a great way to start our day. Parking was $20/day with in/out access. The parking was billed on our room bill. Booked thru Expedia and room rate was discounted a LOT because we stayed 5 days. We were VERY pleased with the 5 day rate! Hotel is so close to attractions that driving was never a issue as in 20 minutes we could be to most trourist spots. We would come back anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: woodr35
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 3 night stay here for a conference. My room was clean, very comfortable bed, a work desk and a small couch. Nice but really not that different from, say, a Courtyard Mariott. Yes it is near the airport and you can hear the airplanes, but it didn't bother me. Shuttle bus runs every 15 minutes or so to the airport, but if you are travelling light, the weather is good and don't mind a 20 - 30 minute walk that is actually dooable. I jogged each day around harbor island and that was great - there are numerous park benches to sit and enjoy the views of the bay and downtown. The gym is in the East tower, and is a good 5 minute walk from the west tower where I stayed and is an extra charge, even for guests. They call it East and West tower, but really they are pretty much 2 completely seperate properties. Internet access is extra, like $11 or so a day. In summary, a good hotel with convenient airport access in a beautiful location, but in all a little pricey for what you get and typical of full service hotels, you have to pay for extras like gym and internet access (no free continental breakfast here)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but,,,,”
Reviews.Author: sbinsun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Sept. The hotel is across from the Airport. We stayed at the West tower, newer than the East tower but it show's it's wear. I received a reduced rate due to a Conference at the hotel. The view from the hotel is great! A bit loud starting @6:30 A.M. this is when the planes start taking off from the San Airport, from the West tower is is tollerable. Upon arriving they put us in the East tower, even though I had a King bed in the West reserved, I said OK as long as I could get a King(none avaialable) we ended up in the West with a king. The room was OK, but stains on the Carpet and the bathroom was not cleaned(not good). Went to the front desk, told them they said they would take care of it(they never did), The next day(evening) we came back to the room finding the lock on the floor, it feel off the door(it is the security lock that is swong over, not the main door handle lock. This was fixed in about 1 hour, they used platic inserts to fill the stripped screw holes and bigger screws. The bathroom had tiles missing and plaster on the floor. lighting is terrible!!! The good: resteraunts are excellent and the View, The bad: you are stuck in the middle of Harbor Island, you will need a cab to go to Old town, or gaslamp($15) each way, it's worth it. We the consumers are paying allot for rooms that are below par,,we should complain!!! I did send them an email,,,but no reply yet.... The Sheraton is squizing every dollar out of this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: LisaV-06
Reviews.Content: We were invited to an event that required spending the night. We were very pleasantly surprised by how nice the property is, especially for the price. We were automatically upgraded to a suite overlooking the marina. Our room was spacious, the bathroom was on the smaller side & we had a flat screen TV. The room was clean & staff was courteous. We didn't experience too much airport noise even though it is in close proximity. If we'd paid more I would have expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Sheraton in Aug 2007. I do not think it is as nice as other Sheratons we have stayed in. The place is huge and upon first entering our room everything looked clean and very nice. After taking a shower I was disgusted to find I picked up hair balls on my feet walking from the bathroom to the bed. Quite a chunk of hairball, I might add. Sometimes a "rotten egg" odor would come from the bathroom and hang around for about 15 minutes. I assume the order came from the sink drains or bath drain. We could hear every word the people in the adjoining rooms were saying. Oddly, we could not hear the typical banging of hotel doors. The elevators worked very well. This is a huge hotel and whoever takes care of the elevators should be congradulated. The self parking worked ok. I believe it is $20 per night. The parking attendants let you in, then let you out. This is fine in a location where parking fees are normally steep anyway. The hotel looked very clean and we had a balcony room on a high floor with a good view. A few days after we checked out I received a master card charge for about $4.50 for a bottle of drinking water we did not open in the room. All in all, I will go back to staying at the Best Western on Harbor Drive. The parking there is free, the quick breakfast there is free, there are balcony view rooms, I can pick up the same hairballs on my feet, and I have never been charged for services I did not order. And the Bestwestern is probably half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms with a great view”
Reviews.Author: janeyToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Nice nautical decor in the West Tower. Beds very comfortable, but only double size. The room was very spacious and had a perfect view of the harbour. Of our 2 week trip of travelling, this was my families' favorite hotel. The pool was warm and big enough to handle several visitors. The hotel staff was very helpful in recommending and finding some restaurants we wanted to go to.Check out the Boat House Restaurant in walking distance of the hotel (near the Hilton). They have daily specials. For example, the lobster dinner is $11.95 on Wednesdays. We got a great deal on our room through San Diego Central Reservations at 1-800-434-7894. We were flying home from San Diego, so this hotel was in a great location. You couldn't get much closer to the airport than this hotel - a 2 minute drive. Surprisingly, being this close to the airport was not a problem. Did not notice noise from the plane traffic. We would definitely, stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...if you get a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Fibbersfan
Reviews.Content: Had a nice July stay at this hotel. We received a very good rate and stayed in the West Tower. I would not recommend the West Tower for families with young children. The walk to the East Tower does get old for the little ones. The East Tower has a much nicer lobby and is generally the hub of this hotel. The pool area is much nicer in the East Tower. The West Tower is a bit of a walk from the East Tower and it might as well be called a completely different hotel. The rooms are bigger, but the West Hotel does not have the more "upscale feel" of the East Tower. If you are a family traveling or have folks in your party with mobility issues....definitely request the East Tower. You will find the nice restaurants, lounges, pools and other amenities in the East Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: muchuckles
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times and each time my stay has been great. I have not had any trouble with airport noise and the accomodations are far superior to what I would expect of a Sheraton. Every hotel staff person that I encountered was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel highly. If you are not traveling for business, the location is a bit secluded and you will need to take a cab into the downtown area as it is several miles to walk there and you would need to walk on a busy street. If you rent a car, the parking fees at the hotel are a bit steep as well. Overall, excellt experience!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Lacking, lovely hotel grounds”
Reviews.Author: jaltravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you're traveling for business and attending a conference. It is far from perfect if you are traveling for pleasure/vacation. My boyfriend and I were visiting San Diego for a wedding and decided to book through hotwire.com. We landed the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. I had read reviews on trip advisor that the west tower had bigger, updated rooms but was further from the action and that the east tower was closer to everything but with smaller "lanai" rooms. When we arrived at the hotel (east tower) we were told that we were actually staying in the West Tower. I asked to be switched to an East Tower high room but was told that the hotel was overbooked and I should be happy I even have a room! (Nice, right?). So we drove over to the west tower, parked the car ($20 per night!), and unloaded our bags to find out that we were actually staying at the east tower. So we had to gather our things back to the car and drive over to the east tower where we were basically ignored to find our way to our room without any help with our luggage. The lack of organization and service was very disappointing. There was a large Enterprise convention going on at the hotel and it seems the staff was too busy helping those on business to help us out. We were given a subpar Lanai room on the 2nd floor with a less than stellar view. There is no safe in the room and water is $4.00. The room itself was standard. One of the restaurants was closed while we were there for the Enterprise convention. A cab ride to the Gaslamp district was about $15.00 with tip. The pool at the east tower is really nice. We never had to worry about finding a lounge chair and the view of the harbor is beautiful. At check out we were charged for 4 nights of parking even though we only had a car for one night. Ultimately I felt that the money we saved by booking through hotwire would have been better spent on a hotel closer to downtown. I will not stay here again and do not recommend it to travelers. I would recommend the hotel to people looking for a conference spot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience(Don't uderstand the bad reviews!)”
Reviews.Author: Nicci116
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say that I cannot believe some of the totally negative reviews that have posted recently. It's almost like these travelers were staying at a different hotel... My husband and I took our two kids (12 & 14) for a 6 night stay at the beginning of July. We love San Diego, and this was our 4th stay at The Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. My 14 year old son chose to return here for his Middle school graduation gift as he & his sister always have a great time. I had actually contacted the hotel in response to the general---We looking forward to seeing you--- email that you receive after booking on the Hotel website. I addressed the email to Robert Cartwright, the Hotel's General Manager telling him that we would be returning and the reason for our visit, and to request a Marina/pool view room. I had booked a Club Level room in the East Tower as we truly enjoy the Club Lounge and the great views that it offers. I actually prefer the rooms over in the West Tower as they are larger, have a bigger balcony and I like their nautical theme, but there is no Club Level in the West Tower. After sending the email with my room request, I received a l reply from Mr. Cartwright.I was truly impressed by this very personal touch, but that was just the beginning! I checked in at the Starwood Preferred Guest check- in area, while my family waited outside with the car. I was told that we had a 2 rooms reserved for six nights, and I said there must be some mistake as I had actually only reserved one room. As it turns out, Mr. Cartwright really took great care of us. He gave us 2 adjoining rooms on the 9th floor, and while the 9th floor is not on the Club Level as I had reserved, the rooms are basically the same and we still had access to the Club Lounge. My kids were over the moon that they got there own room! It truly made our stay so much more comfortable to have that extra space for the week. We were also given complimentary valet parking for the duration of our stay! Now, I know some of you are probably thinking, of course after this special treatment I am going to give the hotel a great review, but if you knew me you would know that would not alter my judgment in anyway. It wasn’t just the way that Mr. Cartwright made us all feel that made this such a great trip, but also many other members of the staff, from the front desk, to the wait staff, the concierge desk, the valet parking staff and bell hops, the gym staff, the bartenders, even the housekeeping and maintenance personnel. Every single hotel employee that we encountered were happy, friendly and truly accommodating people. And in my opinion, it is the people that are employed by a hotel that truly make a difference between a wonderful hotel stay and a so-so experience. You can be in the most luxurious hotel suite, in the most incredible location, but if the service and hospitality are not 5 star you are not going to be happy! We never had a bad meal at the hotel. The kids loved room service and food from Shoreline. the poolside restaurant. My husband and I liked Tapatini, and we all liked the Sunday brunch at Harbor’s Edge. Some meals we charged to the room and some we paid cash for so the hotel bill didn’t feel quite so bad at the end of our stay. But like the MasterCard commercials say “Quality time with your family, Priceless!” We took some great walks along the harbor in the morning, but my favorite part of the day was sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine just gazing at the sunset over the marina. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone just based on the staff alone. We will definitely be returning to the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina on our next trip to San Diego. p.s. Another wonderful thing about this and many other hotels in the Starwood hotel group is that they welcome small dogs; but please if you are going to bring along your pet, only do so if you can trust your pet to be well behaved, that it won’t make a “mess” in the room, won’t bark at all hours and you as the dog’s caretaker take full responsibility for cleaning up after their walks. It is a privilege to be able to have your dog along, please don’t abuse that privilege!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the San Diego Sheraton Marina”
Reviews.Author: MmePoppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location so close to the airport creates way too much noise. Being on the waterfront with all the beautiful boats was nice, and the resort is physically attractive, but it is isolated from the city, and the constant airplane noise was really intrusive. Flights began before dawn, waking my spouse; I woke at 7:30 when the hotel staff began leaf-blowing in the parking lot under our window. The lobby restaurant in the East tower had fine views, but their prices were steep and the food was good but not great. The breakfast buffet was much better than dinner and offered some unusual touches: cheese blintzes and a multi-layered egg torta with several fillings. Good stuff. The staircase between floors was ugly and institutional, making it easy to opt for the elevator, even to go down just a single flight to my son's room. It's a shame they are stuck with this mixed bag of a location: a pretty marina and swimming pools, but an ugly, noisy airport right across the way.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: TheMasterUnit_Dallas
Reviews.Content: Long story short I loved my stay so much this is what I emailed to Sheraton directly: I recently stayed at your hotel for a 5 night 6 day conference that was taking place at the San Diego Convention Center. I must say that this hotel is the best hotel I have EVER stayed in my entire life. I've stayed at a many places in New York, Rome, Chicago, Florida, Newport etc everything from the Millineum in Manhattan to the Ritz in Sarasota. From the moment we got there by the Sheraton airport shuttle our stay was magnificent. I brought my girlfriend with me on this business trip because I had a feeling it would soon turn to pleasure. Everything about your hotel is fantastic. The gigantic pool(s) is amazing and the courtesy of the serving staff out there is impeccable. Particularly a guy named Steve working at the Shoreline resteraunt. That guy had the whole place smiling and laughing. The Harbor Inn Resteraunt breakfasts were some of the best Ive had in awhile. Quinns was excellent. The best martinis and the food was great. The room was perfect maid service perfect. The ladies at the Concierge Desk were the most polite people I think Ive ever met! They were such a great help! Overall, my girlfriend and I could not believe the outstanding service that we were experiencing for 6 DAYS IN A ROW. Everyone of the employees was so nice from the gyms guy giving me towels to the wait staff at Harbor Inn to the front desk. Even the security officers asked us if we were alright and needed anything. If I was a freaking millionaire I would live at your hotel. When I come back to San Diego I am DEFINITELY staying at your hotel. Freaking amazing. Your star rating should be waaaaay over than what it is on some of these websites. Thank you for such a great experience. I will never forget it...END MESSAGE. Overall if youre going to San Diego and you book a room here be sure you book it in the East Tower on a high floor. Once you get that covered trust me you'll have no worries the whole time you're there. This hotel is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: cjoseph_tx1
Reviews.Content: This was quite possibly the WORST stay I have ever experienced and I've stayed in some crap hotels that had a friendly and more knowledgeable staff than this joke of a hotel, not only was our room not ready when we arrived at 6pm, I was treated rudely by the front desk clerk and then he dismissed me to help someone else who got into their room right away. For $509.00 (tax included) a night I expected better service. When my room was ready my room key was tossed on the counter and we weren't even told how to get to it which tower or anything. We then called for a vending machine location were sent on a wild goose chase, never did find it. We called the concierge for a taxi and were told they had them on call and one would be, well we ended up driving our own vehicle, no taxis were available. The laziness of this staff was astonishing! No one at this hotel seemed to be friendly, willing to help or even apologize for their lack of quality service. I will never return to this hotel until changes in staff manners & knowledge of the facility are finally a part of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Isolated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MyrtleMay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a stone's throw from the San Diego airport. If your room faces the marina, you will hear the planes taking off and the balcony is of not much use due to the constant noise. However, the sliding glass door does a good job of shielding the noise. The lobby decor is in the marine theme and is very inviting. But, the arms on the chairs look pretty dirty even though the fabric was dark blue. I changed my room because the bathroom smelled and the paint was peeling on the bathroom ceiling. The second room was better. Decor is in blues and white with a touch of red. I attended a meeting with work and the food supplied by the hotel was very good - everything they served was tasty. Front staff was friendly and helpful and what you'd expect. The location of this hotel is not the best. It's on Harbor Island and it is very isolated. There is nothing else around there that is interesting. You have to get in your car to really enjoy the San Diego experience. There are a couple of restaurants down the road. I went to one and it's just not very lively around the hotel area. If you're looking for isolation and want to stay on the property, this place is OK if you don't mind jet noise. I'd stay somewhere else in the future that has places to eat, drink, and shop within walking distance, like around Seaport Village. This hotel does the best with what it has, but it can't change its location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Family-reviewer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in West tower, which had large comfortable rooms. We were originally meant to stay in the East tower, but they could not give us adjoining/ adjacent rooms.This building seems much quieter than the east tower, which was perfect for us. The pool was smaller than the other two at the east tower, but always quiet- no fights for a sun bed! Although the hotel is situated near the airport, we were not bothered by aircraft noise at all.The restaurant in this building served excellent breakfasts, and the staff were very attentive. The restaurants in the other buildings were much busier. Room service was fast, efficient and good value for money. We did not have a car during our visit, so had to travel everywhere in taxis. These weren't too expensive, but were our only option, as the hotel is quite a distance from anything. There is no safe in the room, although safety deposit boxes are available at reception. This hotel was not cheap, but we would stay here again if we wanted to be near downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: JackPo21
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent overall. Very attentive staff. The room condition was great...everything was nice and neat. I had a lenai room but it looked directly at a fence surrounding the tennis court. Self parking is $20/night which i thought was steep. Hotel is not within walking distance to anything so it is somewhat like a resort for someone who wants to hang out at the hotel pool and see other San Diego sights by car. The property has a very large feel to it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: AshleyRobin
Reviews.Content: My Sisters and I and all our kids and GrandKids stayed at the Hotel for two nights. We had a great time. We spent most of our time in the pool. The food and parking was expensive. We had ground floor rooms all together. Great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Resort -- near the airport!”
Reviews.Author: topterp
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a wonderful location. Hotel sits on marina right near the airport. Airport noise is not noticeable though as the hotel is off the flight path. Marina is beautiful with sailboats, yachts, blue water and palm trees. Other side of hotel faces the bay and great views of Coronado Island and passing Navy ships. Room are spacious and comfortable. Rooms seemed newly renovated with nice furniture, tvs and comfortable beds and bedding. Very clean and quiet. Got a very good price on Hotwire. My only negative comment would be in the food category. While the hotel is situated nicely for views, ease to airport, downtown etc. if you do not have a car, you are captive to the hotel restaurant. Prices in the hotel for food were exhorbitant, though food was good. If you have a rental car, this should not be a problem -- just eat elsewhere. Overall a wonderful stay. Pleasantly surprised and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant views”
Reviews.Author: LouRogerson
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was wonderful, I booked a room offering limited view and was placed on the 16th floor overlooking the harbour with all the small private boats and charters - definately more than a limited view. The hotel is clean and well kept with friendly and knowledgable staff. We were located in the main building which is advertised as being closer the airport and so may have problems with noise but this was definately not the case, plus this part of the hotel has the most features. We walked to the other building, about 5 minutes stroll and found it to be more sub-standard and looked aimed more at conferences. I would defaintely stay here again, we paid $100 a night which is my view was a bargain. Louise Rogerson

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Maryland1Traveler
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in the East Tower but chose to stay in the West Tower for the larger nicer rooms. Our room in the West Tower was indeed very nice and quite large, with a nice view of the harbor. The walk to the East Tower is not bad, but it gets kind of old after the second day. The East Tower has larger and nicer pools, dining, and bars, so I would probably stay there in the future, although the West Tower was very quiet. Best part of the hotel is a 5 minute ride (actually less) from the airport. Also nice is that it is a great place for a morning jog around Harbor Island. Worst part is that the on-site restaurants are very expensive and you have to take a cab to go anywhere off the island (actually the city bus passes right in front of the hotel if you are really trying to get downtown cheap).

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: susanlNewJersey
Reviews.Content: After getting this hotel via a Priceline bid and reading the reviews..I was expecting to hate the property. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Originally assigned to the West Tower (told this by the shuttle driver)..I decided to ask for the east tower based on the comments here. I went to the SPQ desk at the east tower and was given Room 706 . It was on the smallish side..but clean with a great marina view. I felt the staff was professional and accomodating and would not hestiate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again..Definiteily Has Its Problems”
Reviews.Author: oclife
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and got a rate of $105/night..That is likely the only positive to my hotel experience at the Sheraton. The con's first -Location (Literally next to the airport..Noise, traffic, and there isn't anything to do in walking distance from the hotel, i.e. restaurants. Like the others before me said, it's a good $15 cab ride one way into 'town') -Parking ($20/day to park in a dirt lot. It wasn't very lit and our car was covered in dirt when we checked out. Also, the lot isn't covered. For $20/day I expected more) -Lack of Clealiness (Hotel wasn't clean..The carpet in the hallways was worn, dirt on the walls, dirty sheets with holes and the bathroom was the worst..There was a TON of black hair in the shower. The vents in the bathroom were coated in a heavy layer of dirt) -No free Wifi or internet in the rooms (They were charging $14 for a 24 hour period for the internet..Ridiculous) -Restaurants (Food wasn't great and was extremely expensive..$14 for eggs in the morning??!!) The pros: -Pool (Pool was nice and they served drinks poolside, located next to the harbor which was great) -Price (If you shop around, you can get a good rate I'm sure..We did on Priceline)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel099
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel last week and booked our room through the sandiego.org customer service line at a very reasonable rate of $129 per night. This rate was available only through sandiego.org phone line and not on their website. We loved the location, the room (West tower) and the pools. We thought that everyone was very friendly, helpful, and went out of their way to accommodate our requests. One of the employees told me that Sheraton was trying to change their image via a new training program for all employees and that one of their goals was to accommodate guests' needs, etc. My sister is a Starwood preferred member and had us upgraded to the Starwood floors (9th and above?). We really liked the West tower as it was less hectic than the East tower during check-in and in the evenings. The restaurants were good and no more expensive than other hotel restaurants. You can hear planes take off as you're next to the airport, but this did not interrupt our sleep, as planes stop flying after midnight or so. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and saw many other business travelers on a conference. I would not recommend this hotel for a family vacation spot. It is literally located 5 minutes from the aiport by shuttle, so you will hear the airplanes landing and taking off all day and night. If you stay here ask for a room with a pool and marina view if not you will be facing the main street with a parking lot view - not pretty at all! I would also ask for a renovated room - the pictures on their website are not like the room I stayed in. My room was very outdated, the rugs needed to be change - dirty and stained. The bedding felt old and the room had very bad lighting. This hotel needs a lesson on cleanliness. I found hair on my bedsheets and in the tub. Also, some type of bug was crawling in the bathroom - yuck! This hotel is also about a $12 cab ride to downtown San Diego where all the shops and eateries are.

Reviews.Title: “Most of the stay was good, however...”
Reviews.Author: NODAK1979
Reviews.Content: First off, if you book through Hotwire or Priceline, they'll try to put you in something called a "Lanai" room. From all I've heard, you'll want to avoid these rooms...so I called and pleasantly asked to be moved to the west tower....and I was accomodated. That was definitely pleasant. Not pleasant?? 20 bucks for parking. Any great deal you think you're getting because a little less great after that. Overall, the room was nice. The main issue was that I could hear people talking in an adjacent room until after midnight. Since the walls to adjoining rooms were concrete, I have to assume it was a person either above or below me...either way, it was distracting and limited my sleep. We STILL paid 110 bucks for this through Priceline...and if I would have had earplugs, it'd definitely be all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “4-star price for 2-star quality”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveller2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the West Tower during a 4-day meeting I attended in early June, 2007. Check-in was smooth. My room was spacious but dark. The only light switch controlled a single low-wattage bulb by the door. I had to stumble around in the dark to turn on individual lamps. There were black and brown stains on my sheets when I checked in. I requested that these be changed, and they were replaced with sheets that merely had brown stains and were torn and threadbare. In the bathroom, there had been a leak in the wall behind the toilet, and the wall was moldy with the wallpaper peeling off the wall. There had been no attempt to fix the wall. There was hair in the sink. My impression, based solely on walking through the lobby and attending my meeting, is that the East Tower (a completely separate building) is a much nicer, cleaner, and more updated building. (Note that I did not actually see any of the hotel rooms in the East Tower.) There are many more restaurants, bars, meeting rooms, and business facilities in the East Tower than the West Tower. If I had to attend a meeting at this hotel again, I would stay at the hotel only if I were not personally paying the bill and if I had a room in the East Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, More a 3 star hotel, would not rate a 4”
Reviews.Author: Travil1555
Reviews.Content: Overall it wasn't a bad stay. You are very close to the airport but you don't hear the planes. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Balcony was small but would fit two chairs, small table. Pool was okay, could have been nicer. Restaurant had good food but for the price you can find better. I would give this hotel a solid 3 stars. Definitely not a 4 star hotel. Would return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: CATravelMom2
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews, when I discovered that this was the hotel assigned to me by Priceline...I was scared! However, I was pleasantly surprised. Check in was smooth. Stayed in a room in the east tower adjacent property. The adjacent section seemed to be a little older then the main lobby building but definitly nicer looking then the outside of the east tower. Room was not extravegant but clean and modern looking. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Sunday brunch was amazing! I'd go back just for the brunch. Walked all around the hotel and the grounds are very nice. Tennis courts, two pools, work out room and a game room kept my kids busy. I actually wished we were staying more then one night so we could enjoy the facilities more. Hotel is right on the marina so you get to enjoy the boats and the water. Excellent location, easy to get to Zoo, Gaslamp district, ect. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: nhunixguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was troublesome from the beginning. Not everything that went wrong was their fault, but they couldn't make anything right. I went there with a colleague to attend a conference. This is a large property and we were put in rooms at opposite ends of the complex. A walk from one end to the other took 17 minutes, mostly outdoors. This wasn't a hardship because the weather was beautiful, but it made it tougher to meet up for breakfast or classes. The problem was that when we checked in, they couldn't find two rooms for us that were closer. The complex consists of several buildings. The East Tower is the most centrally located. There are Lanai rooms that are at one end, and then far away in the other direction is the West Tower. The rooms in the West Tower are bigger, away from everything else, and non-smoking. The conference center was closest to the East Tower. The rooms weren't particularly clean. My colleague's room had a nasty-looking stain on the bedspread. My room had a big stain on the carpet. The rooms that I saw didn't have safes or refrigerators but they did have coffee makers. There was noise from the nearby airport but I expected it to be worse than it was. The staff were uniformly friendly and smiling, but generally not helpful. As a second example, the person at the desk in the West Tower offered to make a dinner reservation for us at a restaurant in the Gaslamp district on a Friday night, but she told me that the restaurant was sold out. We drove down there anyway expecting to find another restaurant, but the restaurant that we wanted was happy to seat us right away. As with so many things, they might not have been responsible but it seemed like they had a hard time doing anything that was actually helpful. None of the doors which were supposed to automatically lock at night ever actually locked. Guests have an odd habit of defeating security measures and maybe that had something to do with it, but apparently the locks weren't working. In reality, we didn't suffer at the Sheraton. The food was good, the drinks and tapas at the bar were generous, and the staff was friendly. But there are so many nicer places to stay in the area that I'd pick someplace else unless there was a really good reason (for example, a conference on the property) to stay at this Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed, expected better from a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: enboston
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is only a short free shuttle from the airport and the bed is soft and nice, overall I was not too impressed with this hotel. At $250/night (conference discount rate not including tax), the accommodation was only so-so. My garden room was in the Lanai section of the East wing, a very long walk from the lobby; it faced a fence and with the door open you could hear the planes overhead. The door was supposed to be double locked but I could not find the 2nd lock. When I arrived, the problems in the bathroom made it seem like no one had been there for a while: a couple dead bugs on the floor, 2 vials of shampoo but no conditioner, a broken light, the bathroom fan sounded like a rusty helicopter, and low shower pressure-- lots of water came out the bath faucet instead of the through the shower head when the diverter was pulled. It also seemed they were trying to squeeze a dime out of their customers for everything. Examples of the extra charges, which many lower-rate hotels provide no charge or have much better value: - My electronic check-in sheet declared that I would be charged 75 cents for a copy of USA Today outside my door each morning-- and to refuse the paper I should notify the front desk. Despite this notice, I actually never got any papers or charges. - The wired internet charge from the room was high-- if I recall it was ~$8 for 30 minutes and $~14 for 24 hrs, yikes. - To use the exercise room/health club is $10 per day. - Breakfast items in the restaurant are at a high premium. - Bottled water in the room-- if you partake in it, charges you $4/bottle. My friend was staying in the east wing upper floors and she found her room was out of date and the amenities quite chintzy for a hotel that charges $275/night.

Reviews.Title: “I agree, not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: las2cun
Reviews.Content: We got the room for a decent enough rate through priceline, so I can't complain too much, but the 4 star properties we've had in San Diego in the past for a similar rate were so much nicer, that I felt compelled to leave this review. Like the previous poster, we too were given a room in the West tower. There's nothing else over there, and the East tower is a good drive away, so we never enjoyed any of the hotel amenities. That being said, you don't feel like you are anyplace special, because you basically have to go to another hotel to enjoy restaurants, bar, spa services, etc. What's the point of paying for them if you have to go somewhere else to enjoy them? The view was nice when we first checked into our room (harbor, Coronado bridge, a bit of the city) but we were moved around midnight thanks to a plumbing problem, and the new room looked out onto the marina and airport. Still decent, but not nearly as nice. The room was spacious and comfortable, decorated in a nautical theme, which was fitting, but the bathroom was tiny, the towels coarse, and the pillows old and lumpy (glad we brought our own). My beef with the hotel is this....while I appreciate that they moved us to another room after trying to repair the plumbing problem, I felt it would have been a nice touch for them to do more than continually turn our message light on at odd hours for us to call and let us know they were sorry. On both nights I was awakened by the blinking light, so I call only for them to say they were sorry. It was annoying to say the least and if you are going to keep calling, at least get it right and remove the charges for the internet (that we reserved in the first room) but were unable to use in the second room without me having to continually remind you. I feel the service feature of the call was poorly handled and was really more of a procedural annoyance than a measure to ensure my true satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Four stars? I don't think so”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: I was checked in on the West side building instead of the tower building. The lobby looks more like a 3 stars trying really hard to look nice. The ground floor king bed room that I was given looks old and tired. One of the lamp does not work and while the room is spacious, there are not enough furnitures to fill the room so it looks a bit empty. Asides from the amenities, it is not much better than the average Four Points. The Westin Horton Plaza is a better value and location.

Reviews.Title: “ok place”
Reviews.Author: irfr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for over a week here on business in February 2007. The hotel is split into two towers. Most of the activities are in the East and unfortunately I was in the West. There is only a short walk between them though. Hotel is very very close to the airport and as a result, I found it quite noisy because you could always hear airplanes taking off. Room was fine, a good size and was clean but looked like it could do with some renovation especially in the bathroom. Room service was good and the staff were generally very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed!”
Reviews.Author: queenobling
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight with a reservation for the north (remote) tower. Was not looking forward to shlepping our bags over there, etc but no problem. The very gracious desk clerk (lady from upstate NY) changed our room to the main tower. Awoke to a brilliant sunrise and view of downtown over the hotel parking lot. Room had a small balcony. The bed was extremely comfortable and big. Nice soft comforter and plush linens. When I phoned the front desk to advise the shower was only lukewarm, they reversed the parking charge. Enjoyed the upscale breakfast buffet - waited a few minutes on a Saturday a.m. for a window seat and felt we were dining at a yacht club. Impeccable service - a great start that left us fueld for most of the day - a v. good value. Conceriege was lovely with dinner recommendation and reservation. Valet had car up front with luggage loaded after breakfast, ready for us to take off to our destination. It's a great location - didn't have to hunt for it after arriving on a late flight - right across from the airport - and it was a good value at around $200 for the room. Paid a lot more for a lot less in other places. I'm definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “unless your company is paying, its a ripoff..”
Reviews.Author: nbell8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband (who was attending a trade show held at the hotel) for 4 nights. I read the reviews before going (tagging along for a cheap vacation to San Diego) so I had my expectations set low on what appeared to be a place that gouges for everything. I wasn't disappointed. We rented a car for 2 days so we could get around for 2 days on our own. If you stay at this hotel, you either need a car or get taxis if you want to get away from the hotel. We valeted the car for literally 1 hour when we checked in. Then we went back out for dinner and then self-parked the car overnight. When we got the hotel bill at the end, they of course were charging us $24/night for the entire stay (i.e. valet price for 4 nights). My husband on checkout told them we only had a rental car for 2 days and valeted the car for an hour and self-parked overnight. The 'resolution' to this apparently was to charge us ONLY for 2 nights of self parking. It was my husband's company paying the bill so I stayed out of it, but if my money was paying for this, I would have argued more at the front desk. That was the only mistake on the bill we had. The room we got on checkin had double sized beds and we requested king size bed and had to pay an extra $50/night for that. That bumped us up to the Club level room and gave us a city view which was nice. We got free contential breakfast and evening horderves and free internet for that $50 as well. The breakfast was nice (but they normally charge $12/head for it which again was nuts when no hot food was included). The horderves was also normally charged $12/head and again, was not worth the price. It was nice, but we got there one night during the last 45 minutes of it and hardley anything was left and they didn't refill anything. I rented a bike one day (which was $7/hour) and it was nice (a way to get some exercise and away from the hotel). The pool was outside and kind of chilly to go into so didn't get to try it out. I would never stay here if I was paying with my own money. They overcharge for everything and its obvious they know most people staying here don't care cause an expense account is probably paying the bill. The room we stayed in was clean and nice, but as other reviews have said, the walls are thin and we did hear noise often from the room next door to us. I once heard someone listening to their voicemail through the walls, which seems to be a sign of thin walls!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was helpful”
Reviews.Author: OHi0Traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nice hotel in a good location between the marina and San Diego Bay. The hotel should do a better job, however, in letting people know that this hotel is actually divided into two separate towers which are almost a mile away from each other. The room I stayed in was clean and well appointed. The bathroom was a bit dated, but otherwise it was a good room with a balcony overlooking the marina.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a five night stay at this hotel. I made the mistake of booking this hotel using one of those discount internet services. First and last time I'll do that again. I had put in a request for a 4-star accomodation thinking I would be given a reservation at either the Omni, Hyatt or Intercontinental hotel as shown in their example. But , no...it was the Sheraton Marina and Harbor instead. I was both surprised and disappointed. First of all, this property is NOT a 4-star accomodation, and this booking service should not be falsely advertising it as such. We arrived at almost 1am after a late flight. I had previously called the hotel to request a late arrival guarantee. Don't know if it was the late hour or the fact that I had booked through a discount broker, but the room we were given was on the ground floor. Not only did the noise of the airplanes from the nearby airport wake us up througout the night , but there was also heavy foot traffic outside our door in the busy hallway. One night , we had to listen to noisy teenagers out by the darkly lit pool area off our patio until midnight. Ditto on the self-parking situation. I think that $17 is ridiculous! (To valet park, it was $24 per day.) The lot was dirty, far away and very poorly lit. We were also double-charged by the hotel for the entire stay. Someone else with the same common last name must have gotten free parking! You had to give the lot attendant your room number along with your last name each time you left, so I'm not sure how the mistake kept getting made. Even as we left the lot for the last time, it happen again! Back to the front desk to clear it up. Lastly, the condition of the room was not that impressive. Certainly not 4-star standards. Ants in the bathroom and NEVER enough towels. Three out five nights I had to request (by note and phone) more towels and toiletries to the housekeeping staff. I reminded them that there were four in our party and not two. No newspaper on the first morning as well. San Diego and its weather was great however! The kids had a blast visiting all of the attractions. Also, note that there didn't seemed to be any reasonably priced restaurants on Harbor Island. A Von's grocery store was also a few miles away. Note there's no refrigerator or microwave in the room either. The location of the Sheraton worked for us, but the entire trip I felt deceived by the fact that I had basically stayed at a 3-star accomodation but thought I was paying for something much nicer. I guess in this situation the old adage, "you get what you pay for" holds true. Next time, I will book my hotel directly and not blindly through a discount hotel broker.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMBMAK
Reviews.Content: It's been about 10 years since I last stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel and Marina. The good news in the Starwood Brands are starting to merge and Sheratons are starting to feel more like Westons. As a Starwood gold member, I was upgraded. My bed was great and the room appeared to be recently refurbished. For the business traveler, it's hard to beat the convenience of the hotel - although getting anywhere requires the shuttle, a car or cab (and SD cabs are pricey - it's about $10 to the convention center). The staff at the hotel was great. Friendly and very helpful. I called the concierge about a rental car and the Enterprise bus was picking me up 5 minutes later! (another benefit of Enterprise is you can return the car at the hotel - just hand the keys to the front desk). For runners, especially those of us from land-locked locations, the scenery along the island and bay is great. The "north tower" is a bit isolated.

Reviews.Title: “View is to die for!”
Reviews.Author: robsocal
