We had gotten an excellent holiday discount on the net from the Sheraton, so we paid very little for such a nice room on the 10th floor. The Christmas decorations and music were lovely. The redecorated restaurant had a special Christmas menu. Someone who has a lot of money might expect a much fancier place. The hotel was perfect for two teachers, a teenager and a retired couple. We felt pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: juleswb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a vacation/conference Nov 4-10 and loved it. We had a room in the East tower overlooking the marina and city. The balcony was great. The hotel was clean and grounds and pool area were beautiful. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was close to a lot of San Diego attractions. The only downside was the airport noise...normally we didn't hear the planes during the night but a couple of times planes took off early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: punky21
Reviews.Content: I visited San Diego for a conference and the conference was held at this hotel. I didn't have a choice of hotel so I stayed. Some of my colleagues stayed at the "overflow" hotel, which was the Westin and that hotel outclassed the Sheraton in every sense of the word. The Westin is comparable in price and in the middle of downtown... a much better choice! The lobby of he Sheraton was constant mayhem for the five days I was there (Saturday through Wednesday). The service at the main restaurant was horrendous and a hostess was never to be found. The menu is the same in the other restaurants in the hotel and also the same for room service... so much for choices. PLUS... There are no mini-bars in any of the rooms! The concierge and front desk staff were very helpful, as were the business center staff. But the business center is not open very late. The hallways smell like a toilet when the staff is cleaning the rooms... although they are very friendly and accomodating. The location is what is also one of the worst aspects of this hotel. It is an airport hotel... if you are going on vacation, you DO NOT want to stay in the airport hotel. A cab to the gaslamp quarter or to Sea World is about $12-$15 (with tip) and to the border of Tijuana, a cab will cost about $40. The trolly is nowhere near this hotel so you would have to take a cab to a trolly stop to try to save money on getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Just another airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel Oct. 4-8. We booked through Hotwire and were given a complimentary upgrade upon check-in - we ended up on the 5th floor of the west tower with a view of the marina. The pros: friendly staff, comfy beds. The cons: a boring and nondescript property - if you just need a bed near the airport - this would be a fine choice. We did not have a car - my husband taxied back and forth to the convention center ($11-$13 each way) and I took the complimentary hotel shuttle back to the airport (a 3 minute ride) to catch the city bus ($2.25 fare) to downtown. Harbor Island is not a place you will find much to do - if you were to walk to the downtown area, it would be about 3 miles. Airplane noise was constant, but only heard by us when we had the balcony door open. The west tower was a short walk to the east tower - which is where the main lobby and restaurants were located (west tower had one expensive Italian restaurant). Overall, the west tower seemed to be the neglected step sister - the pool and grounds were nothing more than plain. If you do end up staying at this property, an independant deli exists between the towers, and you can pick up sandwiches, wine, pastry, coffee, etc.. for a fraction of the cost the hotel will charge you. Simply put, there was nothing special about this place, but nothing to complain about either, considering we payed $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: mkhailey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was the location of our convention. The bed wa comfy, but there was one problem after the next. Remote didn't work, Shrek 2 was corrupted and overlaid with porn (a negative?), the first minute of a local call cost $13.00, and the shower curtains are cheap. It's as if the hotel couldn't decide if it wanted to be high class with its 'service promise' or a budget hotel where all the added expense is nickled-and-dimed out of you: phone calls, parking, health club access, etc. The room had stained carpets and felt dingy. I'd choose not to stay here again, and I'll probably skip all Sheratons. One star performance: Chris, the bartender and server in the italian restaurant onsite, is great. I was shocked to find great food and service in this restaurant with the days of disappointment experienced at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty satisfied with the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: NYFamilyonVacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the West Tower, 11th floor. The view was lovely, the room was larger than expected and very clean. Wonderful linen, good supply of towels. Front desk and attendants were polite and helpful. Parking was not a problem. It is expensive at $16 a night, but that is what most downtown hotels charge. The downside is that it cost $25 to have a refridgerator and there was a shortage of them. There is some airplane noise between 7 a.m. and 11 p.m. Nicer amenities at the East Tower (pool, lobby, restaurants, etc.), but the walk did not bother us and the lobby did not matter much to us. Not much around the outside of the hotel except a deli open limited hours. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "Lanai Rooms" adjacent to East Tower”
Reviews.Author: ddffdd
Reviews.Content: We were given a "Hotwire Special" room: a dark, dank first floor room in the "lanai" area of the East tower. The room had a lovely view of a...wall..., was dark and dreary, and most importantly, had a bad mildew/mold odor. They could not/would not relocate us that night to a habitable room, so we were walked to a motel. They seemed to know right away what we were talking about with the mildew/mold complaint. Why are they assigning guests to rooms with that kind of problem? We came back the next day, and were given a better room and a food credit to use at the hotel. The main East tower pool was cold and did not appear to be heated. The room was adequate in size, but not spacious. This new room had no airport noise, and a nice view. The views from the upper stories are the best thing about this hotel, including its waterfront location. No in room safe, robes, minibar, newspaper, or other amenities common to that type of property. We had to laugh...the room cards STILL didn't work on the parking gate! Unless you can get a really good rate and guarantee a decent room, there are better values elsewhere. If you do encounter a problem, speak up immediately and insist it be corrected, or at least that you are offered something under their "service guarantee."

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Fabulous Destination”
Reviews.Author: SaremyTravels4Fun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We stayed five nights in mid August of 2004. The pools were great, the lobby beautiful, and the restaurants delicious. The room was pretty standard, however it was nice to have down pillows and a real comforter, not just a bedspread. The staff was awesome! Although, there were a couple problems.. forgotten hairdryer in the room, no newspaper, and one night the neighbor's alarm went off for about two hours. The good news: Sheraton was more than apologetic.. they gave us $50 off our bill and two free lunch vouchers (a $20 value). This treatment was a nice surprise and much better than just a "sorry". We'll definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton San Diego--A Split Personality”
Reviews.Author: PSUDanO
Reviews.Content: From 25-28 July my family and I stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Hotel And Marina. While our stay was comfortable, the fact is that this property has a split personality; the East Tower has the lion’s share of facilities/amenities while the West Tower (where we stayed) is the poor neighbor. The West Tower of this property does not match it's sister tower. The hotel’s two towers separated by over 400 yards (a 5-10 minute walk); while I have experienced similar “sister” properties, this is my first experience with a hotel that has such disparate distance AND quality levels between segments of its property. The West Tower’s facilities included a 3-meal restaurant, pool/spa, and gift shop. It lacked the following amenities offered in the East Tower: 1. Concierge service 2. Casual Restaurant/Tavern 3. Lobby Bar 4. Fitness Facility 5. Comprehensive Business Center 6. Pool Restaurant The West Tower just exuded an aura of neglect—the building exterior is in need of refinishing, and the hallways, especially adjacent to meeting spaces, had a musty odor. The pool area was neglected for much of the day—in several instances, the pool towel supply was exhausted and repeated calls for replenishment for not heeded. The sole bright spot was that the rooms in this tower are comfortable, nicely furnished, and larger than those in the East Tower. There was no mini-bar (West Tower mini-bars had been discontinued), no bathrobe, and no comprehensive Business Center in the West Tower. One (1) of our two (2) phones was not functioning, and building maintenance had to be called to fix it. The second morning of our stay we discovered that our in-room coffee supply had not been replenished. Finally, our room had no phone books. All of these oversights were corrected in a timely fashion, but they added to the effect that you were staying on the “wrong side of the street.”

Reviews.Title: “Not one of the better hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: HERAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for two nights (3 rooms) and we all agreed that other than the main lobby, this hotel is in need of some serious work. The buildings are old and run down. Stained carpets, peeling wallpaper, squeaky elevators, and sporadic hot water. To add to that, the staff was not friendly at all and slow to respond. My brother's room had no towels or coffee maker when he checked in and it took most of the first day to get these items. He had to find a housekeeper's cart to get his own towels. They also overcharge for what they do offer. $10 per day if you want to use their fitness room, $16 for parking, $4 for a bottle of water, etc. I stayed at the Omni in San Diego the week prior and found it to be a much better value. Also, the hotel is not located near any trolley line or public transportation which is an ideal way to get around downtown San Diego. Their shuttle runs from the airport to the hotel, which is only a block away. This is one Sheraton that is in need of a major renovation, including the attitude of its staff. You can do better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property is now my first choice in San Diego. I just returned from a two-night stay at the Sheraton Shelter Island (East Tower) and I couldn't be happier. From the minute the smiling Samantha checked us in at the front desk, I knew my experience was going to be good. The room was more than adequate, the view spectacular, the staff uniformly charming and accomodating. I used the concierge to book dinner at Red Tracton's in Del Mar. I used guest services to purchase passes for the zoo. I used the safe deposit box in the lobby. My every contact with the staff was met with professional, friendly and gracious service. I travel frequently for pleasure and I've stayed at some of the most highly regarded resorts in this hemisphere. This hotel property well deserves the four-star rating. The professionalism of the staff would actually put it in the five-star category, at least for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having read all of the negative reviews of this hotel before our trip, I felt compelled to share my opinion. My family of four just completed a 10 day California coast vacation which ended with two nights in the West Tower, 7/28 and 7/29. We loved it. We had a room on the 10th floor overlooking the marina and the airport. Terrific view. Personally, I love to watch the planes take off. But, since there was very little airplane activity between 11:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m., we were able to sleep with the balcony door open and let the cool, fresh San Diego air into the room. The noise was not a problem. We did not use the West Tower pool, but the kids loved the pool at the East Tower with its volley ball net and basketball hoop. Yes, it's a 5 minute walk from one tower to the next, but it's along a beautiful marina. What's not to like about that? A lot of reviewers have complained about the parking situation. Well, our room key did not work in the parking lot the first night, but the attendant was very helpful and let us out without a problem. I got another key from the front desk the next morning and it worked fine. I saw it as a very minor inconvenience. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants. With all of the great restaurants in San Diego, why would you want to? Take the short drive to Seaport Village, the Gaslamp Quarter, or Old Town. We did have breakfast at the deli along the marina one morning and it was fine. We are looking forward to our next visit to San Diego and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad hotel, very bad location...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a terrible, noisey, and unfriendly stay here. We booked through an online travel site and got a decent rate of about $110/night. Because we booked through the internet discount site, the hotel was very rude to us, treating us like second class citizens. They actually said if we wanted a decent room (and not the one on the first floor facing the parking lot) that we should re-book our reservation through the hotel. (even though they knew we had pre-paid online which wasn't refundable) The air-conditioning turns off every few minutes and you must get up to turn it back on, all NIGHT!! When we complained, the front desk was extremely unapologetic and truly didn't even PRETEND to care. We heard many other guests complaining and some checked out early as we arrived. We are frequent travelers and have never been treated so badly. There is also tons of airplane noise as it is directly across from the airport and there is NOTHING within walking distance. You must park your car in their lot which will cost you $16/day for self-park, $22 for valet. My other complaint was that concierge recommended bad restaurants to us. In fact, we showed up at one and left as it was a total tourist trap. That really annoyed me. We informed them we were food lovers (we live in NYC and are used to great restaurants--not fancy necessarily---just great food) and we were sent to overpriced, bland places filled with travelers. Everything about our stay was very disappointing. There are much better hotels for the price. I suggest going to stay in a better area where you can walk around and not be constantly alarmed by the planes flying constantly overhead. Stay somewhere where you will be valued and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute WORST hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: dananyc
Reviews.Content: Jeez! I don't know where to begin. Long story short. Hubby and I booked thru Hotwire and paid $103/nt for 3 nt stay. We were treated like peasants for booking with Hotwire and were told we would be getting the only room available, on the first floor overlooking the parking lot. I told rude front desk girl (Anna) that I had checked w/their website that morning and saw tons of availability and that it was our anniversary and we wanted a room overlooking the water. She said no and argued with me for FIFTEEN MINUTES until she finally "unblocked" a room with a view on the 7th floor for and extra $20/nt. (Nice welcome, huh?) FINE! The room was gross. A filthy carpet, and very digustingly stained bedspread. The room was SMALL (and I live in NYC where our standards in the space dept. are seriously below the nat'l average) and the air conditioning would turn off after literally 2 minutes and NEVER go back on unless you got up and pressed the button. Not fun in the middle of the night. When we complained after a sleepless night, they offered no apology and said they'd send an engineer up to fix it. When he arrived, he told us this was how the hotel saves money and that people were constantly annoyed about it. The list goes on and on. The staff TRULY doesn't care, they are completely miserable and apathetic. Don't stay here. There are so many good hotels. I suggest getting away from the airport area in general and staying in a place where you can walk around. The airport noise was definitely annoying as was the $16/day parking fee and the entire experience. I wouldn't send my worst enemy to this disgraceful, no-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay 6/22-6/27”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was smallish but comfortable in the East Tower. The view was excellent. We watched a Naval aircraft carrier on maneuvers our last day there. The balcony just fit the two chairs and small table. The room was clean and suited our needs. The upside to this hotel was the excellent service, the pool, the view, and the comfortable bed. The only downside to our stay was lack of hot water and water pressure during peak times. It wasn't cold, just luke warm. And the food is okay but you could do better elsewhere. Parking is expensive. $16 for self park, $22 for valet. I would recommend bringing your cell phone or using the lobby pay phones if you don't upgrade. $2 charge for local and 800 number (that's each call). Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great West Tower location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two nights at the Sheraton Hotel and Marina. When I was told my room was in the West tower, I was a bit concerned after reading the reviews here. However, I couldn't have been more pleased. My room was on the corner of the top floor (12th). It had floor to ceiling windows on two walls with a huge (larger than the room) rooftop patio which I entered through a french door. The patio had two sun lounge chairs, a glass top patio table with four chairs, two additional chairs with a small table, and a potted palm tree. The patio overlooked the wedding garden, pool, marina with boats on the right and across the water to the left was the military helicopter pads and ships. Across the water I saw a fireworks show one evening. The patio area was perfect for enjoying breakfast and the wonderful San Diego weather. When inside the room I didn't hear any airport noise. Rarely outside did I hear airplanes. The interior of the room had plush down comforters and pillows on both beds with soft sheets. The bathroom was large with marble floors, walls, and glass enclosed Jacuzzi tub and shower. The bathroom also had real plants. The sink counter area was large. I heard no noise from any other rooms, never even heard or saw another guest on my floor, though I know there must have been some, since housekeeping was cleaning rooms besides mine. The only negative things I noticed were stains on the carpet, the ice machine on my floor was broken, and I had no remote for the television. These were minor details easily overlooked with the many benefits of this room. I looked forward to returning to this room at the end of each day, and would love to return to this room on another trip!

Reviews.Title: “lots of airport noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lots and lots of airport noise, 3 star property not 4 start as they advertize. Some of the staff are nice some so so...

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: PasadenaRose7
Reviews.Content: I was there for one night only, on May 15, 2004. I was in San Diego for a wedding, and was not interested in the resort aspects of the hotel. I travel a lot, both on business and pleasure, and found the room, which was in the much criticized west tower, to be well above average. The room was spotless. There was a pillowtop bed with all cotton sheets, which gave me an excellent night's sleep. The bathroom was large and first rate. It had a magnifying mirror at eye level, which was great for putting on makeup; a real blow dryer (not one of those anemic wall types); and a shower that appeared to be tall enough for men over six feet tall, with strong water pressure. The staff was very accomodating, allowing me to check in early and also accompanying me to my room when the first key card that I received did not work properly. The room also seemed to be sound proof; I did not hear any planes from the nearby airport, and also did not hear any noise from the elevator and exterior door that were very close to my room. They do charge too much for the parking ($16) and phone calls ($2 even for local calls and calling card calls). Otherwise, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Cruiserfish
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, fantastic view from balcony. The bad thing was the terrible parking situation. Otherwise, fine.

Reviews.Title: “A motel with a view”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirl06
Reviews.Content: Beware the "west tower" if you're unlucky enough to be booked at this hotel. This Sheraton is basically a high rise motel with a good view (from some rooms). The scoop is there is the main building and a separate "tower" -- which is essentially another hotel taken over by Sheraton several years ago. The condition of the west tower is poor and the room decor and amenities poorer than poor. My room was so dirty I had to wipe obvious foreign matter off the walls with a wet towel. When I objected at check in to being placed in this Siberia, I was given the brush off and told the West tower was "better" because it used to be a Westin -- huh -- maybe during the Carter administration? Also, if you're attending a convention beware the check out -- there's a shuttle bus but it fills up quickly, leaving people with flights to catch walking the mile to the airport. Finally, if you're not into $20.00 breakfasts, you have the choice of a grim little deli nearby. Nothing, I repeat nothing, is within walking distance of either Sheraton tower.

Reviews.Title: “The West Tower is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at this hotel (Room 795, April 22-26, 2004) and had a nice time overall in San Diego. We bought a "vacation package" from Hotwire that included this hotel and airplane tickets from San Jose, CA.The staff was all helpful and pleasant (except for one instance described below). The main complaint I have is that I was expecting a 4 star hotel and what I experienced was a 2.5 star facility. We were given a room in the "West Tower". This seems to be the older and more run down half with these deficiencies:1) the single small swimming pool at this tower was not heated and too cold to swim in 2) the room did not have a fridge (had to pay $16 to have one brought in to our room)3) the hotel does not have a VCR even to rent4) our "upgraded" room ($20/night extra) showed signs of age and had elevator noise5) the tub was clogged the first day (they fixed it and gave us a pancake breakfast)6) bathroom light bulbs were burned out our whole stay7) the parking (extra ~$16/day) had a gate entry that never recognized our key and the exit was often delayed with a line of cars8) the elevator closest to our room was very run down, scratched, dingy, but functionalAs a final complaint: We went to the "East Tower" to go swimming since they had a nice large heated pool unlike the "motel" pool at the "West Tower". When we finished swimming, we could not find a bathroom or dressing room of any type to change in. When we asked the fitness center attendant where we could change she treated us like we were'nt even guests. She asked what room we were staying in (what does that matter?) and when I told her we were in the West Tower room 795 she said we would have to pay a fee to use the fitness center dressing room. I told her that was ridiculous and she suggested that we walk through the adjacent restaurant and into a single bathroom and change there.... we were treated like second class citizens. When reading the Sheraton hotel description you sure don't get the glaring distinction between the towers.Again, my complaint is that I was sold a "4 star" hotel and what I got was much lower than that standard.Al Tadros

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel -- Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TravHopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days. Yes, it is very close to the airport. So if you are arriving late, you will be in a comfy bed in no time. I did not consider the airport noise to be a bother at all, and there were no flights after 10pm anyway. We stayed in the West Tower. The rooms were huge and very nicely appointed king rooms. The views from the balcony are great from any side of the hotel you are on. The East Tower does have a different configuration, but has the nicer pool, fitness facilities and restaurants. There is a short walk along the marina between the two towers. They also have a shuttle to take you if would rather. Airport shuttles run every less-than-15 minutes. You are about 2-3 miles from downtown San Diego and the cruise pier. A cab would run you about $7. They have a great bike/jogging trail around the island and to the city. We rented bikes from the hotel in the morning and biked the 15-20 min ride into downtown San Diego and had nice breakfast. The staff at the Sheraton West Tower was very awesome and really knew how to take care of things very well. The only bad thing I would say about the hotel is that there is no cafe in the West Tower, the pool was freezing and the housekeeping staff needs more training. They often forgot to finish the job before moving on to the next room. We would and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the complaints here about the San Diego Sheraton Marina Hotel I must admit I was a little nervous, having booked there thru Hotwire. My family and I arrived on April 8, 2004 for a six night stay and right away we knew this was going to be a great vacation. We pulled up to the East tower where we were told by the valet that our reservations were at the West tower, a block down the road. We were offered a room upgrade for $20 a day to the 11th floor (which we accepted) with a wonderful view of the marina and the surrounding San Diego area. Everyone at this hotel bent over backwards to see that your stay was exceptional. Our room looked across the Marina at the aiport, which though busy was not a distraction nor did it interfere with our sleeping. The room was clean and comfortable and again the service was exceptional. They do nickel dime you a bit especially with the parking fees but hey, everthing is more expensive in California. Overall we would not hesitate to stay at this Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Isolated, Too Noisy, Bad Parking, Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, two kids (ages 7 and 3), and I stayed in the East Tower from April 6-9. We upgraded to the 15th floor Club Level (the highest floor on which their are lodging rooms), free self-parking (normally $16 per night), and free continental breakfast (normally $11.95 per person). The hotel is on a man-made island adjacent to the airport. With the exception of a walking trail around the marina, the hotel is not walking distance to anything. The room itself was fairly small (approximately 10 feet wide and 20 feet long (including the bathroom)), furnishing nicely and in good condition (except for some mold on the ceiling above the shower/tub). It had a sliding door leading to a small balcony with a view of a good portion of the marina, and further away, downtown San Diego. We checked in at night and the view of the city lights was very nice. However, within a matter of minutes we were assaulted by the noise of airplanes taking off, seemingly directly over our room. The airplane noise decreased after 10 p.m. but during the night the air conditioning system made a loud metallic kicking noise when it turned on. The aiplanes returned at about 5 a.m. We could also hear a lot of motorcycle and other fast moving vehicle traffic from the street below. On our last night, we heard a child crying all night in the room next to ours. The self-parking is limited to those spaces farthest from the hotel; the spaces that are near the hotel are reserved for valet parking. The first night I had to hunt for about 10 minutes to find a parking space, and it was about 250 yards from the lobby. I found slightly closer parking spots for our second and third nights but they were still unacceptably far away. The continental breakfast is a buffet on the Penthouse level. Each day the selection was the same: nice pastries, bread for toasting, dry cereal in individual boxes, Yoplait yogurts, and fruit salad (watermelon, honeydew melon, cantaloupe, strawberries, pineapple, and a few blue berries). To drink, there is coffee, tea, milk and orange juice. There are about 10-12 tables, all of which have table clothes and a view of the marina. There were usually two waitresses, but their job is to clean up and keep the buffet stocked; they do not serve food. There are much better places to stay in San Diego. I have stayed in many hotels in San Diego, including the Sheraton's West Tower twice (it is better than the East Tower), and the Sheraton Suites (nice rooms but weird lobby and inconvenient loaction). If you want to be near the airport, in addition to the two Sheraton properties, there is also a Hilton (I have not stayed there). The convention center is not very far from the airport and there are many hotels near it. If you want to be able to walk to the beach, you need to choose a hotel in a different area of town. If you want to go to Sea World or the Zoo, there are also better places to stay. In sum, there really is no reason to stay at this Sheraton, it is noisy, the parking is bad, and it is not near anything other than the airport.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Diego Resort from March 19-March 24 and were thrilled with our choice!!! We had booked at Sheraton.com and had a great rate! We were on vacation for the week and stayed on the 11th floor in the west tower. We coudn't have been happier with the view of the naval habor with the carriers and other boats going by. The staff was friendly, courteous and we never had a problem with parking, the taking of the ticket was quick and easy. Being located on Habor Island Drive was an easy access to everything we wanted to do, although if staying here a car is a must. We had a great deal with a convertible for 12 days with Budget with unlimited miles for $250!The rooms were large, spacious, well cleaned while we were there and the front desk employees were friendly and helpful. When we arrived we did go check out the east tower, which I thought had a nice lobby and outside area. We never had time to go to any of the pools although they looked very nice.When going back we will stay at this hotel again!
